description:
Other reviews describe the delicious fresh offerings: excellent, bright flavors, nice wine list, etc. 

I also loved the relaxed pace of the meal. We met old friends, and we ate and drank and talked for about 2 1/2 hours without feeling rushed (on the one hand) or feeling like the food was taking too long (on the other!) Don't worry, the tip reflected our long stay :-) ). 

We took our time, and the wait staff really read our table right. A single diner sat down next to us after a while, ate, and left, so it wasn't slow service, it was just-right-for-us service, and I really appreciated that.

My salad was nice, my pasta with chantarelles and peas was lovely, and the Tarte Tatin was *phenomenal* (and rich--get one to share). 

PS We sat in back, and it felt like garden dining without the cold breeze.
author: M. C.

description:
Made a reservation on a Saturday night for my Grandpa's birthday celebration. Not too busy on a Saturday at 7pm. We were able to find parking right in front and we also got seated right away. The restaurant is casual but feel free to dress up a little if you're on a date. The restaurant has a darker lighting in the room at the front. So it feels like a candle lit dinner! Very cute! 

My group of 5 was led into the room in the back. It was much brighter because they had a tree that had lights wrapped around it. Also very cute! 

I believe the menu changes every so often. When I dine with my grandparents, we usually share so we shared all the dishes that we ordered. 

Special menu: Foie Gras on a bed of risotto (5/5) - 5 of us shared the whole dish and we pretty much licked the plate once we finished. The foie gras was seared and just enough for the 5 of us to share. It was also very rich in flavor, I would recommend this! 
Tempura Fried Calamari - (4/5) The red curry aioli was a great compliment to the calamari but I didn't realize it was curry until I re-read the menu! The asian slaw was really tasty, sweet and savory sauce in the slaw. Compliments the calamari! 
Grilled Ahi Tuna (4/5) - I really enjoyed this dish. I normally don't like Ahi Tuna but surprisingly I thought it was very good! I did think the mashed potatoes in this dish didn't complement it. The two separately were good but together is sort of weird. 
Grilled Flat Iron Steak (2/5) - It wasn't the best steak and I probably wouldn't ever get it again. This cut of meat is definitely not my favorite but the execution was good. We all definitely enjoyed the shoe string fries and even dipped it in the bearnaise. 
Tagliatelle Bolognese (5/5) - MUST GET. Fresh pasta ALERT! I love fresh pasta and they did really well with this dish. The meat sauce was perfect and lots of great flavor. The amount of sauce and pasta was just enough.
Burrata Cracker Crust Pizza (3/5) - Execution, I think was great. It's really a crispy pizza with cheese but I wouldn't get it again. It's too dry and I wish the Burrata just wasn't as good as I expected. 
Creme Brulee (5/5) - Super rich and creamy! This was not too sweet! My family loved it. 
Chocolate Lava Cake (5/5) - Surprisingly my grandparents loved this too! The chocolate was a dark chocolate and it wasn't too sweet which we love! 

Overall, it was a great experience! We loved most of the dishes and I can't wait to bring my boyfriend here!
author: Joey C.

description:
Food: 4-5
Service: 5
Ambiance: 4

I came here for dinner one night on an empty stomach and left with a very happy, full belly. There's a bar in front, but for dinner, I suggest sitting in the back room where there is a skylight. Now onto the food:

It's no wonder they received a Michelin Bib Gourmand award. I must say, however, that this place is more Italian than French.

Delicious, soft, complimentary bread w/ olive oil

Appetizers you must get: 
House Cured Salmon, Dill Creme Fraiche & Potato Galette
Heirloom Tomato Salad

Entrees:
We both tried the Tagliatelle with Beef (tomato-based sauce). It'a not listed on the menu online, so it must be a new experimental dish. 

There are 2 unisex, single-stall bathrooms. No sink or mirror within either BR. The sinks & mirror are communal, FYI.
author: Cece Y.

description:
If I lived in the Marina, you would probably see me eating here a couple of times a week. The food here is just fantastic:

(1). The grilled octopus was sooo tender and is really one of the best octopus preparations I've had. 
(2).  The cavatelli with beef bolognese was a hearty pasta dish and was absolutely delicious. I asked the server for something filling and this definitely delivered. 
(3).  I saved room for dessert and this buttermilk panna cotta hit the spot. 

Since it was Friday, I had a beer to go with the above meal - just the best way to start the weekend. This place gets very busy and service can sometimes slow down a bit. With tax and tip, this meal was about $70 - about average for a nice dinner. Definitely see how this place made it to the Bib Gourmand list. Highly recommended!!!
author: Andrew S.

description:
(4.5 stars) Thanks Bib Gourmand for another great recommendation. Stopped in here after a long walk through the the wharf and marina areas, and so glad I did. It's got a really jazzy yet calming ambiance--which feels very different from the rest of the marina area--and some awesome food. 

The tagliatelle pasta with duck au vin and mushrooms had my name written all over it. Not just beautifully plated but pretty darn wonderful. The pasta was the real star of the dish, perfectly aldente and made in house. Seriously every bite of it, especially in the (mushroom?) broth below, was exhilaratingly tasty. It was actually so good that it pretty much drowned out the duck, which was well-cooked but the au vin flavor got a little lost when eaten with the pasta. That said, you surely won't be disappointed by it.
author: Jason S.

description:
Leisurely late dinner in quaint setting.
Delicious food and wine pairings!
Grilled octopus great.
Seared lamb with Parmesan potato gratin a winner!
My halibut was very fresh.
Dessert of the day - cherry tart - light and with fresh cherries with a crispy outside heavenly.

Highly recommended!
author: Christine L.

description:
Have you ever stepped into a  restaurant or bar and it felt like a  comfortable pair of your favorite jeans...or a warm  cashmere sweater??....Well Bistro Aix feels just like that.

Bistro Aix is a cozy restaurant and wine bar that serves refined comfort food. The front dining room is dark and earthy with lovely artwork. It is smallish but not cramped.  There is also a back patio for events or dining and it is lovely back there as well.

I would have never found this place if it were not for my friend Michele's reservation for a birthday celebration. I can see why she dines here probably once a week and you should definitely check them out! 

The appetizers we had were all excellent: from the cracker thin pizza, tempura artichokes, and Spanish octopus  all were well portioned and well executed.  I especially liked the smokiness of the octopus....

All four of us had salads and while mine was fine I was so jelly of the Little Gem salad others had ordered...it's good get it.

The entrees are all pretty reasonably priced, well portioned and delicious. The four of us had the Petrale sole, Sonoma chicken or the Ahi Tuna dishes. I tried each and they were all very good.

My Ahi Tuna was a nice portion of fish served with lovely whipped potatoes, a lovely gastric, and really yummy greens.

Desserts were solid as well: Great sorbets ( loved the macaroons), decadent Tart Tartin, and a uniuqe dish (that the birfday Girl received) named "Chocolate in a cloud"

Nice selection of wines by the glass or bottle.

We will definitely be back
author: David G.

description:
I made a reservation here on a Saturday night at 8pm. When we walked into the restaurant, there was no host or any staff available to help us. We stood around for 15 minutes, along with other groups of people, not knowing what to do. I tried to get a server's attention and she cut me off, saying that we need to wait for the host. 

Finally we got seated in the back patio next to the beautiful tree. I was a little sad that this place does not serve any cocktails - only beer & wine. The server also informed us that they were all out of tagliatelle and steak. Boooooo...that was literally what we were planning to order but okay, shit happens. We decided to order the tomato cracker crust pizza as an appetizer and the squid ink spagetti & pork chop as our entrees. 

The tomato cracker crust pizza came out in a timely manner and IT WAS DELICIOUS. While waiting for our entrees, I asked for bread since I saw other tables eating it and they were all out of bread! At this point I'm annoyed because why are you all out of your food on a Saturday night? Poor planning on their part. We waited for around 40 min and still didn't receive our food. We were literally about to just walk out of the restaurant when they finally brought the entrees to our table 1 hour later. Totally unacceptable and we had to bring it up with our server. We finally received an apology for SOMETHING and he gave us 2 complimentary glasses of wine. Fine effort to make up for everything that went wrong. Squid ink pasta was super dry and tasteless. Pork chop was good. 

I don't think I would choose to come back, given all the other choices of restaurants there are in the area.
author: Joyce Z.

description:
I really enjoyed my salmon with mushroom risotto. The salmon was cooked about medium well and flaked off while the risotto wasn't overly creamy. 

The fried calamari was yummy too. Not overly crunchy and the semi-"spicy" aoli sauce wasn't too strong. 

I would definitely come back. I am deducting a star because the hostess asked us a few times how our meal was going or would come and refill our waters with the bottle on our table, I don't think she caught on we were in the middle of a deep conversation.
author: Jess W.

description: Amazing food and service!  I made reservations for our 22nd wedding anniversary and Ryan greeted us like we've known each other for years.  Very welcoming and friendly staff!  We started off with the Foi Gras on a bed of risotto and pears.  Soooo good!  Our main dishes were Squid Ink Spaghetti which tasted fresh and clean, and Grilled Lamb which was perfectly seasoned.  Cant wait to go back before #23!!
author: Giz N.

description:
This place is a hidden gem. My gf told me about this place and I decided to throw my cousin a surprise bday party. The service was excellent and so was the manager in helping me plan and making sure everything went smoothly. He let me decorate and made sure I had everything i needed. Our waitress was just as amazing. She gave good tips on the food, and everything came out in a good timely manner, she cut the cake for us, and we never felt rushed. It was the perfect surprise!

The food is just as amazing. Simple food with great flavors. The corn soup is to die for and I got salmon with risotto. (The salmon was caught that morning. Super fresh!) Other good eats: tuna tartar, the duck, the octopus, the shishito peppers were unique (it's sweet and salty. It had caramel sauce, which sounds weird, but it was perfect) Also their chicken is great too. Crispy skin and moist and can't go wrong with the steak. 

Such a cute spot!
author: Karen H.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE Bistro Aix! I've been here several times with my boyfriend and it's always been amazing. The back room feels intimate with a beautiful tree and string lights, and the servers are always very welcoming and helpful. There are a lot of gluten-free options for my celiac boyfriend. The menu has a great variety of meat, fish, pasta, vegetarian, and pizza options, and lots of good appetizers to share. This restaurant feels so fancy but is very reasonably priced. It's become one of my favorite spots in the city!
author: Lindsey G.

description:
Went out last night with the wife. Started at the bar and cocktails were superb, service better and live music at Bar X was an excellent touch.
Next dinner. Cheese platter to start...nice French cheeses assorted condiments. I had Steak Au Poive and the wife had the duck and both were cooked perfectly. Even the peas that I don't like were outstanding. Dessert was a creme brûlée with a Macaroon and was amazing 

Definitely a restaurant on our favs list
author: Ant R.

description:
I swear, this place hits the spot everytime! Whenever I'm craving some great eats with a casual environment, I think of Bistro Aix. Last night, another stellar experience was had and I can't wait to go back.  

My buddy and I arrived around 9pm (they close at 10pm on Monday) and the bartender was happy to accommodate. Post water and awesome bread being presented, I ordered a bottle of 2015 Gevrey Chambertin off the extensive and well thought out bottle list and it was delicious! For the food, we both started with the seasonal corn soup. It had a light broth and was loaded with fresh corn, tomatoes and peppers...delicious. We also decided to split the tomato flatbread, the roasted chicken and tagliatelle bolognese. I've probably already written this before but, I think this is my favorite piece of chicken in the city. The skin is super crispy and the breast is always moist (I hate that word btw). Order all of these things and you won't be disappointed!

Thanks Bistro Aix for always being a reliable friend. :)
author: Benjamin F.

description:
Customer Service: 4.8/5
Food: 4.5/5
Atmosphere: 5/5
Cleanliness: 4.8/5

When walking down Steiner St. Bistro Aix can be challenging to find, but this is not a place you'll want to miss! For being rated a Bib Gourmand in 2018, the quality of the food and service lives up to the expectation. We ordered the grilled top sirloin steak, the house-ground hamburger* and the cracker crust pizza. The wait time was reasonable, and our waitress was very kind answering all of our questions and making food substitutions. Note that they serve housemade baguette and focaccia bread with olive oil on request. Bistro Aix is a great place for a youthful and fun date, but isn't necessarily a place to go for a quick bite. Ask for a table in the back -- which features a glass ceiling and open lively atmosphere!

*Hamburger was pretty messy
author: Matt I.

description: Best foie gras I've ever had! It was a special that night. Also had the tagliatelle bolognese, octopus and panna cotta. All were very solid. One of the best meals I've had in a while where every plate was good.  The restaurant itself was adorable! Had an atmosphere of "high class" casualness so great service in a relaxed nicely appointed and decorated venue.
author: May F.

description: We had an excellent meal, complementary wine from a great list, and superb, friendly service. I especially appreciate the waitstaff who helped me rescue a blouse after I dripped olive oil on the sleeve. One of the waiters brought me baking powder, which I used to absorb the oil. Then I followed the direction to put a drop of dishwashing liquid on the spot when I got home. After I laundered the blouse, the spot had disappeared! We loved the food, the friendly vibe, good service, and the extra special cleaning tip!
author: Kathleen K.

description: Sorry we have not been to this gem more often. Food is great, as is the wine list! We love eating at the bar and people watching.
author: Brad S.

description: I've been a fan of this place and its staff and food for two decades. It's friendly, affordable, delicious, and one that keeps me coming back time and time again. When it's owned by a great chef and person who cares about his product, it can't go wrong. Always a must when I visit SF.
author: Drea H.

description: Came here for a birthday dinner! Service and found amazing. Tried an assortment of appetizers and the salmon for entree and sorbet trio for dessert. Had two glasses of cab sav. Overall great experience. Excellent food. Would def come back.
author: Linda H.

description:
Had high hopes for this place given most of the reviews were great. Unfortunately, they ran out of the tagliatelle pasta, which was fine I ordered something else. But then 15 minutes later they came back to the table saying they ran out of steak (which the 2 other diners I was with ordered). When they brought out the "halibut" that my sister substituted her order with, they said "here is the SOLE". I am guessing they ran out of halibut and substituted it with sole instead and it was not very tasty. Another waitor asked to "borrow" our salt and never brought it back instead of just going to grab another one somewhere else. Overall, the wait staff seemed overwhelmed and flustered. 

On a positive note, we enjoyed the fried artichokes, the simple pasta I substituted for, and the burger was tasty. So most of the food was good. They also gave us a free round of drinks and dessert since they didn't have anything we ordered which was a nice touch. Unfortunately, the whole experience just was off and I don't think I'll be back.
author: Laura A.

description:
My neighborhood Bistro. Delicious French flair with California fresh ingredients at reasonable prices. Great wines by the glass or bottle & bread made in house.  I eat here every weekend I'm in town. My husband eats here every night I'm out of town. 

Tonight we were there for dinner & heard it was their official 22nd anniversary. Cheers to Bistro Aix!
author: Candy S.

description:
I have been here several times. I sat at the bar both times. Bar tender was super helpful with wine and food selections.
My son loved the special desert which was peach pie. This has become our favorite restaurant stop each time we visit San Francisco.
Good food, wine and service with no pretentious.
author: Ben B.

description: Great neighborhood spot. Always delivers! They have great pasta and a nice wine bar in front. You will see an older and younger crowd and sometimes kids on a Friday night. They have a cute back open area where it's fun to host larger parties ...they squeezed me in last min for a party of 10 and everyone had a nice time.
author: Lady N.

description:
Most of the food was good but some things were not so awesome.  My wife sent the risotto back - not totally done, my scallops had blacken char marks that totally ruined the delicate flavors of a fresh scallop dish.   The grilled octopus was very good, the calamari could of been better.  The peach pie was also okay.  The pork chop dish was excellent according to our friend.

I will be back, but make sure the waiter knows I do not like char on any of our food.  The wait staff was very friendly and helpful.
author: Mike R.

description:
Wow, this place is a hidden gem! Every time I come here I think the food is amazing, and wonder why I
haven't been back sooner! I had the ahi tuna, done perfectly, my date had the halibut, both delicious! And the octopus appetizer was one of the best I have had. So yummy, great dinner/date spot!
author: Andrea M.

description: Great service intersects with wonderful food. A gem that you have to try. Every community wishes they had a Bistro Aix. Jeffrey Lewis
author: jeffrey l.

description:
A fabulous find. Well executed bistro style, great food, super fresh and great wine selection with no fuss in a cozy setting. 

Was staying at the hotel across the street and surprised this place was #19 in the search. Hoping this review boosts them up a bit! Well deserved.
author: Celina F.

description:
An overall 3.5 from me, but maybe my group didn't order the right things!

Food: 3 (It sounds like the non-pasta entrees are very solid! Our group ordered pasta though, and it was just OK.)
Service: 4 (friendly & attentive!!)
Ambiance: dark & intimate, good for date night or small group gathering

Rounding down to a 3 b/c the three pasta dishes that we ordered (squid ink pasta, risotto & the angel hair pasta) were literally DROWNING in butter.

Usually butter means flavor, but I felt in was lacking in that sense. If I'm gonna clog my arteries, it better be damn well worth it.... all it left was a shine on my lips and my tongue coated with grease.. :/
author: Emily C.

description: I stumbled on this place with my boyfriend when we were walking around, looking for a place to eat and I was honestly very impressed! We got seated right away even though it was a busy night. We got two glasses of wine, calamari which was amazing and different than any calamari I've had before, and a margherita pizza! It was the perfect amount of food and everything was so rich and tasty!
author: Daniel C.

description: I took my son & friends to Bistro Aix for his birthday in March. He booked it, so I went on Yelp to read the reviews & get the scoop. Two reviews had mentioned that later evening reservations beware they run out of popular entrees or specials. I know now why, our reservation was at 8pm. Yes two entrees were sold out. No wonder! The food was delicious & atmosphere & service matched the excellent food! The pasta was fabulous! In the group also ordered was the pork chop, chicken & sea bass. All were flavorful & cooked to perfection!
author: Maria C.

description:
Came here for a celebratory dinner with the wifey. Was a bit disappointed that they ran out of most things on the menu by the time we had arrived (1.5 hours from closing) So we both opt for the steak main course as it was the safest bet to a tasty meal. We both enjoyed it, but our server had one job...and couldn't even get my order right. How hard was it to swap out fries for spinach?  It wasn't a busy night, as it didn't seem like anyone came into the restaurant after us.  

Food 4.5
Service 4.0
author: Toro C.

description:
If you can, get a seat in the back room. It feels like you're eating in an arboretum! Service is excellent, and our waitress was very attentive and helpful with her recommendations. Overall, the venue is super cute and an excellent place for a date. 

To start, I recommend getting their Nova Lux Potato Pancake. It's essentially a slightly heavier hashbrown topped with smoked salmon and an arugula salad on the side. Really delicious.

Hands down, my favorite dish is their Angel Hair Shrimp Scampi. Usually, this dish is a tad too overwhelming for me because of the copious amounts of butter (and sometimes cream ugh) other restaurants use to add "flavor" to the dish. What those other restaurants don't realize is that a good shrimp scampi is all about simplicity: well-cooked pasta, nicely sauteed shrimp, some olive oil, a little bit of butter, and an excellent white wine reduction. And Bistro Aix does this perfectly. It's rich in flavor without being rich in body. I could eat this everyday. 

Also had the chance to try their Braised Duck, which was extremely tender and juicy. Highly recommend if you're looking for a little more protein or something with a more exotic flavor profile.
author: Zi-on C.

description:
Really yummy pastas and amazing soft shell crab! 

Surprisingly the most basic and simple pasta was the best one we had. The spagettini with tomato sauce was awesome. Honestly, not as good as Delfina's but definitely up there. The black spagetti was also quite good but not as good as the spagettini. 

I was most blown away by the whole soft shell crab with spinich. Wow I took a bite and I was in heaven. Highly recommend!! Come for a good priced and also scrumptious meal. 

The street this restaurant is located on is super cute and has a bunch of restaurants.
author: Rohenne L.

description: This place hits all my must haves- consistently awesome, top notch service, quality ingredients, great wine list and fantastic ambiance.
author: R B.

description:
This place was recommended to us by some close friends, so we had to try it out. Boy am I glad we did because the spot phenomenal!

The service is great, but that goes without saying. The ambiance is top notch if you are able to sit in the front, which I would recommend. (Though we have not sat in the back, so we may be biased :) ) It is also a great spot to bring family or parents when they are in town, because it is classy and fun at the same time.

The food is amazing, as you would expect from a popular restaurant in SF. I would HIGHLY recommend getting the Ahi Tuna, as it is to die for! But be aware that they get all their ingredients fresh every day, so they run out of dishes if you get there later in the evening on a weekend night.

In review, great place, we will be returning many times, and make sure someone at your table gets the Ahi Tuna so you can be jealous that you did not order it!
author: Trevor S.

description:
Awesome food, all the way around.
Awesome service - everyone is genuinely friendly and knowledgeable.
Great selection of food!
Wine list is excellent, and wines by the glass are on point. PS - I *really* appreciate how knowledgeable the servers are about the wine list. Cannot state this enough.
Great value for portion size and quality.
We are happy to keep coming back here repeatedly - in an area full of over-priced, over-hyped restaurants, Bistro Aix has found a formula for success.
author: Celeste R.

description:
4.5 stars rounded up for the great service and nice atmosphere! They were accommodating of a large group in the back of the restaurant (next to the beautiful tree lit with lights).

I was super impressed with the food here especially for reasonable prices. The garlic, broccoli rabe & burrata pizza ($16) was AMAZING. I highly recommend it! Super creamy topping with crunchy thin crust. The tomato, mozzarella, fontina and parmesan pizza ($13) was really good too. I also enjoyed the tempura calamari ($12). It came with delicious asian slaw and red curry aioli on top.

For the main dish I got the squid ink spaghetti ($20). It had a very unique flavor and wasn't too rich. I definitely enjoyed it but the burrata pizza was still the standout meal for me. Lastly for dessert the creme brulee with lemon cookies was addicting. Highly recommend it as well!
author: Linda X.

description: We ordered the pasta and the steak and both were delicious. The service is quick, music not too loud. Nice place. Will return for sure.
author: Christy C.

description: I like everything about this lovely spot. It offers a cozy warm environment, a great serving team. The dishes is fresh and delicious. I think for the area the quality matches the price. It is a little great place..
author: Margaret P.

description:
Our group of four was looking for somewhere in the Marina to eat before our Houdini Escape Room at the Palace of Fine Arts on a Saturday night so I was relieved to find an 8:00 reservation available by Bistro Aix. Overall the food was a solid 4 stars but the service was a little off-putting - could it be because it was Halloween weekend and we were in costume? Possibly. But we enjoyed our meal overall.

We particularly enjoyed the grilled octopus appetizer and the buratta and broccolini pizza was amazing as well. The grilled lamb leg and risotto were both perfectly cooked but lacking in flavor. We also got a side of shisito peppers and I enjoyed the sauce it came with. 

I would definitely save room for the dessert! Both the chocolate cake and panna cotta were delicious!
author: Christina L.

description:
Not often do I take the time to post a review. It needs to be really extraordinary, good or bad experience. We were a large group so perhaps if your just a couple or two you might enjoy.

This is one of the few times we had both. The service wasn't bad, it was just plain awful. The server didn't think it was a problem when we asked about our salads after waiting 40 minutes. When they finally did come they were great..

A full hour later we had not received our entrees so my sister discreetly walked over and chatted with our waiter. No luck, we just watched as they sat,served the entire back room as we waited for our meal. I finally told the waiter give it 5 more minutes or it was time to leave. He had a tantrum walked into the kitchen, kicked the doors open so loud it startled the room.

Finally our meal showed up and everyone really enjoyed except for my medium rare chicken.

No manager bothered to drop by the table, no apology from the staff.

Have worked in the industry for years one of the few times I would have ever considered sending a note to management.

Great meal, terrible service...
author: Bob S.

description: One of my favorite places to eat in the Marina. Every meal I've had here has been delicious, the food is always exceptional. Service is generally very good. The larger room in the back can get a bit noisy when it's crowded, but not so bad that I've ever found it hard to carry a conversation. Overall, great seasonal and local food, always well prepared- I'm happy!
author: Ariana S.

description: Great, great service, great food. We had the calamari and artichoke entries, followed by the scallop and sole mains, all terrific
author: Ed C.

description:
Really disappointed during our last visit...

We showed up on time to our 8pm reservations on a Saturday night and were seated 25 minutes late. Which was especially frustrating as we had tickets for a show afterwards that we now had to rush to make, despite allowing for 1.5 hours for dinner when we made the reservations. We were also hosting family from out of town celebrating my sister's graduation for her master's degree. We were all looking forward to a nice relaxing, delicious meal.  

We let the waiter know that we had an hour left for dinner. Somehow the entree portion was still served 45 minutes after we were seated (we ordered immediately upon sitting). And strangely the meat entrees (steak and burger) came a few minutes before the gnocchi dishes. We ended up rushing through dinner and paying our check as we were still eating.

Food wise, all appetizers were delicious. The salads were especially great; we ordered the Little Gem and the Butter Lettuce with Goat Cheese. The guys loved their meat entrees; the Kobe Burger and Steak. 

My sister and I both ordered gnocchi and it was terrible - the broth was super watery and it had no flavor. Truly, none. After dousing with salt and parm I finally sent mine back. It was also pretty disappointing that we were given a list of about 7 items that were sold out as we sat for dinner. All pizzas were sold out and they were out of french fries for the burger. Plus a number of other items that thankfully we hadn't planned to order.

We were never offered the fresh bread baskets that we noticed at every single table inside as we left the restaurant. I didn't see these at any of the back patio tables where we were seated. The patio seating is generally lovely, but this time it was a total disappointment, as we rarely saw our server, despite it not being very busy. 

I do want to add that the host was genuinely fantastic. He was positive and professional and helpful all around.
author: Lorri H.

description: Food was good and tasty but served cold. Service left a lot to be desired and was incredibly uninspiring. And they don't take American Express.
author: David S.

description:
Delicious French food in a jovial atmosphere. We arrived just in time to be served (calling ahead helped) and sat at the bar alongside a 19-year Bistro Aix regular and the bartender's wife. 

We shared the grilled pork chop which was perfectly seasoned and grilled. 

We enjoyed the food and company and will definitely be back when we are next in the Marina!!
author: Nadine K.

description:
The food here was definitely really good. We ordered House Cured Salmon, Dill Crème Fraiche & Potato Galette and Grilled Octopus, Roasted Yukon Potatoes & Jalapeño Chimichuri to start. For entrees we had Risotto, Himalayan black truffle, chives & egg yolk and the local halibut. The total came to $70 before tax and tips.

I thought the potatoes were suprisingly well done in all the dishes, making for a better dish overall. My favourite dish was definitely the local Halibut which had came with really good spinach, the aforementioned potatoes and a sauce that was completely wiped off the plate. 

The restaurant rounded off the amazing food with excellent service. My only complaint was that it was a bit too noisy.
author: Alfonso C.

description:
Came here because we saw it on the Bib Gourmand list. The service was great and the food was delicious. I loved the restaurant itself (and the beautiful tree in the back that we got to sit right next to!)

We had the gnocchi, asparagus pizza and chicken meatballs and all were great! That was genuinely some of the best gnocchi I've ever had (though I'll admit I've never had it in Italy!).
author: Sonali D.

description:
I really love this place!
Food, service, ambience, value, it has it all.

My husband and I went here with a friend a few months ago. It was a celebratory occasion and the restaurant's ambience fit the mood. The back area where most of the tables are was similar to a nice tent with stringed lights that warmed the mood and created an intimate experience. 

The server was very entertaining and so nice and friendly. He was also very prompted and took care of us.

The food was so so good. We ordered a lot of appetizers, salads and shared it all. We each had our own main dishes which were absolutely delicious and for the price point, it was such a great deal. We had some cocktails as well and when we got the bill, it was a very nice surprise given the amount we ordered and the area of the city we were dining in.
author: Karen M.

description: Went last night for a last minute date night. The space is really cozy and the service was great. We started with the calamari which was amazing and some of the best I've had in a long time and just a bit spicy. I ordered the steak which was just all right. It was pre-sliced on the plate and not a huge serving. The salad that I had was also way too bitter and not really edible and it came with very average shoestring fries. The pork chop on the other hand was a huge serving and tasted great with much better crispy kale and potatoes as sides.
author: Josh C.

description:
This place is really good, and that's coming from someone who isn't a big fan of French food.  I find that it's usually too 'saucy.'  The octopus appetizer was excellent.  You can never go wrong w/ the ahi tuna (appetizer), but it's nothing extraordinary.  The calamari was pretty good.  

I thought their fries was really tasty.  I had the halibut, it was quite good.  For dessert, I recommend the first item, the tart with the creme fraiche (sp?).  The panna cotta tasted like a breakfast yogurt - I wouldn't get that again.

It's not a cheap place, but then again, it's in-line with what other French restaurants of this caliber in SF charges.  The service is very friendly.  I don't like how they tack on a 3% surcharge for the Healthy SF (for employees' healthcare).  I don't see why that charge is passed on to customers rather than the employer (restaurant owner) paying it all.  I guess the alternative is to just increase their prices without having that extra 3% charge line item.  But this is a separate complaint; nothing to do with the food here.

Our party of 5 was able to walk in on a Tuesday night around 7PM and get seated right away.  They have a back area which is pretty nice.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Sat in the back patio area for dinner. Ambiance was super cute and romantic.

Service was great, friendly and attentive, not annoying or hovery.

Food was delicious, we got an assortment of appetizers and then two entrees and dessert and loved everything we got. 

Definitely wouldn't be disappointed coming here! Especially during the week when they have great spe
author: Sarah G.

description: Just started to go back after years of neglect (100 percent reflection on me not the house).  Food is good, a bit pricey but good. Good wines; bartender on Wed is on top of her game.  The music that they play is awesome. will be back again this week.  hope u stop by
author: Allan B.

description:
I visited here for my birthday weekend from LA. We called 35 minutes before we got to the restaurant.', the host said he can sit us down. The host quickly sat down the party that walked in after us since they had a reservation they were white. There were plenty of empty tables and bars however no one even greeted us we stood there like idiots for almost 20 minutes and left. I felt discriminated against because we were Asian. 

1. If they even said hello and greeted us with a smile I wouldn't have been so upset. 
2. The restaurant had the "I voted for trump" sticker I have nothing against trump but I guess they decided to openly discriminate against Asians.
3. Visit Isa Restaurant instead it's right next door. Exquisite French cuisine they are Friendly, service is amazing and beautiful patio seating in the back.
author: Grace L.

description: Ordered the clams, very salty and can't say they were good. Waiter with half hair ponytail, no smile on his face and asked us if a plate on the side of the table looked ok to us.... just move it? Kind of bizarre, no thank you when we left the restaurant. Not enough staff for good service unfortunately.
author: Erica K.

description: Great Marina restaurant and bar. Very friendly and great food. Also great value.
author: Steven N.

description:
Despite the fact we had made a reservation we had to wait almost half an hour to be seated. As we waited we sat in the bar, where the bartender was completely rude to us!! As an apology we got complementary appetizers, and were helped by a super polite and nice waiter (at this point I had said to myself I wasn't writing this review) but by the end of the night the rude bartender approached our table, with the excuse of bringing the coffee, and he pretty much smashed it on the table!
Ps. In terms of food we paid around $300 (4 people) for a pretty mediocre dinner.
author: Regina B.

description:
I was really looking forward to trying Bistro Aix with my crew after reading amazing reviews of the restaurant. However, the experience was subpar.

First of all, the waiters were not very nice. We made a reservation, but they still chose to seat other walk-in customers before my party.

My friend ordered the kobe steak, which was recommended by our waiter.  When the food was brought to the table, it seemed like the waitress served the wrong order. Ten seconds after the plate was placed on our table, it was taken away by another waiter without any explanation. He later came back with the "correct" order and grinned. Again, no explanation whatsoever about the mistake.

When the waiter was serving my entree, he basically just smashed the plate on the table. Simply rude.

As I was walking out, I noticed every table has a basket of bread and some butter. My friend and I did not get bread during our meal.

The food was mediocre and the service was terrible. I will NOT come back to this restaurant. For those who are looking for a nice French restaurant in the area, try Gamine. They have amazing food, wine, and desserts. And the waiters are warm and funny.
author: Moko R.

description:
To start off, the bread is AMAZING!! Don't forget to request it since it's free! The focaccia is incredible - light and fluffy with a hint of buttery flavor - SO delicious! Wish I could have it every day! The rest of our group also loved the baguette bread that came too!

For main dishes we ordered the steak with fries, ahi tuna, lamb, and pork ribs. It was all wonderful! For $24 I would have preferred more ribs (there were 5 ribs) since with mashed potato and kale sides, they were obviously the majority of the cost, but the ribs themselves were great. Fall of the bone, tender, delicious. My boyfriend's ahi tuna was also great - easy to cut, not chewy at all, seasoned well. No complaints except we just wanted more!!

The desserts were fantastic - we got the creme brulée, panna cotta, and tarte tatin. I LOVED our creme brulée - the crunchy top was thicker than most other ones I've had and the thousands of vanilla bean seeds in the custard was proof that they use great ingredients!

The service was on point - our server always made sure we had enough water (they left 3 bottles on our table so we wouldn't have to keep asking - I thought that was really thoughtful), our empty plates were quickly removed and the table was always clean. 

It's pricey but definitely a good place to go for a special occasion (:
author: Mio W.

description: First time here everything was wonderful specially the spaghetti. Alan at the bar best bartender ever thanks for hospitality. THFC..
author: Ercan V.

description:
This is a perfect neighborhood restaurant for us.

The menu is extensive with plenty of excellent appetizers. 

The duck, squid, and salmon appetizers are some favorites. 

They have pastas and protein forward entrees which rarely disappoint. 

I can't recall ever ordering dessert, probably because we overdo it on appetizers. 

It's far superior to A16, and less crowded.
author: Cecil C.

description: Go to Bistro Aix if you just want an all-around pleasant experience. The ambience of the restaurant is great- especially in the back dining room, service is prompt and polite, and the drinks are wonderful. The last time I went, I started with the fried calamari with red chili sauce- excellent. Truly some of the best calamari I've had. For mains, we had the tagliatelle bolognese- great execution and flavor development!- and the chanterelle mushroom risotto- a little overdone but still definitely yummy. Would be back again!
author: Talia B.

description:
Came here the night before Thanksgiving with my family from out of town (Los Angeles which has also has great restaurants, so I am always skeptical when choosing a restaurant which I have never been to before to show visitors). Choosing this place on a whim and arriving at 8:30 PM without an reservation, we were greeted kindly by a lovely woman and were seated within 10 minutes in the back room **the back room is a little chiller than the front room, but we loved it because of the spaciousness and ambiance - there is an indoor tree with lights!

Recommendations: Chardonnays were a little off for us/not well known, so if you can bring your own, do it (ask for the corkage price).  I highly recommend the Smoked Salmon Appetizer and the Octopus Appetizer.  As far as entrees go; everything was wonderful.  I suggest the Chicken Breast which was so tender.  My husband had the Ahi Tuna which was good, but had a kick due to the wasabi flavored mashed potatoes.  My mom had the lamb which everyone said was delicious and my dad had the kobi beef hamburger - all were devoured.  The duck confit was a salty according to my brother.

Overall, this was one of the best restaurants that we have been to since moving to SF from LA 2 months ago.  Great service, atmosphere, staff, and food (all reasonably priced too!). We will be back and you should come too!
author: Vanessa V.

description:
Definitely a good place to hang out and grab dinner after work. 

When I went, the place was either filled with people on dates or people who just finished working from 9-5. 

Food: I had the salmon and the corn risotto was TO DIE FOR. I would 100% order this again when I come back.  

Service: Waiter was friendly and gave us honest opinions on each dish. He also came back every so often to check up on us and made sure we were okay. 

Atmosphere: Normal, casual environment. They have a bar area in the front but also a nice porch and dining area in the back. So you get the best of both worlds depending on your mood that day. 

Overall, I had a great dining experience and the food was up to par. I will definitely come back and try the halibut or ahi tuna.
author: janice p.

description:
How have I not been here yet?!  I have walked by it a million times and honestly never noticed Bistro Aix, but someone recommended it, and now I know why!  In my opinion, everything was perfection from our server, to the food and the wine.  My friend and I sat on the back patio/atrium area, which had a wonderful atmosphere after it got dark and has a pretty lit up tree in the middle of the room.  

We couldn't decide on a wine so our server recommended the Cab Franc - it was delicious!  We started with the burrata appetizer over eggplant.  My friend ordered the scallops with risotto and I got the angel hair pasta with crab, mushrooms in a garlicky, chili oil type sauce.  I was not expecting to be as blown away by my angel hair as I was - the flavors were outstanding.  I was actually disappointed the next day when I didn't have more leftovers.  Is it acceptable to lick the plate if you're alone?!  

Loved this place.  Will definitely be back.
author: Elise C.

description: Love their food & ambience.  I had octopus appetizer & squid ink spaghetti and my hubby got steak. They were very tasty.  I will definitely come back this place.
author: EunJoo C.

description:
I used love this place and would give it a 5 star but I am now giving Bistro Aix two stars because the portions of food that you get have gone down and the prices have gone up.  The burger is still good but its less than half the size now  The chicken is now just a breast when before it was half chicken.
The service is still good and everyone is nice.
author: Dan K.

description:
Favourite restaurant in SF! I moved here in February from London and have tried a lot of restaurants around the city but nothing compares to here! I was walking past it in the Marina and we had to go in. There were no tables available so we were offered to wait or to sit at the bar. I do not normally like sitting at the bar but this one is great! The bar was larger than normal so you had space between other people and you can see the chefs in action cooking on a fire pit. The bar man was so nice and helped us choose our options on the menu and told us about the wine list. We had the octopus and potatoes to start and it was the best food my boyfriend said he has ever had in his life. We then had a steak and squid ink pasta, delicious! As we were sharing they split it onto two separate plates and made sure that they did not all come at the same time. There is a back room which use to be a patio but is now covered and it's gorgeous, we have already booked dinner there for next week! The food is very well priced, the only downside is that the wine is all $60 a bottle unless you get a half bottle which we did. 

I would highly recommend it and if you go in the summer time you can sit outside and enjoy your wine!
author: Tessa R.

description:
I would definitely come back. 
The food was great and very reasonably priced for what you get and the neighborhood. We had the grilled octopus appetizer and for entrees we had the steak frites and grilled ahi. All were wonderful. I normally don't like potatoes but the ones that came with the octopus were so delicious. Ditto for the garlic mashed potatoes with the ahi. If you love fries, they are pretty good here! 

There were a few hiccups but the server definitely went out of her way to comp us for any "troubles".
For instance, they accidentally brought the wrong wine and had to swap it out. We hadn't consumed the wine yet so we didn't catch it. Neither of us cared but they comped our next glass. Then our dessert was supposed to come with mandarin oranges and strawberries. Apparently they ran out which is no biggie but I kind of didn't like that the server didn't tell us and we had to ask. Again I didn't make a stink but just wanted to make sure they just didn't forget. Seconds later she comes back with another dessert and said "we want you to have something done right". So sweet!!
author: Z C.

description:
What a perfect evening. I was looking for something unpretentious, in a warm and inviting setting; small; extraordinary. I stumbled on this place walking around in the neighborhood, and wasn't disappointed.   I had the salad special to start -- baby kale and arugula, asparagus, marcona almonds, and goat cheese. Amazingly refreshing and a perfect portion. Veal osso buco for the main - fall-off-the-bone tender in a glaze that hinted of cherries and wood with a flavorful and simple risotto with asparagus, mushrooms, and carrots. The wine selection was great and quite reasonably priced.  The staff seemed to love their jobs and know the people who came in as often as they didn't. It made me feel like I'd been invited over to a friend's house for dinner with great new folks rather than being at a restaurant where in theory I don't know anyone. My server/ bartender was genuine and easy to talk to and clearly loved working there. Oh and they also play great music. 
I would go back here anytime and twice on Sunday...thanks Bistro Aix for being a particular highlight of my San Francisco experience!
author: Chimene M.

description: I would definitely recommend Bistro Aix for a range of occasions, from date night to family dinner. Celebrated a birthday dinner on a week night.  Upon arrival our reserved table was ready, in the back room next to the fancifully lit living tree.  Everyone loved their appetizers, both meat-lovers and vegetarians like myself.   There is an excellent selection of classic dishes, from  roast duck, pork to veggie pizza.  Even one of the kids who used to eat only chicken nuggets loved his squid ink spaghetti!  The atmosphere was warm, casual, busy and happy.  Good find!   Tip:  come early to park.  It's well worth it!
author: Merry B.

description:
honestly the food, service and ambience is as good as it gets!  

alfred was our server and he was incredible.  he was so kind to us, professional and truly made our experience there wonderful.  we met the fabulous ryan and he was just lovely!

the food is great- the burger is one of the best in the city.  its huge and smokey and delicous!  i had it with the sauteed spinach instead of the fries and it was perfect.  we also had the margherita pizza which was absolutely out of this world.  

this place is wonderful and we can not wait to go back!
author: Samantha B.

description:
This is a solid option in every way, from the time we entered to the time we departed.  It was our first visit to this restaurant.
 
Points that helped merit this rating were:
We were warmly greeted and taken within a few minutes to our table.
Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu AND the wine list
Our meal was perfectly paced for a group of friends that had not seen each other for years. 
The food was fresh and very well prepared and tasty.  Three of us ordered the local halibut and it was terrific.
The starters were fine but not exceptional with the exception of the asparagus which was a standout. 
Deserts and coffee were appropriate conclusions to a very nice meal.
The price was fair for the total experience and attention to our needs.

One note that did not spoil the evening but should be considered by the management is that the kitchen ventilation did not adequately remove the various delicious odors that ended up on my clothes and were still strongly present the next morning.  This was a minor issue that would not keep us from coming back again (and again and again)!

Thank you, Bisro Aix for a very nice venue for our reunion!
author: Stu W.

description:
It was Saturday night around 845pm.  My wife, myself, and another couple were roaming around the Marina sans-reservation looking for a place to eat.  After repeatedly being told of 1hr to 2hr waits, we came across Bistro AIX.  It actually looked quite busy inside, but luckily, they had an available table for 4 in the front portion of the restaurant.  (I was told that there was a large back portion but did not venture there).

Unfortunately, when placing our orders, there seemed to a decent number of items that were "out".  I think it was 5+ items, including the Chicory Salad that our group was eyeing on the menu.  We noticed that there was only one Crème Brûlée dessert remaining, so we placed an unorthodox dessert order first so as to reserve the item.  Clearly, we are big Crème Brûlée fans.

For appetizers, our group shared Calamari and the Fuyu Persimmon Salad.  Both of these dishes were really good.  The Calamari stood out for me as it was served in a slaw with a drizzle spicy sauce rather than a normal serving of bowl of just Calamari and a side dipping sauce.  The combination with some veggies was great.

For mains, my wife and I shared the Gnocchi and a special for the evening, the New York Strip.  I liked both of these dishes as well.

Finally, for dessert, we received our aforementioned Crème brûlée, which certainly lived up to all the build up that I've provided throughout this review.  We also had the Chocolate Cloud Cake, substituting vanilla ice cream for whipped cream.  Both were very good.

To top it all off, we thought that the staff was really friendly as well.

I'm looking forward to a return visit.
author: Sebastian N.

description: We had reservations and were running 15 mins late. We called and ask if it was ok and they said it was fine. Got seated pretty quickly. Ordered the Burrata to share, which was ok. Kind of flavorless. For my main course, I ordered the Kobe burger with bacon and gruyer. The burger was well done, even though I asked for medium. Overall, burger was just ok. The fries were really good though. Also, if you like bread, you have to ask for a bread basket. Service was decent too. Overall, this place is ok.
author: Lisa T.

description: I just had the best kobe bif burguer ever! My wif also had a fantastic black trufle risoto! Nice music, romantic, great service. Already a favorite spot at SFO.
author: Santiago E.

description: Spaghettini pasta dish rocks!! So flavorful !! The broccoli rabe flatbread was decent..  and pretty delicious wines.. great backyard patio!!
author: Raja K.

description: My wife and I have been going to Bistro Aix since 2009, and it has stayed as one of our favorite dinner spots in all of SF. Bistro Aix has always done amazingly delicious seasonal dishes which showcase some of the best local, California ingredients. They change up their menu for the seasons and to keep things different, but also have a bunch of "go-to's" which we always like. And the setting/vibe is awesome - a great Mediterranean rustic feel that is comfortable but also chic. I hope to keep coming back here for another 8 years!
author: Charlton V.

description:
In town for an extended weekend visit we came here with family who live nearby. We arrived on a Saturday at 6pm and the place was already packed! With two kids in tow I'm always on the lookout for other families and I'm happy to report there were at least a few other families there at that early dinner hour. We ordered two appetizers to share -- calamari and grilled pear. Both were good, though the pear felt a little skimpy. The portion of the calamari was great but I felt the taste was just ok. The kids devoured the spaghettini. I believe I heard my son say it was the best spaghetti of his life. :)  I got a tiny taste before they finished it off and it really was delicious. Made me wish I had ordered a bowl for myself! The grown ups enjoyed steak and angel hair pasta with shrimp and mushroom. We were able to enjoy a bottle of wine that we brought and the service was great. 

Kiddo tip: As I mentioned there were other families dining during the earlier dinner time (we were there at 6pm). On a weekend I'd definitely go early as it got pretty crowded! There's no changing table or place for stroller if you have an infant  so just be warned!
author: Sarah C.

description:
This is such a cute restaurant! It's a nice date spot. If you're ever here, ask to be seated at the back because it's a lot nicer back there due to the stringed lights they have up. 

Came here with the boyfriend. We ordered brussel sprouts for our appetizers,  pork chops for my entree, and steak for my boyfriend. 

Brussel sprouts - ehhh nothing special. Probably won't get it again. 
Pork chops - came with mashed potatoes and fried kale. The pork chop was juicy, and I like to eat the kale and potatoes together because it gave it a really unique texture. 
Steak - cooked well and the sauce it came with was really good. 

Although overall the food was good, the menu was very small and I won't come back because there's nothing else I want to try and nothing I ordered wowed me.
author: Michelle T.

description: I have been going to Bistro Aix for several years.  While the food has always been lovely, the service has often been a mixed bag... until today.   Today, my wife and I took my father here (he was visiting from out of town).   While our own server was lovely, the restaurant got busy and we found it difficult to get her attention for some additional needs.  We finally managed to flag down a different server, but she was actively rude to us.   She repeatedly informed us in a rude tone that she was "not our waitress" and expressed clear annoyance that she was burdened with having to help us.  That was bad enough, but when we pointed this out to our server, there was no response by the restaurant.  No one came to our table to apologize.  Nothing.   Save yourself the frustration.  If you want a nice evening, do not dine here.  The food may be good, but it does not make up for the pattern of bad service.  Clearly, management at this restaurant does not make customer service a priority.
author: Jeff M.

description:
Absolutely love Bistro Aix! Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco.

It's truly a hidden gem in the Marina. You can sit outside and people watch when the weather cooperates, dine at the bar, or enjoy the back atrium with table and bench/booth seating around the beautiful olive tree.

The food is fantastic - fresh, consistent, delicious, perfectly cooked, and really offers something for everyone. I highly recommend the beet salad, spaghetti, risotto, steak (substitute the fries with mashed potatoes, you won't regret it!), cheese plate (either for dessert or as an appetizer), and the tarte tatin for dessert. 

Service is always great. The staff are friendly, knowledgeable, attentive, and not too nosy or talkative. We've dined there with groups of 2 all the way up to 12 and have never had any qualms about the service, getting orders wrong, or things taking too long. They're always accommodating too and I usually have no problem getting a table for 2 as a walk-in on busy nights (Thu-Sat).

As for price, Bistro Aix is honestly quite reasonably priced for the food, service, and atmosphere that you get, especially vis-à-vis other restaurants in the neighborhood like Delarosa and A16. Dinner for two can range from $50 to $100+ depending on whether or not one orders appetizers, drinks, and or dessert.

Lastly, the atmosphere is really what makes this place. It's always busy but never too noisy, cozy but not cramped, romantic/intimate but not dark, and the decor and design are beautiful.

Overall Bistro Aix is fantastic - great food, atmosphere, service, and value. 5 stars.

A few other tips and notes: while it's always busy, reservations and walk-ins aren't too hard to come by, no matter the size of the group, they don't take Amex, they're closed on Sundays, and if you're looking to have a nice, relaxing dinner away from the trendy, crowded, Millennial-filled restaurants of Chestnut and Union then Bistro Aix is a great option.
author: Brendan C.

description: Love this place. Reserve a table on the back covered patio. They had many gluten free options for those with celiac. The chicken was exceptional.
author: Laura G.

description:
If you want to go to a place where you are ignored and made to feel like a fool standing in a corner.  This is the place.  After waiting for 15+ min without even a simple "Hi, I'll be right there", the hostess (who was obviously not wanting to be there) came over and made us feel even more unwelcomed.   

Well screw that.....we picked up and just left.
author: Edward M.

description:
Came here for NYE! Such a cute place. We were given a table in the back! Cute ambiance. There were red and green Christmas light around a tree in the middle of the room and dim lighting. 

I ordered the Sonoma Chicken with Yukon potatoes! So yummy!!! My potatoes weren't yellow though. They were purple. Weird.
My boyfriend ordered the sirloin Steak. Not as juicy as I would like my steak to be but it was still good. The steak was served to us uncut. Just the woke steak. No bread was given to us either 

Our waiter was sweet and friendly and came to our table often to make sure we were doing fine. They actually forgot to serve us the glasses of wind we ordered but she was very apologetic. 

For dessert we ordered the Tart Tatin (apple Tarte) and the Milk and cookies. I preferred the milk and cookies. The Tart Tatin was really sweet! The serving size is big and I didn't get to finish it. The sweetness is too much. 
I almost forgot our appetizer!! Burrata for appetizer! Super yummy!!
author: Majileen C.

description:
My wife and I decided to give Bistro Aix a try on our way home this Saturday evening.  It ended up being a great night.

The Superb:
+  I really enjoyed the space and vibe.  Dark tones, marble tops and interesting light fixtures set the mood.  Romantic, warm and a bit modern.  
+  Wine list.  Superb.  Entre Deux Mers for $7.50 a glass?  Dope.  They even had two decent beers on tap (Radeberger Pils and something local).
+  Menu - Diverse, creative, and interesting.  It made it hard to pick what to eat.
+  Service.  Our server was awesome.  Friendly, helpful and let us take our time.  Awesome.
+  Grilled Octopus Appetizer - $14  Boom, Pow, get in my belly!  It was wonderful, had a nice texture and wasn't chewy at all.  The roasted potatoes and arugula worked well with it.  Damn fine.

The Good:
o  My grilled leg of lamb had great flavor but about half the pieces required some serious chewing.  At $22 I was happy with the amount of lamb I received, and the potatoes were tasty, but I would have hoped for a bit better slicing.  The grilled outer marks had a nice crust and were the highlight of the meal.  
o  Seating.  We sat at a tall two top, which is fine, but I feel bad for the 4-top that got a direct shot of my ass the entire meal (one poor lady's head was about 12 inches away from my arse).  Sorry about that.

Overall I was a fan and I look forward to my next visit to Bistro Aix.
author: Andreas H.

description:
BEST CALAMARI I have ever had. I have tried lots of calamari but this was the best. If you like calamari, make sure to order this one.  Its served with a sauce that has a slight spicy curry flavor and over a bed of slaw and some herbs.  The combo of the flavors go great together. I will go back just for the calmari.

Service is very good. Also when ordering wine, was able to taste do a small wine tasting before choosing. 

Desert was the only dish lacking for me. Panna Cotta was not properly made. It was more like a so so yogurt and fruit dish.

5 starts for the calamari and service.
author: Ivory M.

description:
Great service and cozy, laid back ambience. 

Favorites were the burrata pizza, octopus salad, beet salad, creme brûlée and chocolate cake.
author: S C.

description:
We're from out of town, staying practically right next door to this place. I don't recall it being here last year while on our stay but I'm glad it's here. Place is pretty fucking cool. 
Atmosphere is cozy, casual. Staff are super friendly, like they know you and that's welcoming. 
Really nice menu, so many delicious options and a great wine selection, if you're a wine drinker and they have beer. My ONLY disappointment was no gluten free beer and no cocktails or hard liquor. I'm a whiskey gal and it wasn't an option, well it wasn't on the drinks list and I didn't ask so that could be on me. I asked for a white wine recommendation and was obliged.

I ordered the sirloin, comes with frites, béarnaise, and a little salad. My other half had the lamb, comes with au gratin taters and crispy spinach. There is no salt and pepper on the table and once you take a bite, you know why. It's NOT needed. Everything is seasoned so well and cooked perfectly, all the flavors go so well together. My sincere compliments to the chef for creating a fantastic menu.

This place is tops.
author: Lesley B.

description: Spent my birthday in this lovely restaurant. The waitstaff are very friendly and the food is delicious. Big bright courtyard in the back perfect for any meal! Will definitely be back to this restaurant!
author: Susan G.

description: Consistently delicious food at reasonable prices. Everything on the menu is great. And love the beautiful back room with the olive tree!
author: Danielle R.

description:
I came here for my birthday dinner with my girls once on Sunday at 8pm. They told me that they went out of lamb, Ahi tuna, and scallops. I was very disappointed. There were not much to order. 

The salad was good. But the duck and squid pasta were just so so. 

There is one thing that I really don't like. The waiter was always not around. 

Overall, it's a good place to chill with friends or family. The price was not too bad, $80 per person including a glass of wine and desert. I would give one more star if they actually serve a full menu and I didn't have to ask the other server to look for my waiter.
author: Tammy L.

description:
This place has really delicious food! And a large selection on the menu to choose from. Every item from start to finish was tasty. This restaurant provides a nice and intimate atmosphere, yet can be casual. There is a large section in the back of the restaurant to accommodate larger groups.

For appetizers we had the:
Calamari: Delicious drizzle on the squid
Octopus: Not a huge portion, but nicely grilled 
Tuna Tartare: Raw Ahi tuna with avocado to be eaten with chips, yummy

For entrees we had the:
Halibut: Lightly grilled with sautéed spinach and potato wedges in a good sauce
Hawaiian Ahi Tuna: Comes with fried spinach and creamy mashed potatoes. Seared and soft and melts in your mouth good with the sauce. My favorite of the night.

Dessert was:
Tart Tatin: Really good hot apple pastry with melting whipped cream on top. 
Panna cotta: The thick texture of the yogurt-like cream with berries was quite good
 
I only wish the main entrées were a little bigger for more enjoyment.
author: Ali F.

description: Loved the grilled octopus. My husband enjoyed the yellowtail tuna. I had the squid ink spaghetti with squid. It was delicious. The service was fantastic. We were surprised by the room in the back of the restaurant. It provided a lovely ambiance.
author: Joanna T.

description:
I went in a group of 6 on a Thursday night.  Pretty full (we had a reservation so no problem) and were seated on time.

Ambiance was great for what the place is.  Very friendly and I ended up knowing several people there outside of the group I was dining with.

The menu looked good, reasonable prices and good selection.  However I didn't see anything on the menu that shouted "French".  Not a problem, just an observation.  

I had a piece of grilled salmon, which I asked for medium-rare.  My t-shirt clad waiter replied that they normally cook it medium.  I politely said again I would like it medium-rare to rare.  Another person at my table also ordered the salmon and she wanted rare.  Our waiter again said they normally cook it to medium.  It was clear he really didn't want to ask the cook to go from their norm.  I find these days that saltwater seafood is pretty regularly ordered and/or cooked rare or medium-rare.  It was cooked properly and tasted good.  At $24.00 I was surprise at the portion (good) for San Francisco.

Everyone's meals were good.  That's a good thing because our waiter never asked until he cleared our plates.

We ordered several desserts to share and that was painfully slow.  The ice cream and creme brulee were brought out first, but it took 10 minutes for the last item.  By that time the ice cream was pretty soft.

Big selection of wine and we are winos, but we felt they were a little too proud of their wines (ie. pricey) and concluded even with corkage we'd be much better off in quality of wine for the price bringing our own.

My only real complaint and it isn't big was I'd like my waiter/server/waitperson/person to wear something besides a wrinkled t-shirt.  Okay it was gray, but still.  I can get a waiter and a cook in t-shirts in a diner.  That and at least check on us WHILE we're eating to make sure everything is okay.

Maybe I'm being harsh, but I've had better service at lesser places.
author: Jeff Z.

description:
This place took me by surprise. The patio area was cute with dim lighting and a lit olive tree in the middle of the room. 

We shared appetizers and pastas and everything was good including the tagliatelle, broccolini burrata pizza, beet salad (and I don't usually like beets), octopus and especially the gnocchi. 

Had a great time and new favorite spot in the marina.
author: Melody T.

description:
I had my bachelorette weekend in San Francisco, and our group of 9 ate at Bistro Aix after taking a sunset boat cruise. 

The restaurant itself was a really cute and cozy space. We were initially disappointed to find out that they were out of quite a few items- bread, one of the entrees, and one of the bottles of wine we tried to order. In fairness, we did have a 9:00 pm reservation, so we were eating kind of late. I can understand running out of an entree or wine, but bread?! How does a restaurant run out of bread?

Anywho, overall the food was good. As a group we ordered a few small plates, but I only tried two- the tempura fried baby artichokes, and the shishito peppers. Both were really good, especially the peppers! For an entree, a friend and I shared the crispy chicken breast, yukon gold potatoes, and green beans. The entree was good, but nothing great. I probably would order something different next time. No one else really raved about their entrees. Of course, we had to have dessert- the creme brulee and crepes. Both desserts were delicious!

If I was just grading on the food alone, I'd probably be closer to 3 or 3.5 stars. However, our waiter was great. I know it probably was annoying to wait on a group of 9 women who were coming from a booze cruise. He was super patient with all of our questions about the menu, and most importantly he kept the water and wine flowing all evening. I don't think either of my glasses went close to be empty.

With so many amazing restaurants in San Francisco, I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here. But if you are trying to book dinner for a large group, or happen to be in the area, I would recommend Bistro Aix.
author: Alissa M.

description: We dined here on a Monday night for an early birthday celebration and we had a great time.  I wish I had the receipt so I could be more specific in my review.  We were both given a generous taste of the rose to see if we wanted to order it, but we went with a bottle of chardonnay instead.  We shared the beet salad, which had good flavor although the greens were a bit tough.  The angel hair pasta with shrimp was great.  The lamb was perfectly cooked and had great flavor.  Our server and the host/manager were both very friendly and attentive.  We ended with crème brulee and coffee.  We would definitely go back.
author: Jan F.

description:
Liked the ambiance. I would definitely come back for a relaxed dinner.

Food was ok. But the pizza was GREAT! So I would say it's a MUST! 

We ordered many appetizers to share and we liked all of them, still the pizza won our hearts.

Great great service!  We stayed there forever having dinner and they were very patience with us, they didn't even try to rush us, which was nice as we were having a great time :)

I would recommend a reservation, as it'was a full restaurant all night (trust me I was there the whole night! haha)
author: Maggie J.

description: This was an excellent meal. Food was rock solid, especially the pastas and mains. And the wine list is awesome; both bottles we ordered were superb. Service was a little inconsistent, but the top staff was outstanding. This is pretty close to five stars, so for a great price and super cozy atmosphere, let's round up.
author: Amjad S.

description: Great service, great ambiance, great food. Honestly I had no idea what to expect. I live in the city but don't go out in the marina area hardly ever. This was an impromptu decision last minute call for four to see if they had room. Maybe a Wednesday or Thursday night. The service was excellent and as someone who doesn't eat a ton of meat, mostly fish and veggies, there were a ton of great options. I will definitely come back again. Looked like a really nice back patio for a warm evening.
author: Alex S.

description:
3.5 stars because just average to me. However service was excellent and you should try for yourself. It's one of those places where the dishes can go either way. The food was not bad at all. But I eat out a lot and compared to others, this place is just average to me. 

Food:
- Grilled local sardines- good
- Tempura fried artichokes - not my favorite, OK
- Grilled rare Hawaiin ahi- good presentation, mashed potatoes were yummy, ahi was just so-so.. not much flavor
- Ravioli with cheese and crab i think? OK
- dessert had the straweberry crepes, and chocolate cake with ice cream.. good so-so

They have good selection of wine by the bottle or glass. We had 2 each .. Malbec and Pinot Noir. 

It could be expensive here. The main dishes are $20 and up. Like I said the food was not bad, just not amazing for the price. Very cute restaurant though. Love the area in the back that looks like garden and skylight roof.
author: Vol T.

description: Love this place! Has been around and evolved over last 20 yrs! Place appears tiny but once you get past the kitchen, the back "patio" is quite delightful. Service was excellent but the food is outstanding! Hard to classify as French--more Northern Italian with French influences is prob more apropos. Tomato salad is extremely fresh, calamari is perfect but the octopus is fantastic--tender and flavorful. The pastas are made in house and taste like it! Perfectly cooked with nice bite and chew. We loved the squid ink & gnocchi but the duck/ stinging nettle was SOOO YUMMY!  And lastly, the lamb was perfectly cooked! We love this place, can't wait to return and always struggle with reviewing fave neighborhood spots but need/want them to remain (& successful)!
author: Gary T.

description: Highly recommend! We made a reservation for 4 on a Friday night and the restaurant was very accommodating when we asked to move the reservation back half an hour. I really enjoyed the grilled octopus and tuna tartare appetizers. Both extremely flavorful and good serving sizes! For main course, I shared the truffle risotto and leg of lamb with a friend. The truffle risotto was tasty, but nothing amazing. The lamb however, was delicious and I loved the texture of the crispy kale with the potato au gratin. We sat in the front room but after seeing pictures of back dining room with the olive tree, I want to go back!
author: Chloe Z.

description:
The decor of the restaurant is deceiving! You enter through the front and it's very dark and ominous. But if you walk to the back with the sky light it's so beautiful! So ask to get seated in the back!

We had small plates, pasta, and a pizza. Thin crust just the way I like it! We had he beet salad, octopus, tagliatelle, gnocchi, and the broccoli pizza. All great. I did find the gnocchi kind of bland but if you just dip it in more of the butter sauce it will be good. 

Super romantic and fun! I want to return to try the chicken or halibut.
author: Tiffany L.

description: LOVE this place - the food is delicious and fairly priced, and I've had nothing but positive experiences here. Ask to be seated out back if there's availability; the back patio is outdoorsy and decorated with cute lights. Would be a great place to go on a date, or even if you're feeling a fancier meal with friends. It's one of my favorite restaurants in the area.
author: Catherine S.

description:
This bistro has all the elements of good surprises. It has a cozy and small entrance but a beautiful and private space for dinning on the another side of the restaurant. 

The servers are very busy but manage to provide good services. Your water will always be full, and proactive on customer need every 5-10 mins. 

The food was great!! I had the pork chop and squid ink spaghetti. 

Pork chop - portion is not super big but it will save you some space for the appetizer and sweet. Fried crispy kale goes well with the soft mash potato. The orange dark sauce is perfect to the tender pork. 

Squid ink spaghetti - the noodles was cooked perfectly. They dice the squid in different sizes to bring more interesting texture. The tiny garlic just intensify the flavor of the whole dish.
author: Isaac R.

description:
The complimentary bread was the only thing we enjoyed eating, unfortunately. :/

Food:
+Complimentary fresh bread with olive oil- delicious; so soft and perfectly baked. Note: You have to request it though, so don't sit there waiting for it!
+Beet Salad- ugh! the flavoring was so off. way to sweet and pretty inedible
+Cracker Thin pizza- had high hopes for this "popular" entree but there didn't realize it would be a SAUCE-LESS pizza with chewy hard cheese. Not a winner.
+Flourless Chocolate cake- this was the biggest disappointment of them all bc I was expecting a beautiful layered hearty chocolate cake and instead it was a tiny little brownie with a huge, unnecessary dollop of cream on top. complete ripoff. apparently "flourless" cake means its basically a brownie.
+Erlinger Non-alcoholic beer- they have it! another win for the hubs

*I might come back to try the burger but that's the only other appetizing entree on the menu for me.

Service:
Our waiter was very friendly and he did check on us frequently. Very nice guy. The stars are for him.

Ambience:
DEFINITELY sit in the BACK! The beautiful living tree in the inside of a room is enchanting and the perfect backdrop for an intimate dinner. The front room was pretty dark and filled with loud children the day we went.

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description: Food is pretty good, but wasn't happy with the service. It took a veryy long time to get our food and the waiter had quite a bit of attitude when we asked to split the check- I understand it can be an inconvenience but he could've politely declined the request instead of being extremely rude about it. Got the chicken it's really good. The back sitting area is really pretty, would recommend asking to sit back there.
author: Kelli L.

description:
Great atmosphere, cute outdoor patio. Servers were very attentive. Food is absolutely delicious. Try the tuna tar tar or the halibut, just for the halibut.... Hehe

Definitely going back!!!
author: Grace H.

description:
We had reservations at 5:45 pm for a group of 8 to celebrate a milestone birthday.  We were seated immediately in the back patio which was very cozy and nice ambiance.

We ordered a variety of appetizers, halibut, Kobe burger, ink pasta, duck pasta, and lamb.  Most of the dishes were very good; the exception of the duck pasta, because the duck was overcooked and dry.

The reason for my 3 star rating is that the waitress was not very attentive.  After she took our order and the food was served, she never came back to ask if we needed anything.  We had asked for a cup of hot water and never received it.
