We noticed that other tables had baskets of bread with olive oil dip, but our tables were never offered any bread and she never came back for us to ask her any questions?

I ended up writing to the Manager to ask if breads were served to customers or needed to be ordered and paid for before you receive it?  The Manager did reply to me that it is written on the bottom of the menu that you have to ask for their homemade bread, but it is complimentary.  She also wrote that maybe they were busy and ran out of bread?  No, at 5:45 pm, they were not busy as only one other table was seated in the back area where we were seated.  Definitely not too busy that the waitress could not bring us the hot water we asked for either!

OK, it was our own fault for all 8 of us not seeing the fine print that you have to ask for the homemade bread!  But the bottom line to me is... The service from the waitress was not up to the 18% service charge that we paid for in this restaurant.  Food was good... Be sure if you want to have homemade bread to ASK FOR IT when you order your meal because your waitress may never come back for you to ask again.
author: Em D.

description:
Initially, I was planning to have dinner later in the evening, but decided to prepone due to Bistro Aix's early opening time for dinner. My date and I selected the Himalayan Black Truffle Risotto and the Squid Ink Spaghetti, respectively. 

The spaghetti dish contained strong hints of sea salt, much to my delight, and it was clearly evident that the linguine was authentic since the taste indicated a hand-made craft. In addition to that, there was truly a squidy tinge to the flavor - it was clear that I had transcended towards seafood heaven. 

The risotto took my date back to her New Zealand days with its refreshing, oceany taste. Although she found the dish to be quite delicious, she was unable to wipe the plate clean, so I gladly devoured the rest of it. The chives, albeit being reserved a side to the truffle risotto, were surprisingly very well done too. 

To conclude our meal, we shared a rich serving of Creme Brulee coupled with a Douro Port. 

Overall, dinner at Bistro Aix was a five-star experience, from a service, ambience, and food standpoint. I'll definitely return to this top-notch establishment in the near future !
author: Adnan K.

description:
Came here last Friday night with my teammate and had an enjoyable evening. When I made the reservation, I had no idea that Bistro Aix was so beautiful and so lovely.

We were seated deep inside the core of the restaurant where there was a beautiful lit up tree in the midst of it all. We had a booth seat and our tables were made of polished, jagged wood. I ordered the petrale while teammate ordered the chicken. First time I ordered fish, I must say it was delicious. Very light and not greasy with lots of veggies. As for the chicken, very moist and wasn't dry.

Our server was very sweet and took the time to explain to me what the petrale was when I inquired.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
My friends and I had a great time dining at Bistro Aix. It turns out that we were running late so I had one of my friends call the restaurant to ask if we could bump our reservation back a half hour because of traffic. The woman on the phone said of course and then thanked us for letting her know. Being nice is not lost in San Francisco. 

After we finally arrived, we were asked where we would like to sit. I thought that was nice. My friends and I all got the leg of lamb with the potatoes gratin. It was so delicious. The meat melted in your mouth and the potatoes had a great flavor to them with a crunchy top. We all inhaled our food. 

I didn't get our server's name but it was a nice woman with red hair. She was helpful when my friend asked for her opinion about entree choice and she was attentive without being overbearing to our table. 

For dessert we got the creme brûlée and chocolate pudding. Both desserts were amazing. I'm used to creme brûlée being a little thicker than creamier, but I understand that various places make it differently. I loved the chocolate pudding! The chocolate pudding tasted more like dark chocolate than milky, which I don't normally go for. However, this one was the perfect topper to our dinner. 

Overall, we had a great experience and would definitely come back to try other entrees and desserts!
author: Chantalle B.

description:
Pretty solid and delicious food. My party was running a little behind and the staff was so accommodating and attentive, which I really appreciated. The baked brie was phenomenal and the deviled eggs were good, but nothing really special. I ordered the short rib bourguignon, which was good, but could have been a little less dry. We also ordered the Ravioli De Mer, Steelhead Trout, and X Burger which were all solid. 

Great ambience and overall good food. Great date night, happy hour, or even dinner party spot. Ample seating and the staff is very friendly and attentive.
author: Linda S.

description:
Food here is outstanding. Incredibly fresh! Literally the best steamed green beans we have ever had! Everyone was going nuts over them, which says a lot considering they were just green beans! Lol. 
Olive tree in the middle of the back dining room creates a lovely atmosphere. 
Wine program is great. Nice representation of some reallt fun, lesser know French appellations versus the typical, very expensive ones - kind of refreshing! 
I would have loved to give them 5 stars, but the service was lacking during the first hour of our dining experience. Everything else was great!
author: Heather H.

description:
Enjoyed a dinner here with family on the weekend
The back patio is enclosed and is very beautiful 
The prices are $$$ 
The portions for appetizers are meant for two people
They only serve wine and beer in alcohol selection
The two private restrooms have frosted glass and can make you feel your rivalry has been compromised ,but I assure you that no one can actually see thru

2 appetizers
4 dinners
5 glasses of wine
3 beers
2 Ice creams  
3 coffees
 $360 including tip
author: Andrew G.

description:
This little gem is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Tucked in the Marina District you will find this quaint, yummy and relaxing bistro. We have celebrated many birthdays here with our large family and the service is consistently friendly and the food never fails.  

I hate to share as I don't want it to get too crowded, but I have to as they deserve the praise.
author: Cheryl R.

description: Cozy seating, dim lighting, just the right amount of noise and of course- really delicious food make this place a great spot.
author: Ari A.

description:
Pretty neat place. Was looking for places to eat and Yelp steered me towards Aix.
I went in at around 7PM on a Saturday trying to just get a table for 4, but looks like they were busy that night and had nothing until at least 8:45. I was about to give up, until the hostess said we could eat at the bar and there were two people who were about to leave which opened up 4 seats. Score! 

Although this place is labeled as a "French" restaurant, I do see some Italian dishes and influences. Pastas like a spaghettini and squid ink spaghetti.

We started with the tempura fried calamari served with an asian slaw. The slaw reminded me a lot of vietnamese pickled slaw and was tart and refreshing. The calamari was crispy and went well with the slaw. 
My wife ordered the squid ink pasta and I opted for the burger. 
The squid ink pasta was flavorful and briny, but it is on the salty side. My wife couldn't finish the whole dish because it got a bit too overwhelming. It is good, but maybe a dish to share or at least have some bread with.
The burger was served naked, with the lettuce and tomatoes on the side. I got the burger medium rare and they cooked it to the right temperature. It was maybe a slight bit too charred though as I tasted some of that bitterness from charred meat. Sitting at the bar, I could peek a bit into the kitchen and saw they use a wood fire grill for at least some of the dishes. 

The spaghettini looked delicious and I want to try it the next time I come back.
author: Lan N.

description:
Called to place a pick-up order tonight and was told by "John" that they were too busy to take my order.  What the heck is up with that??  My husband and I have been been placing pick-up orders from here for a few years now (we both work late) and have never been told this.  Yes, sometimes there's a lengthy wait but we've never been told that they can't accept orders when they're busy.  Sounds like a lazy employee who just made that up... 

Time to find a new restaurant with better customer service.  This place (food and service) has never been that special anyways.
author: E M.

description:
This is such a cute restaurant! It's a nice date spot. If you're ever here, ask to be seated at the back because it's a lot nicer back there due to the stringed lights they have up. 

The food was a great size (not too big and not too small). My Husband and I shared the butter lettuce and goat cheese salad.  it was a perfect size when split.  We followed it up with the angel hair pasta. Lots of shrimp and a perfect flavor profile.  Both options paired really well with the Rose that we picked. Super happy with our decisions.  

We chose to not have desert but I am sure it would have been just as wonderful as well.  

A new favorite spot and we will make this one of our spots next time were in the city.
author: Marie S.

description: First meal I had in San Francisco and it was really nice.  The atmosphere is fun, especially in the back room which is cozy.  I ordered the Burrata and Roasted Eggplant appetizer and the Spaghettini as my entree.  Both choices were delicious.  The sauce on the Spaghettini was just really delicious and made the simple dish taste better than your usual spaghetti and marinara.  Staff was very friendly and I definitely recommend!
author: Carrie F.

description: Love this place.  Good food, wine options and service.  It's one of my "go-to" neighborhood favorites.
author: Mike B.

description: I search high and low for squid ink pasta . And I found a good one here. The salmon apps were also exquisite. Love the patio area.
author: Jango L.

description: This place is outstanding.  Probably the best Spaghetti with Tomato sauce in the city if not Italy.  The prices for the ambiance, quality and service are unreal.  Each I've been here I've had an outstanding experience and can't wait to go back.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
I just love this place!
All dishes are perfectly executed and the wine list is superb.
author: Liz B.

description: Went on a date here last Friday night and was happily surprised by the ambiance and food. They have a few tables in the front dining room and an indoor patio in the back with romantic lighting and a tree wrapped in christmas lights. We had the grilled octopus with garlic, shallots, citrus and yukon potatoes for our starter. This was the best octopus dish I've ever had and I'm glad that we asked for recommendations on what to order because it was well worth it. For our main entrees we had the top sirloin with bernaise sauce, salad, and shoestring fries, and the seared ahi in a spicy port sauce. Both dishes were exceptionally well cooked and every element of the dish complemented each other. I would definitely return here again!
author: Alysia W.

description:
Oh My God. DELICIEUX!
   This is a little restaurant that reminds you of those amazing ones you find in Europe. The gnocchi is absolutely the best I have ever had (including when I lived in Italy) and they pair it will lightly cooked tomatoes that literally burst in your mouth. My husband and I will definitely be regulars here!
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
Stopped in for a drink at the bar. Very friendly staff, cute ambience. 

From that experience alone, would come back for dinner/drinks here.
author: Siv L.

description:
While I have started to write reviews for Yelp, last night was the first time I followed the advice on yelp and I'm glad I did, Bistro Aix was extremely enjoyable.

It's was steady but not packed and we were seated right away in the back room, a lovely, well-lit area with a tree in the middle and a open glass ceiling. We waited a few moments, just starting to wonder where our server was and then the waiter appeared, he immediately apologized for being late. Nice touch. We ordered two glasses of wine, two appies and a main to share. The waiter recommended having one appy, then the second with the main as the flavors complimented each other, we agreed to his strategy.

Within minutes the first appy (and highly recommended on yelp) of Calamari (tempura battered & served with Asian Slaw) arrived and it was excellent. Tender calamari, crisp batter, with a hint of spice and fresh slaw underneath - wonderful.

At this point my wife hit her wine glass with her elbow and knocked over half the glass onto the table, the waiter quickly arrived with towels to help clean it up. He immediately asked if she would like another glass - she declined.

The mains arrived moments later and both were fantastic. The Potato Gnocchi with Chanterelle Mushrooms, Peas & Sage Brown Butter was sublime and the Zucchini Flowers with herbed Ricotta, Fava Beans and Tomato Sauce were exceptional but the portion size was a tad small. However, the waiter was right, these flavors really complimented each other.

For dessert, my wife ordered the Blueberry & Peach Pie with Vanilla Gelato, it was okay but I am not a fan of peach pie, that aside, the fruit was fresh, the crust was flaky and the gelato was tops.

At the end of the meal when all was said and done, the waiter arrived and informed us that my wife's wine had been removed from the bill - another nice touch!

Overall an excellent meal accompanied by excellent service. Bistro Aix made a great first impression and I look forward to another meal there soon.
author: G C.

description:
Came for my anniversary. Reservation for two at 7:30 on a Friday and my table was ready for me without wait when I arrived at 7:25. Perfect.

Water already set up at the table. Perfect.

Attentive server, I forget her name, but she checked up on us just enough to make sure we were taken care of but not bothered. Came back to refill waters for us without us needing to ask. Perfect.

We ordered calamari, a duck dish, and a lamb dish. The duck was perfect. Full of flavor and juicy goodness. The lamb was... ok. It was a bit dry. Calamari was good.

Enjoy the garden like atmosphere in the back but I got to hear 4 tables conversations simultaneously. 

4 stars.
author: Paul C.

description:
Came in for a birthday dinner for the gf. The ambiance is fantastic. The patio outside is perfectly lit and feels very cozy. 

The food was pretty good. We had an asparagus and fennel salad, the spaghetti ink pasta, and the potato gnocchi. I was surprised that the prices were pretty reasonable for a French restaurant. The other dinner options seemed very tasty, and I would consider trying some other dishes.

The wine selection is excellent. 

The service was lacking. It took a solid 20 mins to be asked what we wanted to drink...and there was no wait when we sat down. I was hoping for better service for a special dinner. 

In the end, it's a good place in a good area. It is reasonably priced, has a vibrant menu, and certainly has the ambiance down perfectly. Service was mediocre at best, and our specific dishes were good-not great.
author: James O.

description:
I've been here only twice, I hope that still makes this review worthwhile.
Both times, the food was FANTASTIC/AMAZING/OFF-THA-HOOK/etc.  Service was attentive yet not-snooty, great wines; and the vibe was pretty classy but not uppity.

Apps were 6(!) stars out of 5; main courses were 4-5 stars out of 5; desserts were 5 stars out of 5.  Their tarte tatin is one of the top 5 best desserts ever.

I loved Bistro Aix the first time I went; I loved it even more the second time I went.

Could be a great place to take a date, or just to hang with old friends.  They do a really great job -- I am surprised that more folks don't know about this place.
author: David P.

description:
This place has great ambiance and food! With that classic California cuisine, Bistro Aix is one of my go to restaurants for taking people that are visiting from out of town. The food is consistently good and really delivers on all levels in terms of food, ambiance and service.

We started with the fried calamari, which was a perfect size serving for 4. Crispy, light and the salad it came with was fresh as well. For my entree I had the chicken. I cannot say how amazing this was. The number one issue with chicken is being dry, Bistro Aix delivered a moist boneless piece of chicken that melted in your mouth. Outstanding! 

If you are looking for quality food in the Marina area definitely check this spot out!
author: Alex L.

description:
We sat down at the bar kinda hungry but not starving which means that my palate is likely to be attentive without being self deprecating, an important point to make when offering a 5 star review as even a tuna sandwich without mayonaise can taste good when one is starving.  I asked the bar tender "what's good?"  He responded, "Well if I was eating tonight, I would have etc etc etc.

Our mouths were truly in a rapturous orgasmic moment and I had to keep asking myself, "How is a $8 bowl of soup making me feel this good?"

Screw the wine by the glass, this place is deserving of a bottle, a nice Kermit Lynch selection I might add. We ate and drank, did several OMG's and left feeling as if we finally found a place that we couldn't wait to come back to. And that for me is rare.

Ces't bon!
author: MandM P.

description: Bistro Aix is delicious! It is pricey, but incredible spot for a date or fancy dinner. I highly recommend the duck pasta dish, and pro tip - ask for a table on the back indoor covered patio, it's amazing.
author: Clay P.

description:
How have I not reviewed this place before? This place is my go to for group dinners, last minute parent dinners, work dinners, etc. The service, menu, and ambiance are all fantastic for any occasion. Great extensive wine list, accommodating staff.

Highlights for me are the burrata appetizer, the octopus, and the Ahi entree (SO GOOD). Love the back patio!
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Great food and good service! I loved the squid ink pasta! My favorite spot in SF! I would def come back here if I could.
author: Dimitri L.

description:
OUTSTANDING SERVICE

The food at Bistro AIX is perfectly fine, not over the top, but I'm giving them five stars because of the wonderful service. Ate there for the first time recently with a few friends and had a great experience. 

THE ROOM
Be sure to sit in the back room. It's got a nice, big skylight with a large olive tree beneath it. Nice touch. Comfortable, pleasant ambience. Not way noisy. 

MENU
Something for everyone: meat eaters, fish eaters, sorry - didn't notice veggie options, but I'm sure there's something. If you're an asparagus lover, do not miss the asparagus soup. 

PRICES
Reasonable.  

SERVICE
Again, in a word, outstanding. Our guy was very attentive, but not intrusive, making sure we had everything we needed. Just great. 

Definitely looking forward to my next visit to Bistro AIX.
author: Heres J.

description:
Could not cook a steak to save their lives.  Like literally if the world was invaded by aliens and they were told "Cook this steak properly and we will spare the world, or else we'll obliterate everyone", the world's done for.

I sent an overcooked steak back twice before I just gave up.  Also their so called "14oz" steak is not what'd expect in other restaurants as it is half the thickness of normal steaks.
author: Jerry J.

description:
My friend had chosen this restaurant for her birthday dinner because it was recently listed in the top 100 restaurants in the Bay Area, and I must admit, I'd have to agree with that title. 

At first glance, Bistro Aix appears to be a tiny restaurant that can barely accommodate 20 guests or so, but do not be deceived!--there is a lovely back room decorated with Christmas lights and a tree in the center allowing the restaurant to seat many more guests. I highly recommend making reservations in advance, especially for large groups (though I think they refuse to accommodate any group larger than 8-9). 

As for the food, I'd have to say everything I tried was superbly cooked and had great flavor and texture. I got the leg of lamb and it was absolutely DELICIOUS. I'd definitely recommend that to diners. Others at my table got the New York Steak thinking that would have the most portions, but I think my lamb wins in terms of quantity and quality of our dishes. I also got a taste of my friend's scallop dish and though the scallops were perfect, I had the same complaint that I always do with any scallop dish at any restaurant--there wasn't enough of it!

I'll wrap up my review with one note about their service. Though we had reservations for our party of 8 and we arrived right on time, our table was not ready for us, and to apologize for the 20 minutes that we had to wait, the hostess gave us all a free glass of champagne! Overall it was a pleasant dining experience.
author: Cindy N.

description:
I was a bit disappointed at this place compared to few other bib gourmand restaurants I've been to. 

My date and I were not extremely hungry so we skipped out on appetizers and went for entrees, we didn't see anything that looks amazing from the appetizers. I ordered the paccheri with Maine lobster since the Hawaiian ahi and my second choice of lamb were sold out. My guy went for the his staple, steak.

When our entrees were served, mine looked dinky. Luckily I didn't have much of an appetite that night, otherwise I would be raging. I saw more sauce than pasta or lobster itself. I probably ate like one claw worth of lobster meat with about ten pieces of paccheri pasta. But I was more disappointed about how boring the taste and how poor the presentation were. With such large sized pasta, I would expect the lobster bits and the pancetta to be stuffed inside, so that each bite would capture the taste of its ingredients. The most I could grasp with my fork was some sauce and maybe one piece of pancetta on top of the paccheri. The sauce was pretty decent though. It did bring out that sweet flavor of lobster and adds a tang to the dish. 

I've also tried a bite of my date's steak. It was a bit overcooked for medium rare, which made the steak extremely dried. $20 steak? I'm not really expecting much from the steak itself than from the Chef's ability to turn his ingredients into a piece of delicious art. 

We ordered desserts instead, since we skipped out on appetizers. I had the vanilla bean creme brûlée and he had the strawberry sorbet. My creme brûlée was just at the right amount of sweetness. I do taste the hint of vanilla without it being too overwhelming like next doors at Isa. Taste wise, this one is solid. Presentation wise, again I was disappointed. I was browsing the yelp pictures and saw the creme brûlée served with three star shaped cookies and some mint for decoration. I told my date, this is cute and I'm getting it! When my creme brûlée came, it had no mint, two unequally sized star cookies with one looking normal and the other looking like Patrick from SpongeBob that lost weight in his legs. My date's strawberry sorbet looked more pleasing. It's actually pretty good. Very rich in the fruity flavors, paired with pear bits for greater texture. 

With the goods and bads in the foods, I would rate this place as 3 stars. I'm dropping one for the service. My server was not necessarily rude, but emotionless and not quite helpful. He doesn't check on our table, we were out of water halfway through the meal and he doesn't seem to notice at all. Many times servers would ask if I would like a recommendation or needed help in deciding on what I want, the server doesn't really interact with us too much. Other than "may I take your order" and "would you like the dessert menu?" He's got the basic lines down but hey, if you don't appreciate our business, we're glad to bring it elsewhere.
author: Connie C.

description:
This place is so yummy! It's one of the best places in the Marina for sure. I love the food
and ambiance :)
author: Christine S.

description:
Duck confit and good wine - newly in love with this place.  Great ambiance, really awesome service, and a cozy back patio.  Our reservation was seated a little late which we were not worried about at all but they brought us champagne to make up for the wait...and creme brûlée for dessert. Classy, classy sweethearts.  Will definitely be going back to this place.

(Faux) outdoor seating score: 5
author: E F.

description: Marina hipsters and old school SF unite! It's AIX! I've been here a bunch and it's good but never memorable. A tad squishy interior and too "marina" for me. I liked the food but for the price, I would choose elsewhere if it was a personal decision. Why did I go here? Biz meeting and on the expense report.
author: Matt T.

description:
Superman was here!

I mean, there was a waiter who looks just like Christopher Reeve, Superman, before he fall off from horse, the waiter from East Coast, Boston, very funny guy, he talked to us about English accent because my gf asked him, she is from the same too.

We had:
Tomato Cheese Pizza $12, Cracker Crust Pizza with Tomato, Mozzarella, Fontina and Parmesan was a good for an appetizer.

Lamb $23, great lamb with potato gratin & rosemary jus
Top Sirloin $23, with Friench Fries, Bearnaise Sauce

The Lamb and Steak were both great, nicely done, mouth watering dish.

and

Chocolate Cloud Cake w/ vanilla ice cream $8, I actually cleaned the all chocolate sauce and the melted ice cream by my finger. I was ready to lick it up but my gf said "NO!!!"

Plus 3 glasses of 11 bucks Red Zinfandel.

5 star for everything.

We had a wonderful time.
I want to see the superman again.

Thank you Bistro Aix and the Superman giving us such a great dinner.
author: Nobu K.

description:
This is a cute little spot just off Chestnut. Good food & great service- our server was very nice & very helpful with wine pairings etc.

I ordered the Paccheri al'Amatriciana, which was a delicious pasta preparation. The portion size wasn't huge, but good enough. The smaller portion size did leave room for dessert - which I was totally okay with. We split the Peach Pie for dessert, which was - for lack of a better word- dreamy. 

Would definitely recommend this restaurant, will probably come back again.
author: Yukti G.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night at 8:00PM, and the place was full so I didn't think we had a chance as a walk-in but the hostess told us it would be 5-10 min. I was a little weirded out when she didn't take our name down and just walked away, but she came back a few minutes later and somehow my girlfriend and I were able to be seated immediately. We sat in the back room right next to the tree with all the lights - very cool ambiance that I was not expecting when they took us back there. 

Food was outstanding - the sanoma chicken was possibly the best chicken dish I've had since I can remember - it was cooked perfectly. My GF got the gnocchi, also outstanding. Portions were surprisingly large for a place like this in the city, and prices were totally reasonable given the quality ($15-25 for entrees).  Service was excellent also - our waitress was very helpful with wine and food, funny, and quick. 

Pleasantly surprised on many levels. I would love to come back here and try the other items on the menu!
author: Jon R.

description:
Amazing service and food. I have been to Bistro Aix many times over the years and have never been disappointed. The customer service is great, and I especially love eating in the cozy back room that reminds me of a classy fairy garden. The food is delicious.  Our family's favorites include: 

- Burger 
- Spaghettini 
- Steak Frite 
- Sole 
- Chicken 
- French Fries
- Chocolate Cake 

Overall great service and amazing food will keep us returning to Bistro Aix for the ages.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Love the back area make sure to ask to be seated there! The food is excellent. Tonight we started with the salmon on the heavenly little potatoes just simply delicious. For the main dish I had the pork chop with asparagus risotto - super good but I'm so full you could roll me outta here ha. My BF got the lamb shank an he ate every single piece of food on that plate. It came with potatoes - to die for! There desserts look great but we were too full to consider it 

Tip I'd suggest to management/owner is to have a more approachable host area. Right when you walk in it gets little uncomfortable as no one really address you right away.
author: Jess O.

description: Good wine choices little pricey. Entrees were Delish and the service was swell. Has a great ambiance in the back patio with a stunning olive tree:)
author: Jessica L.

description: Very nice and cliche place. We're visiting from Orange County , CA and we found this place by mistake while walking around the Marina. We had the grilled squid for appetizers and for main course I had the Sonoma Chicken and my wife had the Sirloin steak. We had some white wine with it which was excellent. The food and service was above par and I'll recommend to anyone who gets around this area while visiting San Francisco. Ben was our waiter and he was outstanding. Thank you
author: Alex G.

description: Cannot say enough good things about this place. This was our standard go-to when friends came to visit us in the city, and now that I have moved I realize how over due this review was! Rave reviews for the Sonoma Crispy Chicken Breast (seriously the best chicken I have ever had) and the Hawaiian Ahi Tuna-- cannot go wrong! Special shout out to Roxy, who always makes the visit worth while. You guys rock!!
author: Ian C.

description:
Dined on a Saturday night here and my wife and I were hoping for a great experience since we were in the city to celebrate our anniversary. We had tried the Italian place a few doors down several nights ago, and it was a perfect dinner. So this time we walked down the street looking for somewhere to dine. We saw Bistro Aix, and it looked inviting so we went in. We did not have a reservation, but they weren't that busy and they sat us in the back. Here's the short version:

-As soon as we sat down, we noticed the few other occupied tables being waited on rather attentively by the other staff. We sat there for exactly 10 minutes before we were even offered a drink or any water.

-Our drinks finally came, and we observed our waitress visit the table adjacent to us at least 3 times for things like topping off glasses of champagne, bringing the bill, discussing how to spilt the bill 5 ways because everyone was probably paying with daddy's credit card.. anyway, obviously long wait to take our food order.

-So our waitress finally comes floating over to take our food order. Great. Someone else shortly after brings our food. That is all the service we had for the next 30 minutes. No, "can I bring you another drink" "how is everything tasting/looking/...." "would you like more water?"   Nothing.

-When we were done I finally had to flag her over to ask for the bill. I sarcastically said "I though you forgot about us.." she said, "oh, no, I though you were still eating...." OK.

-We paid. good thing I had cash, so we didn't have to wait. 

-On our way out, we observed the manager/owner/entrepreneur/boss warmly thank a party that was walking out in front of us, and wish them well. Then, he saw us leaving and not as much as a smile or anything as he looked at us and quickly looked away. Nice guy. We left with a bad taste in our mouths. 

So much for the short version.
author: Anthony M.

description: These guys continue to impress. Service staff are pleasant, on it, and knowledgeable, nice atmosphere, and the food is always terrific. Always a good choice for dinner and not super expensive, either.
author: Lance K.

description:
Great food that is made from scratch. The seating in the rear next to the olive tree is amazing. 

This place is always busy so be sure to call in reservations for your party beforehand. I really recommend the beef steak that is cooked in open wood flame also the Sonoma lamb is delicious. 

Bon apatite
author: Adam W.

description:
in all honesty, this should really be a 3.5 bordering 4. 

the food is great depending on what you order. the best of the best include:

- duck breast, not the leg (sometimes on the menu, sometimes not. but definitely worth asking)
- spaghettini - the BEST thing on the menu
- the calamari appetizer (asian infused)
- burger (kobe beef!)
- chocolate cake

all other menu items are kinda.... mediocre. good but mediocre for a town like SF where good food is everywhere. 

my main gripe is the service. it's inattentive (ie - you'll be thirsty all night because you're not getting refills), absent-minded, uninformed, and seems to be a general non-priority. they're not rude, but they're not really living up to the server name either. i think "order taker" and "check giver" is more appropriate.
author: Sammi C.

description: Bistro Aix has a surprisingly pretty atmosphere. It doesn't look like much from the front but the back opens to a pretty "patio".  The food was also delicious. We had the fried calamari as an appetizer and I had the salmon for dinner - both were great.  For dessert we shared the chocolate cake - how can you go wrong with that? Wish it cake with a scoop of ice cream instead of te pile of whipped - but te cake was rich and delicious.  They also had a nice selection of wine and beer.
author: Lanae S.

description:
Had such a nice dinner here! Our group of 4 had a reservation for a Saturday night and were happy to be seated in the back patio. The patio area is really charming with trees and lights, and it seemed a bit quieter than inside. Our server was very knowledgeable about the wine list and helped us select a bottle that ended up being great. Some dishes we had that we especially loved:
- Beet Salad
- Cracker Crust Pizza
- NY Steak
author: Paige D.

description:
There are first dates, in the "this can be seen as a first date if she wants it to be, but hanging out if she doesn't" sense of the word.  Then there are legitimate first dates.  And then second dates.  And then eventually, you realize it's getting sort of serious, and then it is time for the time honored, coming of age, "wake up dude, you gotta do something classier than cider bar crawls and Jurassic Park 3D!" date.  And this, my friends, is what Bistro Aix is made for.

It's equal touches whimsical ("oh look babe, a tree is growing in the back dining room, lololol") and romantic (I mean, the place serves red wine, does it not?).  And it's really, really, really good.  We shared the lamb in a red wine sauce (insane!), and the chicken (really solid), and some desert that I've since forgotten, but it was good.  The service was really, really awkward.  But that is basically on us, since we completely misunderstood where we were supposed to sit, and threw the entire evening's worth of reservations off.  If you have even adequate social skills and directional comprehension, you'll be able to avoid that pitfall and I am sure they will love you.

But ultimately, this is a great hidden find.  Make sure to request the back room (for the whimsy mentioned above) and you are set.
author: James S.

description: Bistro Aix is one of my favorite restaurants. I have never been disappointed with the quality of their food or service. I recommend making a reservation to be seated in the rear dining room. The dining room has a glass roof, not a skylight but a glass roof that is the light source for a thriving Olive Tree growing in the middle of the dining room. It is so rustic and peaceful to be dining next to a large olive tree. We began our meal with a basket of warm focaccia and sour dough bread, and Burrata Salad. I always order the grilled lamb. My guests ordered Squid Ink Spaghetti , Spaghettini, and Grilled Salmon. The servings were ample enough that we all were able to sample each others entree. The presentation of my grilled lamb was fabulous. A bed of deep-fried spinach was garnished over my medallions of perfectly medium lamb in au jus with Au Gratin potatoes. The crusted cheese of my Au Gratin made every bite heavenly. Each bite of my lamb was so flavorful and tender. I could taste the slight mesquite wood smoke from the grille. I told our wait staff that one of our party had a birthday. We decided to share a serving of peach pie ala mode. Our server brought our dessert out with a lit candle. Our birthday guest was very pleased with the extra touch. The wait staff is attentive, and helpful making recommendations or describing the entrees. I would not hesitate to recommend Bistro Aix to all my friends for an enjoyable dinning experience. Parking is not easy to find so allow yourself extra time or catching a taxi or public transit. The 22, 28, and 30 buses will bring you almost to the doorstep.
author: Kailey W.

description:
We were five couples for dinner on a Saturday night. We were seated promptly which was a good sign. We sat out in the enclosed patio. 

For starters, we had two orders of the deep friend calamari to be shared among the 10 of us. My hubby and I split an heirloom tomato salad, and we had individual entrees - He had the grilled ahi tuna over mashed potatoes, and I had the roasted chicken with red potatoes. I never order chicken when dining out, but was glad I did. Cooked to perfection, and very moist and tasty. Hubby enjoyed the flavors on his.. 

None of us had dessert or coffee. We did share 3 bottles of wine. 

Bread baskets brought out and refilled. 

Our server was great. Very attentive. Water came in clear bottles, and refilled as needed too. 

Comments - long gap in between our starters and respective entrees. Felt like 1/2 hour. The patio somewhat noisy.  The food unlike tradtional French cuisine.  Wished we were able to taste the desserts, but homemade dessert awaited us at home.

$500.00 inc. tax & tip. 




.
author: Shirley N.

description:
I can't imagine a better restaurant when you're in the mood for pasta and wine. Came here with a group of eight and we were seated in the back patio area. Very cute!

I made the mistake of ordering the burger. The burger itself wasn't bad per say, but I was immediately disappointed with my order when I had a taste of what the other girls ordered! How can plain ole pasta, particularly spaghetti be so good?? There wasn't even any protein in the dish!

FYI, if you and your girlfriends are small eaters, they will split the pasta for you . This way, you can share an appetizer or two. =)
author: Msha D.

description: Came here for a friend's birthday and all of us had a great time. The food is amazing! We only had appetizers with drinks and they were beyond delicious. The dressing and the sauces they use are incredible. I'll definitely be back again. The staff was also very friendly.
author: Narina A.

description:
We had our latest dinner club here and the main question we had to ask was how to pronounce the name of the restaurant.  Aix is is pronounced as X so that was good to know.  We were with four people and we shared everything we had all night long.  We started with the blue shrimp and butter lettuce salad.  Four our main meals we shared the ahi tuna, crab spaghetti, halibut or trout (I forget) and beer sausage.  Everything was pretty tasty and my favorite was the crab spaghetti.  As sides we got the brussel sprouts but I was too much of a fan and the red mashed potatoes but they actually weren't red at all.  For dessert we had the tartin and chocolate cake.

The atmosphere was pretty cool and had a bigger back area than I would have though.  Our service was so-so though.  We had to ask multiple times for bread while others tables were just given it without asking and our waiter never came around to ask about a second round of drinks.  In fact we didn't see him again until the end of the night because the hostess took our dessert order.
author: Blake B.

description: Although we had a reservation for 8pm, they seated us at 8:20 and the host didn't even offer an apology. On top of that, the barman was very rude to my fiancee and her mother. To their credit, they offered an appetizer for free. But that does not change the facts. On another note, the food is mediocre, and definitely not worth the high price.
author: Tasos N.

description: Made a res on yelp since Open Table couldn't take it 40mins before arrival. When we arrived at Bistro Aix there was a line out the door. After connecting w the hostess she seated us right away in a table in the back room(this is only where you want to sit to dine in my opinion) w the tree of life. We opted out of the calamari even though every table seemed to be feasting on it. We had the cheese plate w 3 different cheeses, apple & pear & the most delicious warm nut bread that had honey dripped upon the whole plate. We also got the smoked salmon on croquettes - I felt the croquettes were too crunchy but my foodie teenagers & husband disagreed. The duck confit was absolutely devine w delicious spices - I licked the dish clean. Husband's squid pasta was spicy & truly eye appealing - squid was fresh. My boy had the lamb cooked to perfection & daughter had the gnocchi which was tiny gnocchi w sundried tomatoes, mushrooms and a light sauce. Wine selection was great w CA, Spanish & French and reasonable. Chelsea was delightful as our server, knowledgeable and friendly even in the rush. She too, kept a smile at the beginning when she had to let us know all of the menu items that they were out of - she continued the list & even longer to the table next to us when they sat. Come early if you seek something that is popular - as it's all made FRESH! & isn't that how it should be when we eat!!!
author: Deirdre M.

description:
this place is so awesome!  Came here for the BF's mom's bday on a Saturday night.  It was packed of course, and a few of us were running late since parking in the marina is such a nightmare.  the staff was understanding and still checked on us despite the whole party not being present. 

definitely ask for bread! it's made in house and served with really good olive oil. after destroying 2 baskets of bread we decided to skip apps... we ordered the lamb, short rib, ahi tuna & halibut.  all of the dishes were so simple but so good! everything had so much flavor but the seasonings weren't overpowering.  everything tasted fresh and their selection of wine is great.

we ordered the apple tarte and creme brulee for dessert--im not a huge fan of sweets but they were delicious!
author: Jen D.

description: This is a great restaurant. The food is creative, delicious and beautifully presented. We were treated well by our server, and special dietary needs were accommodated. Excellent wine list.
author: Larry M.

description:
Everything was delicious! Not cheap, but delicious none the less. 

 After trying to yelp a bunch of 5 star restaurants around the city, we finally stumbled in here after seeing their nice styling. It was a happy accident; everybody absolutely loved their food. I'd be back if I was a local for sure.
author: Justin K.

description: The food at Bistro Aix is delicious and not too expensive (for a french restaurant). The pork chop was great! The scallops I thought was just okay, it had a too overwhelming bitter taste to it from the grill, but the risotto that came with it was very good. For desserts, we had the creme brulee and loved it! Smooth and delicious!!
author: Claire S.

description:
Fries ($5) and aioli were both just okay. Fries could be crispier or tossed with some parsley. Or something. I don't know. They were lacking. 

Farm fresh tagliatelle with coq au riesling ($18) was okay.  I didn't get why the pasta had artichokes in it.  You only eat the heart of the artichoke, not leaves.  They had one heart and then the rest of it was sprinkled with leaves, which I then had to dig around and take out.  The chicken was okay, the pasta was good, I was just over the dish by the time I was done with the artichokes.

I wouldn't mind coming back to give this place another chance, despite this first stumble.

Our waiter looked like a young Dana Harvey.
author: Erika C.

description:
Amazing dinner! We had reservations so got seated at the back area, which had real trees and fairy lights throughout. 

I had the Hawaiian ahi entree and my hubby ordered the sirloin. Both dishes were scrumptious. Followed with a decadent dessert of peach & blueberry pie and chocolate cake. Both were delicious. 

I'll be back for sure. Great wine list, good service and delicious food. 5 stars!
author: jenn s.

description:
My sister took us here for the celebration of her husband's (my brother in laws) b-day.

We split some apps..The margarita pizza was AMAZING..really truly amazing...I suspect there was garlic oil on the pies, the crust was crisp and thin....ohhhhhh I'm dreaming of it now.   CRAZY GOOD.  Calamari- also excellent., and the fois gras also good, but really not as good as the others.

My bf & I split the steak and the lamb entrees. For me - the lamb killed it, better meat, better side.YUM.

Desserts did not disappoint. we split 4: ice cream, berries, fruit tart and choc cake....can't choose - sophie's choice - all super yummy.
author: Amy W.

description: In short food was good, entrees not hot, but warning...service is awful!  Not attentive, brisk and short, never asked if we were happy with entrees...etc.  there are MUCH better options in this town!
author: Fritz L.

description:
This restaurant was recommended by a friend of my lovely wife and I am truly grateful to Dinah.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal, the wait staff and decor.

We got stuck into the wine straight away and the French rosé was delightfully refreshing.  I do prefer French rosé but would welcome any Yelper's US rosé recommendation.

We selected Baby Lettuce and baby gem lettuce with carrot and avocado salads.  Both were tasty although we both preferred the baby gem offering most probably due to the vinaigrette and avocado.  And we know this because we swapped salads at the half-way point.

I snuck in between starter salad and main course a pasta dish, Paccheri amatriciana.  My darling partner helped and loved each and every bite, as did I.

Although we found the pairing of grilled rare Hawaiian Ahi tuna with mashed potatoes a bit strange, this did not stop my better half from enjoying the perfectly cooked Tuna and quaffing down the delicious mash.

Petrale sole was the itch I wanted to scratch and Bistro AIX did a fine job.  I've never before seen or eaten the green, sand dollar pasta plated with my sole but it was quite a welcome addition.

We will return, we will return, oh, we will return.
author: Jay D.

description:
Dined here with my gf for her birthday.  Both our first times and we totally enjoyed it.  It's in a cute part of the Marina next to other eateries.

To start we shared the Heirloom tomato salad & Tagliatelle w/ English peas & truffle butter sauce.  For dinner we also shared the Seared Ahi w/ Fried Spinach and Wild Salmon & Corn Risotto. We finished with chocolate flour cake & apricot glazed panna cotta.

We liked our appetizer/starters and dinner entrees much more than dessert.
author: Aurelie N.

description:
Visiting the area & decided to try the place since many yelp users seemed to love it. 

I have nothing bad to say about it!! It was beautiful! I went to the back seating area where I sat under dim light next to a beautiful tree that was wrapped in lights. 

Our food took a little while, but that was okay-we were distracted by a starter of yummy bread and calamari! It was to die for. I loved the touch of lemon and cilantro the cook topped the calamari with...it's like he knew I was coming!! Hehe. 

Our waiter was excellent! I forgot his name unfortunately but the service was great. Cute place to go on a date. Especially if you sit in the back where the tree is!
author: Jessica J.

description:
Great neighborhood spot, but with food quality that can compete with much more expensive places.

Very casual atmosphere, but they have some great items:

Salad with breaded goat cheese. - Some of the best goat cheese I have ever tasted.
Their olive oil tastes so fresh. I hate to use the word grassy, but it has the essence of grass, which sounds gross but it tastes amazing.
Their ahi tuna (I know not french) is spectacular.
The lamb always kills it as well.

Definitely would recommend for anyone that wants a casual meal that will really hit the spot.
author: Ryan M.

description: My favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  I could eat the Hawaiian ahi every night...my mouth is watering just thinking about it!  Delicious food, beautiful atmosphere and a great staff, not to be missed.
author: Bridget C.

description:
YOU NEED TO GO HERE. SERIOUSLY. 

It's not too often that I visit a SF Chronicle Top 100 restaurant. 

I found Bistro Aix on yelp. My trust in my fellow yelpers led me to a gem. 

I don't think I have ever been to a restaurant that had such amazing food for such a great value. I was so happy with the food that if the bill had been twice as much I wouldn't have thought twice about the cost (which I never find myself saying). 

For starters, I had the house focaccia. AMAZING. It was so good I had 3 helpings of it. I asked and they told me they bake it in-house. Damn, I wish they sold it. 

I had the Mesclun Green Salad With Tarragon Vinaigrette (with Warm Breaded Goat Cheese). The salad was good but it was the breaded goat cheese that made it spectacular. I swear I almost asked him to round up five more orders of the goat cheese. 

For my entree I had the  Grilled Top Sirloin with Maitre 'd Butter, French Fries and Watercress Salad. It has been years since I have had meat this good for such an great value. I had it medium well and it was perfect. The portion was medium sized and it only left me wanting more. Simply amazing. 

For my dessert I had the Tahitian Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee with Aniseed Cookies. I wasn't fond of the cookies (which came on the side) but the creme brulee was very good. I can't say that I can tell the difference between average and great creme brulee, but it was definitely tasty. 

The tab for two with one glass of wine was around $80. 

I definitely suggest the $23 prix fixe menu. 

I can't recommend this place enough. I will DEFINITELY be going back. 
A great place for a nice date.  


Pics here: http://flickr.com/photos/calmenda/sets/72157604000729208/
author: Carlos A.

description:
I've been looking forward to dining here, and I was not disappointed. We made reservations and got seats around the back patio tree. The lighting was great, and the service was friendly and unpretentious.

The bread and olive oil were a good start. Boyfriend had beet salad with spinach and goat cheese. I had route farms romaine with warm breaded goat cheese. I had half of my salad stolen away by Boyfriend but what I had was delicious! Warm breaded goat cheese was amazing.

Boyfriend's roast chicken was tender and moist, but he was hungry for more. My spaghettini seemed like a safe choice, and it amazed me. The pasta was just the right amount of al dente, and sauce had an amazing flavor. Just the right sauce to pasta ratio to cover each bite without smothering it.

Dessert was a flourless chocolate "cloud" cake which disappeared way too fast. A great dinner and date night!
author: Victoria C.

description:
An exceptional experience. My partner and I arrived in the evening, about 15 minutes before the restaurant opened for dinner. They enthusiastically greeted us, seated us, brought us water and bread, and told us the kitchen would open in a few minutes. It was a good beginning and we were happy.

The bread was wonderful. The salad was wonderful. Everything tasted fresh and well-prepared. I ordered gnocchi, and found it unlike other gnocchi, which is always one of my favorite dishes. It wasn't bad at all, just not prepared the way I anticipated. 

At one point, our waiter, Ben, asked us how our food was. I was honest about the gnocchi. Ben tried very hard to get me to order something else instead. I resisted and ate the gnocchi, because I truly do love gnocchi, and I didn't hate this. We were having a very enjoyable experience. After dinner, drinks, and dessert, Ben brought our bill, with the gnocchi removed. It was definitely not necessary to do that, but it was a gracious example of what the service and experience had been at Bistro Aix. We will be returning soon.
author: Marc J.

description:
Occasion: July 4th Dinner with Neil 

What I Had:  Crispy Roasted Sonoma Chicken Breast with Baby Red Potatoes, Blue Lake Green Beans & Jus

Food Review: Reasonably priced and high quality chicken. The plate overall was a bit sodium-heavy for my liking and could be better balanced by perhaps sweet (maybe dried berries or sweet corn?), but overall, I was a fan. 

Service Review: Service was splendid. Our waiter was very helpful with wine selection and was knowledgeable on house wines. 

Venue Review: Small restaurant, but convenient parking in that there is not only street parking (although rather sparse) and a parking garage a block away. 

Overall Impression: One of the better rotisserie chickens I've had in this price range, and loved the green bean pairing. Best for dinner with a small party of 2-4.
author: Rachael K.

description:
There is no shortage of corner cutting in today's world, especially with a tumultuous economy such as this. That being said, I still like to think that we all deserve a little something special on our birthdays free of charge. I remember the heyday of free desserts for turning another year older- even Red Robin servers used to bring out a tray bearing a slice of cake far too big for its recipient. That's how it SHOULD be. Now, you're lucky if, as the waitress at Bistro Aix said, they can "scrounge up a candle" and stick it into the dessert that still winds up on the bill at the end of the night. Real generous. 

Okay, I'm done complaining. Yes, I had to shell out $8 for a birthday dessert, but the food and service were truly stellar. I ordered a beet and spinach salad with a tangy orange dressing and a bean soup and sauteed spinach and garlic for my entree. The soup was a bit on the salty side for me, but I generally leave out the NaCl with my personal cooking so I am a bit more sensitive than most when it comes to that taste. 

Their menu featured pastas, salads, appetizers (including a really good calamari) and desserts, the establishment was clean and not too crowded or loud, and the service was great. The end.
author: Marisa M.

description: To me, one of the great features of SF's food scene over time is the character and quality of it's neighborhood restaurants.  Bistro Aix is a great example, where the staff is casual yet attentive ... the food boasts a local and contemporary twist on classic bistro fare ... and the wine list is creative and interesting.  Cozy with plenty of repurposed wood - it's not surprising that locals adore this place, and it's also well worth the journey even when not convenient.  Kudos!  PS ... our favorites were the grilled figs, duck confit w/ mint pesto, and halibut:)
author: Dave P.

description:
What a great little restaurant. 

It was on my friend's "to-try" list, and I'm glad it was. My two girlfriends and I were in for a (relatively) early dinner, as a last hurrah before some ridiculous wine exam the following day. 

Service was superb, and we shared a number of dishes. All were fabulous. The wine list was also fantastic - not too long, but definitely with enough variety to keep me interested in trying a few glasses. 

The back enclosed patio was charming, if not a little humid. I would definitely return for another lovely meal.
author: Ingrid C.

description: I enjoyed dinner there yesterday with friends, the food was excellent, so fresh and tastes great. The are first courses mostly were great. The service was also outstanding. This is the best meal we had here in SF.
author: Ran H.

description: My husband and I enjoyed this our evening here.  There are two dining areas of which one is quiet and romantic in the back while the front bar/table area is more lively.  We wanted music so we opted to sit in the front.  Ordered a bottle of wine and the salmon appetizer which was delicious but the toast underneath was too drenched in oil for my liking.  He ordered the pork  which was flavorful but was a bit tough and I ordered the Sonoma Chicken which was cooked perfectly.  Very moist!  The waiter was wonderful and after inquiring whether we enjoyed our entrees, they comped a dessert for the tough pork.  Thank you.  We appreciate the great service.
author: Jan W.

description: Their offerings are consistently good.  I've had the kobe beef Hamburger, cracker crust crust pizza, ahi tuna, cheese plate, pork chop, butter bean soup and about four of their salads.  I generally sit at the bar rather than getting a table. The staff is really cool and the wine list is great. They always help me find the right wine pairing for my meal. I highly recommend Bistro Aix!  I would eat there every day if I could.
author: Wayne S.

description:
I have been going to Bistro for the last few months since moving to the Marina and have totally fallen in love with the place. It's the perfect, cozy neighborhood spot and it has the feeling of being somewhere familiar. I have noticed over my last few visits that there is a strong "regular" presence which obviously speaks to the staff and the owner. Servers are chatty, friendly and knowledgeable and the attitude is casual yet professional.

As far as food goes, it's great. Simple, sophisticated and fresh. I have yet to have something that I didn't enjoy.  Some of my favorites are the roasted chicken and the halibut with the corn fondue. On top of the food, if you are at all interested in wine, you have to check out their list. It's incredible, totally reasonable and has tons of French and European bottles. 

I've noticed a few scathing reviews of this place, and to be honest, I don't get it. It's a small, bistro-style place with great food and friendly people. I guess if you're expecting something different then you would be disappointed, but if you come in wanting to be treated like a friend, then that is what you will get.
author: Emily G.

description:
I keep coming back to this place.  I don't know why.  Perhaps it's because of the coziness of the place.  The service is very good.  They make great suggestions.  And they even tell you that you've ordered enough for 3 people (we probably would've just kept ordering).

Their menu changes all the time.  Some items that the ingredients are readily available you'll always see on the menu.  But many things you may not see it the next time you're there. 

My favorite would be the fried calamari.  the sauce is wonderful.
Sardines (seasonal) is the best I've ever tasted.
Dungeness crab and angel hair is my favorite (also seasonal).

The have a pretty good wine list to go with their good food.
author: Philip T.

description:
Love the ambience of this place! Especially the tree with lights in the middle of the room. Prices and portions are decent and reasonable. 
Appetizer: cured salmon- this was the highlight of our meal! I would definitely recommend this. 
Entrees: short rib- tender, juicy and nicely seasoned 
Leg of lamb- the potatoes on the side were so creamy. Probably the best I've ever had. The lamb was cooked to perfection. I can't think of anything I'd change about it.
Dessert: chocolate cloud cake. I was expecting more based on all the reviews. However, it was delicious and I loved that it was light and not too sweet. 
I will definitely be coming back here the next time I'm in the city!
* get reservations as it does get very crowded *
author: A C.

description: Great food. Really great service and the back room is amazing with the olive tree and skylight.
author: Kristin K.

description: Came here on a Friday night and it was packed! A lot of people were waiting around drinking wine and waiting for a table. Luckily, my party made reservations and were seated right away. We ordered the pork chop, lamb, and ahi. The best part of ordering different dishes with your friends, is that you get to try out all the dishes! Everything was cooked perfectly, my favorite was the lamb. For dessert we got the creme brule and chocolate cake, both definitely satisfied our sweet tooth. Service was awesome and I would come back again to try out other things on their menu!
author: Sarah S.

description: I come up on vacation a couple of times a year, and have been doing so for 20+ years. Went there tonight and had the best Frisco meal in quite a while.  Asparagus salad and gnocchi, while not traditionally Italian (not soft and puffy) were exceptional. Wife loved homemade tagliatelle with beef bourgignone. (Who can spell this?) and vanilla creme brûlée (thicker harder shell with a very creamy vanilla pudding)!  Great service from the one guy who says cheers!
author: Ed A.

description: Ate here while vacationing with our children (ages 8 and 9).  The staff was very friendly and not at all snobby about seating us for an early dinner with the kids on a Saturday night.  Our kids are adventurous eaters so we had fun.  Everything we tried was excellent and the service was top notch.  The blueberry peach pie for dessert was a highlight. Highly recommended (and we are picky!)
author: Kim V.

description:
5 stars for the food, 3 stars for the service...thus the 4 star average.

We had an 8pm reservation and were offered a bar style table close to the front door crowd. Disappointed that the back patio was reserved for a party that night. We declined the initial table and said we'd wait for an actual one.  

Soon after we were seated and immediately ordered drinks. The waiter was great offering suggestions on how to pair wine with our dishes, but the service was off throughout the meal. Had to ask for the infamous bread after our first app had arrived, and the waiter basically asked me if "decided?" from the bar where he was standing (a solid 5-6 steps away from our table.) He seemed really short and somewhat cold with us unless talking about wine, almost like he couldn't be bothered. 

The timing of our food was really inconsistent too, we got the first app right away and then waited a fairly long time before receiving the second, and then again for the entrees. 

The burrata app wasn't as exciting as I had read it would be. The pizza however was delish! Piping hot, thin crust with great texture, and a great showcase of cheese.

The salmon was also an evening favorite, the corn risotto makes me want to whip out my arborio and chicken stock.  The sirloin was ok, probably not something we'd order again. 

Happy to have tried the food but would have swapped out the customer service for what we got next door at Isa :)
author: Brianna M.

description:
Don't know what all the bad reviews are for. This place is amazing and you DEFINITELY need a reservation otherwise your not eating her.  Do yourself a favor and have their Spaghetti! It might seem like the simplest item on the menu but it reminded me of Roman pasta! Their salads and desserts are great too.

Wonderful, Romantic, Date Spot!. Always packed so book a table early!
author: Farheen M.

description:
Bistro Aix was a wonderful place to celebrate my 25th birthday. It's a mature yet trendy spot, obviously fitting. We sat out on the back porch, which is cozy and intimate - perfect for a birthday date. 

We enjoyed a bottle of wine, and started with the asparagus and fennel salad. I thought it was light, fresh, and very tasty, although not something I would necessarily rave about. For an entree I ordered the squid ink spaghetti, which I really enjoyed. It was unique and flavorful, but I can't accurately describe it beyond that. Try it for yourself! We finished off with an order of creme brulee, which also did not disappoint. 

The service was ok, but not fantastic. This seemed to be a common theme on my trip to San Francisco, so maybe I'm just used to servers being a bit friendlier and attentive. Of course I don't want someone checking in and interrupting my conversation all the time, but an occasional "how is everything?" is generally appreciated. 

Lastly, I found the bathroom setup a bit strange. There are individual toilets and communal sinks located in the walkway between the restaurant and outdoor patio. (If you have to fix your makeup or pop a zit, do it at home!) To me this felt a bit more like a club than an upscale restaurant. 

Overall, this is somewhere I would recommend for a nice date. The prices were reasonable and I thought the portions were appropriate (although my boyfriend disagrees and left hungry).
author: Heather F.

description: Great food, even better service.  I can't believe there were so many complaints about the service.  Our waitress was wonderful, couldn't ask for more.  In fact they forgot one of our sides (not really a big deal) and they ended up comping it.  Also our entrees were pretty much ready in 5 minutes.  I've never gotten food that fast.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Thursday night. No reservation. Thanks for taking us in. Even though we did have to wait about 30-40 minutes. 

Lovely ambiance, perfect date spot. WIDE wine selection.

Food: I ordered the leg of lamb. The meat was a bit too chewy for my liking. 

The pasta with tomato was on point.

In my opinion, the portions are perfect.
author: Dia J.

description:
This is a solid dinner spot. It has a lively yet romantic atmosphere - we liked the front bar area with people coming and going and then of course the back room was quieter and had great ambiance. All in all, this is a great place to come with friends to share a glass of wine and some small plates or to come with your significant other and have a great dinner.

Our meal:
- burrata with eggplant starter - fresh, creamy burrata, subtle flavors. A nice start.
- leg of lamb - we were hoping for the actual leg of lamb but instead the meat was expertly cut and plated, which is fine just an FYI
- hawaiian ahi tuna - kind of a strange mix with the garlic mashed potatoes but it just worked and created a really fun flavor. would order this again.
- desserts - I don't remember what we ordered, I had a blueberry and peach pie - the fruit was fresh and fantastic, but the crust was kind of overpowering. Dessert was not the stand-out of the meal and I'm not sure if it's even needed, we were stuffed after our main dishes.

We had a great meal with friendly, respectful service and would definitely come back. Thanks for a great night Bistro Aix!
author: Amy D.

description: This place has one of the best veggie menus in SF. The parking is tough, but you are in the heart of one of my favorite party areas in the City. You can walk and walk, which makes it a nice place to go with someone.
author: Kevin F.

description:
this place is cute restaurant with good food and win choice. i came here a few weeks back to a birthday celebration and even though we had a slightly larger group (of 8) and made a reservation ahead of time, we still waited at least half an hour before we got seated. but the hostess was nice and apologized for the delay and gave us free prosecco while we waited. 

anyways, the food was good, among all my friends, we ordered the scallops, leg of lamb, steak and fries. all of dishes were cooked well. i ordered the lamb, which was cooked to the perfect medium rare, the meat was tender and well seasoned. on the side of the lamb was this fabulously delicious potato gratin. it's by far one of the best gratin I've ever had! it's creamy and with thin sliced of potatoes layered with cheese and slightly toasted crumbled panko crumbs on top, it was simple yet delicately tasting.  we also order a bottle of bordeaux to go with the meal, and since we had lots of steak and lamb eaters on the table, the wine went really went with all the entrees we got. 

all in all, the place was great and i would definitely want to come back in the future to taste more dishes!
author: Joyce C.

description:
Quality, quality, quality! Ambiance, ambiance, ambiance! Service, service, service!

Need I say any more? :-) A must for those who appreciate excellence without having to spend a whole month's salary. You can catch me sitting at the bar having dinner with my better half or family or friends every month.
author: Tia N.

description:
If you want decent -- even respectful service -- this is not the place.

We took our friends to dinner at Bistro Aix to cheer up a friend who just lost his job. While the entrees were good, the appetizers for the most part didn't sing -- were average - not outstanding, as I would have expected. But this isn't about the food. 

The problem was the service. 

After our entrees, we had dessert, coffee and after dinner drinks. The bill was promptly delivered and paid (around $300). We enjoyed the glow of good conversation with coffee and dessert for about 10 minutes. Then (while we were still finishing our coffee) the maitre de came to the table. She didn't exchange any pleasantries, but instead got right to the point: she grabbed a few pieces of silverware off the table and asked us "do you need anything else?"

We got the message -- she wanted us to vacate immediately. So we left immediately. On the way out I asked her why she rushed us. She did not offer any apology, and just said there were "lots of people waiting for our table."

Her behavior ruined the evening for us. 

I wrote a letter to Bistro Aix about the incident. They didn't reply. Clearly, this is how they roll.
author: Mark P.

description:
Delightful place with a lot of very good dishes. Cozy, not too loud. Special mention for the figs with goat cheese and the creme brulee (which is INCREDIBLE, and I'm French). It's also affordable ($7 for desserts, $16 for main dishes).

And the service is really good too. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Maximilien B.

description:
Service was spotty, they only gave us one menu at first, dropped off someone else's appetizer at our table and walked away before we had ordered anything and were on the slow side.

We started with the Paccheri with main lobster which was probably about a 3-star dish. I realized that I'm not a huge fan of Paccheri in generally though so my judgement may be swayed by that, but the dish overall just wasn't that memorable and only had a few small pieces of lobster.

That being said, the lamb was succulent and tasty as was the potato gratin that accompanied it. The salted carmel shishito peppers side dish and the bacon brussel sprouts were the stars of the show though! They were both awesome, be sure to try both if you come here!

For desert we had the chocolate cloud cake and the strawberry sorbet which were both also excellent. Looking at it go by to other tables I was worried that the chocolate cloud cake would be too heavy, but it was anything but. I guess that's why it's called cloud cake, it was super light but still very chocolatey and delicious. The sorbet was very light and fresh tasting with a couple of fresh strawberry slices and almonds on top.
author: Ely L.

description:
I came here twice with my family and the second experience definitely made this place a new favorite spot.

The first time I came here I had the burger with an egg inside,  and what made it tastey is that if you look behind the bar, you will see a stone grill using actual wood and that is why their meats get that nice mesquite flavor. 

The second time here my girlfriend I had the Spaghettini which caught our eye from our first experience.  To keep it short and simple, I give it a 10/10. Its like a margherita pizza in a bowl of noodles, the fragrance just catches your attention. The cheese and tomato sauce paired well with the perfectly cooked noodles. First time i've had a non-meat sauce spaghetti and it was great. 

Overall service was good, friendly staff that attentive, and very well designed establishment. I highly recommend making a reservation cause there is always a long wait at dinner time. No matter, I will definitely come here again.
author: James M.

description:
The front looks much different from the back dining room. While the front is dark, romantic, yet tight; the back is bright, airy, and open. The back dining room has a sunroof that lets in a lot of natural light, plus they have a tree in the center so that it almost feels like a patio. Background music plays at an average level however the overall volume is never loud.

The food is Californian with some pasta dishes. You can easily share the pasta as an appetizer or eat it primarily as your main dish. We had two salads, two pastas, and calamari for appetizer. The appetizers are good, especially the calamari. The pastas are good, cooked al dente.

The mains are properly cooked and well seasoned, but perhaps just a slight much salt. I had the lamb served over risotto. I felt the risotto could have been cooked slightly more but nothing to really harp over. There's just something missing. I don't know what it is. Perhaps a special sauce to tie everything together?

I was so full from the rest of the meal I didn't dig in with the desserts. My family chowed down the desserts in no time so it's easy to recommend them. The desserts are much prettier than the rest of the food. Service is good although somewhat sluggish due to the low wait staff and big parties.

_____

Go for appetizers, pasta, and desserts.
author: Michael H.

description:
I decided to filter for $$ and top rated, which eventually led to me choosing this restaurant. 

First thing I liked about this place was that I could make a reservation for the day of online. My fiance and I went on a weekday for dinner.

The restaurant definitely did not stick out. It was dark and did not have a huge sign up in front, so look carefully. When you go inside, it's dim as well, but not too much where you are unable to see your food.

When we got the menu we were a bit confused. Appetizers and salads are listed under one group and we were not sure whether a salad could be eaten as a main course or was just vegetables prepared as an appetizer. The server was very helpful in guiding us through the menu, giving us recommendations and estimating sizes. We decided to do some things tapas style, which worked out well. 

The appetizers were decently sized for two people. They even split the dishes without any extra cost. The menu is seasonal, but we had the octopus and fava bean/arugula/goat cheese salad. Both had excellent taste. The octopus was not chewy at all. 

We also split the squid ink spaghetti, which I thought was wonderful, and the ahi tuna with mashed potato and spinach. The flavor of the spaghetti was delicate, but the texture is what made it amazing. Some sort of panko/garlic crumble just made it mouth watering. The tuna was a bit overcooked (technique is always hit or miss with tuna), however the mashed potatoes were creamy and I believe the spinach was deep fried, giving it a good crunch.

Lastly, we had the sorbet with creme fraiche, almonds, and cherries. Honestly, I was a bit disappointed that my fiance chose this as dessert because I always go for whatever chocolate cake there is... But OMG I AM SO GLAD HE CHOSE IT BECAUSE IT WAS AMAZING! I had expected it to be super sweet, but it was very well balanced and worked very well with the nuts, cherries, and creme fraiche. One order was perfect for two people.

Overall, my fiance and I had a wonderful night out to dinner here and are so happy we came across this gem. If we're ever in the area again we would definitely come back!
author: Alyssa N.

description: I still love this restaurant but I'm not so enthused as the bargains are gone and the menu no longer changes very much.
author: Norman B.

description: Repeatedly disappointed. I really want to like this place but I just can't! It has a great location and a beautiful interior. The menu looks incredible, but the food is good and not great. Conveniently, (also suspiciously) this place seems to have lots of availability on Friday nights. That being said, it's probably the only restaurant on chestnut st that you can get into on a Friday night without a reservation. Furthermore, both times I've eaten her, the wait staff has been rude and inattentive. This restaurant has good potential (and is so cute!), but between the mediocre service and food, I don't think I'll be returning.
author: Ava S.

description:
Love this place!

Love Roxy!

Order the chicken and/or Hawaiin Ahi.  The Brussel Sprouts are also very delicious.  You will thank me!

If you want a good drink, they have a delicious Prosecco that I recommend (only one on the menu).

Definitely make a reservation or you will be waiting for a while.  Sit in the back, there's a tree smack in the middle of the room which makes it feel like an indoor garden (pretty cool).
author: Eric D.

description:
Very good service. Moderately priced food for The City. For example, a NY strip with fries and side of curly endive was $24. They use oak to smoke some of the meats. 

Comfortable seating. Good vibe in the place. Lively without being so loud you cannot talk. Extensive wine list. Would go back. 

Parking can be in pain in that area.
author: Mike S.

description:
I would have given at least four stars but something really pissed me off... Read below.

Ambiance: 4 stars. We were seated in the back room, which offered a little more light, wasn't as loud, and a little less hectic, compared to the front room. However, the acoustics were pretty resonant, so although it wasn't as loud as the front room it was still pretty loud.

Food: 4 stars. Tried the Baby Beet Salad, Bloomsdale Spinach, Goat Cheese & Orange Vinaigrette, Tempura Fried Monterey Calamari, Asian Slaw & Red Curry Aioli, the Snake River Kobe Hamburger on Focaccia with Aioli, Pickled Onion w/ Farm Egg, Bacon, & Gruyere, and sorbets. All the food was fantastic, with the exception of the focaccia bun for the burger being a little too small for me.

Service: 2 stars. Everything started out great. The server was good. But it all went downhill when, midway through dinner, I asked her if she could make sure I get the bill. She agreed. When we were finished and she presented the check, my dinner companion tried to intercept the bill. The server indicated that I would be receiving the check. I proceeded to pull out my AMEX and she told me Bistro AIX does not take AMEX. I immediately told her it was no problem and that I have other cards they would take. My dinner companion saw that as an opportunity to send the server away with his Visa card and she complied. I did not want to cause a scene, but my internal reaction was... What the FCUK just happened? That is total bull$#!+ for her to do that. (On a sidenote, if i am beat to the check, I have no hard feelings against my friends. But when this behavior is exhibited by the business I am a patron of, I find it unacceptable). Note to management: Make sure your employees maintain their integrity.
author: Ray C.

description: Coordinated a surprise mustache birthday dinner for one of the girlies here.
