The staff was so helpful getting us seated where we wanted, and letting us hide in the hallway area when they sat her at her table. The food was so good! We all got different items and they were all perfectly delicious. Sitting in the window area for dinner and watching people mill around the arena is fun and nice. I highly recommend coming here for a date night, birthday dinner, or even solo dinner at bar.
author: Ashley J.

description: Don't be fooled by the size of this place - it's DELISH. The wine was amazing and it went well with the fish that I ordered. I went here with my cousins and we had an awesome girls' night with the help of Bistro Aix, an attentive waiter, and a bit of pinot. My boyfriend and I will definitely be here on a date night.
author: Rachel M.

description:
I have to start off by saying I'm in between 3 and 4 stars, but at this time...I have to stick with 3. Hopefully after a few more visits...I can increase my review. 

My boyfriend and I and two of our friends dined here for NYE. We absolutely love the Marina area and Bistro Aix really fits right in with the charm of the neighborhood. Below I've broken up a few categories and some of my pros and cons. Take them with a grain of salt since this was my first time eating here. 

Food - 4 stars
What we ordered...
*Baby Beet Salad with Baby Spinach, Goat Cheese & Orange Vinaigrette
*Grilled Rare Hawaiian Ahi Tuna with Mashed Potatoes, Fried Baby Spinach & Spicy Port Sauce 
*Brussel sprouts with applewood bacon and shallots - roasted perfectly and loved the flavors. 
*Warm Breaded Goat Cheese - I added this to my meal just because I have a love for goat cheese. It was very tasty, but a bit overbreaded for me. It was delicious though. 
*Cheese tray - they had 3 cheeses, few slices of bread, walnuts and apple slice. Eh. 

Wine - 4 stars. Great selection, priced well. Our table enjoyed a several bottles of sparkling and white. 

Service - 2 stars. Ok...maybe it was because of the holiday, but I have a hard time accepting poor service ever. Especially when my meal is 2+ dollar signs. It took over 20 minutes to order, our water was only refilled when asked (multiple times), food took about 20 minutes to come out, then we had to ask another server to get ours in order to pay our check...just all around not that great. 

Note...beer and wine only. 

Overall...besides the not so great service, I highly suggest you give them a try. I know the bf and I will be back.
author: Dru M.

description:
Love, love, love this place - the perfect local neighborhood joint where you can enjoy a glass of wine and appetizer at the bar with the very friendly bartender and other staff, or sit at a table for a multi course dinner of some of the best food in the city in an understated urban atmosphere. This is one of those places you could eat three times a week and never get bored because the food is simple, direct, authentic, flavorful and altogether satisfying. Fresh, lovely local ingredients, the spaghettini is exceptional, butter lettuce salad crisp and vibrant, cracker crust pizza a delight to eat - the perfect balance of wafer thin crispiness, cheese, and thin smear of gorgeous tomato sauce, and the grilled calamari tasty, (though I thought it was a tad overwhelmed by the other ingredients and would have liked the calamari to be more prominent in the dish). 

We'll stop in for a bite every time we're in SF, and that's saying a lot considering the variety of great food the city has to offer. 

You can't go wrong here - it's excellent!
author: InTheBurg B.

description:
A great little gem
That serves a damn good burger.  
Get the first dessert.
author: Josh G.

description:
The most delicious meal I've had in a long time; I forgot how good French cuisine is! I ordered chardonnay, the boyfriend ordered beer so he was happy.
We got an eggplant topped with burrata cheese and bell peppers h'ors d'euvres, which was AMAZING. Also got a simple arugula with baked goat cheese and radishes, also delicious.
Main dish was crispy chicken, cooked to perfection. The chicken was incredibly moist and went perfectly with the crispy skin.
We got to sit in the back, which is like a pseudo patio. There is a tree in the middle of the room and the ceiling is all skylights so it's like you're in an enclosed outdoor patio, I loved it!
We will definitely be back!
author: Arianna W.

description:
This restaurant does it all right. Before going to see a BATS Improv show in Ft. Mason my wife and I enjoyed an awesome meal here with some great friends. We were seated in the back area which is decorated very awesomely. The whole dinner had a great feel, from the knowledgeable waitstaff to the delicious appetizers and dinner. Great meal with friends facilitated in an awesome location with great food, and great music.

Wow this place is worth checking out and I definitely recommended for a date night a foodie adventure.
author: Joshua M.

description:
This place was very disappointing, especially since it had so many good reviews.  

First off, there was no host at the front door to greet customers, and the waiters simply whisked by us without a word.  We stood awkwardly in the doorway for about 5 minutes before we could attract someone's attention.

When we did get seated, we ended up waiting quite a long time even for our salads to arrive.  For the price, the salads are certainly not worth it.  I do not understand how you can charge $6.50 for a plate filled only with 1/4 of a head of butter lettuce and maintain a straight face, or how you can call something a "beet salad" when it has less than one entire beet in it.

The tagliatelle with coq au vin was so dry that it was almost inedible.  When we informed the waiter that the chicken was overcooked, he said "that's how all of the chicken for that dish has been cooked, so it's all going to be the same." ... so clearly these dishes are not made-to-order.  He replaced it with a slightly less dry, plain chicken breast... about 30 seconds later, so obviously those were pre-cooked and just sitting in the back for who knows how long.

The Ahi tuna was marginal.  While the plate was piping hot, the actual food was lukewarm, which only makes me think that this dish was also pre-cooked and carelessly warmed up in a microwave. 

The waiter tried decently hard to make up for the sub-par food.  While this is appreciated, a good restaurant would not serve such low-quality product in the first place.  The one star is for the waiter, who at least understood our disappointment and provided pretty good customer service.

For these prices, there are certainly better places to eat in San Francisco that really take pride in the food they serve.  I would suggest scratching this one off your list of places to try.
author: Holly E.

description: Cute date restaurant. You pay for the atmosphere more so then the food.
author: SCSR L.

description: Absolutely the best spaghettini, with the right flavor and al dente texture.  The tomato and cheese pizza appetizer was delicious with the right flavor of cheese, sauce and crisp crust.  Last but not least the beet salad was the best I have ever had!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Wonderful food and service, awkwardly they don't accept American Express.  A gem of a local spot with a respectable wine list and a well constructed menu of delicious  cuisine made from fresh seasonal ingredients.  

Major gripe is they don't accept American Express.  Come on! how gauche!  if you're a restaurant that finds it ok to charge over $100 for diner for two, accept Amex! 

Unfortunately until they accept Amex again, they're off my go-to list- such a shame.
author: Garrett G.

description:
I have been here twice.  The first time it was 4 stars.  The second time (most recently) gotta give it 2 stars.
Really rude, dark-haired hostess, who despite our reservation sat two tables of four in front of us that were walk-ins.  When I questioned why this was happening she told me we would have to wait and that the people who came in after us who said, "Four please, we don't have a reservation..." had a reservation and that is why you sat them all before us.  Makes a lot of sense.  If you make a mistake, apologize; don't get pissy with the customers you a.) are making wait, b.) just flat out lied to.
   Here's a tip, if your host area gets crowded, as you walk over to perform your job ask: "Does anyone have a reservation?" Undoubtedly, those that took the time to call and make one, will pop up and you can sit those people first instead of making them wait 30 minutes. 
Both times we have come here the servers all act very surly.  I don't know what it is...
I am more of a service with a smile kinda guy as opposed to service with a side of hipster smug.  Dudes, it is a restaurant - you're not curing cancer. 

These traits aside, the food is very good as is the atmosphere.  Service really screams a 2 or a 1, but because the manager was so nice the first time we went there and because of the food and vibe, it gets 3 stars.

Try the squid ink pasta.
author: Alex A.

description: This place is adorable!!! I love the back room with the beautiful wooden tables and the live olive tree! The food is pretty amazing to. I had the Duck Au Vin which was beautifully prepared and delicious. My husband had the spaghettini and loved it, which is saying a lot because he's extremely picky. For dessert we had the Panna Cotta (great texture) and the Tart Tatin (to die for...) Our waitress was really nice and pleasant and service was great! We are definitely coming back!
author: Julie S.

description:
For starters, we had the house cured salmon. There was a generous portion of salmon, and it tasted delicious with the dill cream sauce and baby green salad. A great, light appetizer. 

Entrees: 
Farm egg tagliatelle: This is somewhat similar to a fettucine pasta. It wasn't drowning in sauce, and the pasta noodles tasted home made. The mushrooms were so yummu and flavorful. 

Leg of Lamb: so juicy, cooked the way I like it, flavorful. I kept finding my fork gravitating towards this plate. 

New York Steak: again, just like the leg of lamb, it was cooked to my liking (medium rare). Decent

The only thing is that the portions are not as big as I would like (maybe this is why America is fat? I'm used to large portions. Thank God I work out I guess). 

All in all, good food. Decent service. Ambiance is a little on the older side. So if you want something hip and happening, I suggest Delarosa.
author: Victoria B.

description: Ate here for the first time with friends. The space was cozy, service and staff were friendly and helpful. Everyone enjoyed both their apps and the main dishes. I appreciated that the kitchen was flexible and able accommodate a few dietary restrictions we had.  I think the favorite dish of the evening was the grilled pear salad. A few bummers re the wine... 1 - our friends were really hoping to try so wine from Aix... seems like perhaps they should bring some in, given the name and all. 2 - though this is our fault for not checking, we've never eaten at a restaurant in the city that did not waive the corkage fee if you also ordered a wine off the menu. We ordered a nice bottle to start, and it wasn't inexpensive, and yet we were still charged the steep $25 corkage for having our own burgundy with us to enjoy after we finished the wine from Bistro Aix. This kinda left a sour taste for all of us and seemed a bit greedy to me.
author: Wendy D.

description: This is a nice restaurant with great food that won't necessarily break the bank.  It also has a beautiful interior space with a sunlight, making indoor dining feel like it is outside.  Although the category of this restaurant is listed as French, I would actually characterize it more as upscale Californian.  I started off with the grilled octopus with jalapeno chimichuri sauce, which was phenomenal.  It was a nice light, but flavorful, portion, so I didn't feel stuffed before the main came out.  I then had the squid ink spaghetti, which reminded me of all the squid ink dishes I had in the Mediterranean.  The chocolate cake I had to end the meal finished everything off quite nicely.  The service was great, and the atmosphere nice but unpretentious.  I would absolutely go back.
author: Scott E.

description: What a darling place! We came in for dinner and our server sat us at the most romantic table next to the tree in the middle of the dining room! You can't really beat twinkling lights on a tree and a handsome man across from you at dinner! We ordered the lamb meatballs, octopus, scallops, and the steak. All were delicious! Then we had the strawberry almond crepes which were yummy too. The wines impressed me a lot and we were able to pair some nice glasses with each dish. Overall, it's a super romantic place and I highly recommend it for a date :).
author: Sheeva G.

description:
Had a great dinner last Sunday night with a group of 4.  The pork chop was amazing along with the salmon.  Overall a very reasonable priced dinner with decent ambiance.

Sat in the back but it didn't really feel like a patio to me.  It does have natural light but it kind of feels like something is missing back there...
author: CC C.

description:
We arrived on Saturday at 5:30pm and were told that there were no tables available until 9:30pm, as a party had reserved most of the restaurant. We felt a bit disappointed by this news and were debating, outside the restaurant, where we should go next. The hostess then ran out and told us that she could squeeze us in between two reservations, if we promised that we'd finish eating in an hour, and would that be ok? Most definitely! Just for her accommodating attitude, I'm adding a full star to my review. The food itself was fairly unremarkable--think Italian approach to pasta coupled with French approach to braising meats and creating sauces (think: lots of cream) and you've got the fare here. 

Our table ordered the farm fresh tagliatelle with coq au riesling, pumpkin ravioli, and sage brown butter sauce gnocchi. The first was very heavy, in terms of the cream sauce, but the coq was very moist, fatty, and tasty. The pumpkin ravioli was only mildly sweet, slightly spicy, and just very pleasant. The gnocchi was nicely chewy, but the sauce was a bit too oily for my taste. 

In short, you won't go terribly wrong by ordering a pasta dish. The portions are generous and the flavors, though unremarkable, are quite good.
author: Annie M.

description:
The menu sounded interesting. There were 6 of us. But the portions were a bit skimpy.
All ala carte - the food was so-so for the price. The wine menu was extensive. But the noise- my heavens- it was almost unbearable. It was hard to hear the person sitting right next to me. The service was also so-so. I mean I had to tell my waiter for grated cheese for my pasta dish. Then he began to clean off another table before coming to me with the cheese. After he literally just dropped the plate in front of me. Not very French- I'd say. I wouldn't go there again. Lots of room so if you are stuck for an ok place to eat and don't want to eat too much and it's raining out- well this might fill the bill
author: Paolo A.

description:
Adorable restaurant in the Marina. 

Upon entering, you see a few tables, a bar and a kitchen that is partially open so you can see the chefs in action. Hostess seated us in the back which was surprisingly big and charming. A tree adorned with lights sat in the middle of the room. The ceiling was one big skylight. Very romantic atmosphere. Although, the noise level went up as the night progressed. However, I would prefer to sit back here than in the front. If you make reservations, ask to be seated in the back room. 

Our server, Matt, was great. He patiently explained the menu especially when I couldn't decide on what to order. We ordered the star route farm baby lettuce salad with tarragon vinaigrette the warm breaded goat cheese. It was delicious! You must order this. 
For entrees we had the crispy roasted Sonoma chicken breast and the chicken was tender and flavorful. You will not be disappointed! The other entree was the Hamburger with foccacia with aioli and fries. I ordered it with the farm egg and the burger medium rare. Fries were shoe string fries!! Burger was devine! Meat juice was coming out every time I took a bite. My hands were dripping with juice and I licked every finger. 

For dessert, we had the warm apple tartine with creme fraiche. I was disappointed. There was not enough apple flavor and not very sweet. 

Overall, great place to have a Friday night dinner. Service was spectacular and fast. Matt was excellent. Food was delicious, except the dessert. One of the best burgers I've ever had! 

TIP: They offer prix fixe menu Sunday-Thursday. $25 for 1 appetizer and 1 entree.
author: Molly T.

description: Super tasty, service is great! Paid $33 for appetizer + entree + dessert. The panna cotta is DELICIOUS !
author: Tal C.

description:
There are things I like about Bistro Aix and things I don't. I was entertaining some older family friends, and one of them had somehow found out about this place so I went with it. We had the Asian-inspired fried calamari appetizer, which was really good. 

I then had the sliced steak, which was also very good I admit. The problem was the other stuff on the plate. It came with this dry leafy green, like fresh spinach or arugula. I like those but not dry and undressed. 

More annoying than that was the french fries it came with. I was about to get the seared ahi, because it sounded better as a whole but my wife wanted to try the steak and order the sole for herself. So I got the steak. 

The fries did not work for me. Not that they were bad but like I said, the meat was very good and the dish could have been much more memorable with maybe scalloped potatoes, mashed, or roasted red. Just something more on par with good quality meat. The fries were shoestring style and similar to what you'd get at In N Out. They weren't bad, they just didn't fit the dish. 

I liked the fact they had some cool beers, but only a couple are on tap. The bottled beer was going for $6-10 apiece, which is just too much if it's not fresh. Chimay might be the exception but not the others. Our waitress was also absent at times. She'd check on us and then disappear for long stretches of time. She asked us if we wanted to look at dessert menus. We said sure. They came 10-15 minutes later. Not a big deal but why not just bring them right after you ask?

Alas, we are from Berkeley and have our own foodie excursions to keep us occupied without trekking this far. This place was an occasion for guests, and it went over well. It exudes that yuppified vibe of the Marina and this place caters to those folks. Fair enough. It's not a place I feel destined to return to, but I had a nice time still.
author: Sherry G.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant at the moment.  I have been three times in the last 6 weeks and sent some European friends visiting for a regatta there who also loved it. 

The service: I've sat at the bar each time, and we've been delighted both with the bartenders and our neighbors at the bar.  Both are interested in getting you the food for your mood. 

The food:  My favorite dishes so far: Beet Salad and Tagliatelle (sp?). 
The greens are so fresh and clean they feel like they are squeaking on your teeth.  The beets and goat cheese are equally fresh tasting.  It's a gorgeous and simple dish ala the slow food movement - local, fresh, highlighting the ingredients without over seasoning, saucing etc. I do not think I asked if they were local, but it tasted much like the greens I'm getting from my yard.  

The tagliatelle is home made, but it was the chicken on top that made my eyes roll over.  Warm, tender, with a slightly crisped skin.   Definitely a young / small chicken where you're getting the best flavor from the meat.  A bite of meat on the fork, swabbed through the pasta with a bit of artichoke followed by a swig of interesting wine (I haven't even talked about the by-the-glass selection, but trust me it's good) while seated at the marble bar and enjoying the company of friends and bar mates is...well....it's why I'll keep going back and sending others.

The Mood: The restaurant's face lift and attitude adjustment seems to go from the back of the house, through the kitchen right up to the moment you walk in the door.  They've got that little bit of magic figured out.
author: Paige B.

description:
Don't be fooled by the three star rating.  If Yelp would give us half-star options I would give Bistro Aix 2.5 stars as its one note-worthy element is its rear atrium that has a great sky-light that gives the room an outdoorsy feel.

The food at Bistro Aix is okay - not poor nor grand but squarely in the middle of both categories.  It didn't help that on my most recent trip there the kitchen was out of a couple of menu items by the time my party was seated at 9:30 PM (we had late reservations).  The house cured salmon on potato galette with dill cream & baby greens would have been really good but for the fact that the dish was way too salty.  The baby beet salad with goat cheese is a common dish done all over the city but in this version the flavors did not seem to harmonize.

For my entre I ordered the grilled Sonoma leg of lamb with the potato gratin.  The gratin was good but the lamb was served a bit cold.  Thus, meat that was cooked perfectly medium-rare was a bit tough and rubbery.  I also tried the ahi tuna with mashed potatoes and was disappointed by the blandness of the dish.  The spicy port sauce accompanying the dish was anything but spicy.  For dessert I played it safe and got the vanilla ice cream with chocolate fudge and toasted almonds.  The safe bet turned out to be pretty good but nothing that one would hope for from a fine dining establishment.  

Bistro Aix has an extensive wine list and is good for groups as I was able to get a last minute reservation for eight people on a Friday night.  I would not pick it as a place to dine, however, if you are looking for an intimate evening and great food.
author: Oski B.

description:
I came here last week on a date and was very pleasantly surprised by a nice atmosphere, excellent service, and a delicious (though rather limited, imo) menu. A bit on the pricey side, but it was a date and I obviously wasn't paying. ;)

I got the sole. My date ordered the steak. We ordered a nice bottle of french wine. All of which was simple but excellently prepared and wonderful tasting. I highly recommend the sole if you go here. It was buttery and complimented with some great potato cubes and sauteed artichokes. 

The service was one of the best aspects. Our waiter was attentive but not intrusive. He seemed to know when we wanted him around and when we didn't. He was very professional and probably one of the best waiters I have had in this city for this class of restaurant. 

My only complaint is the small little table we were seated at in the back corner. Next time if it is warmer outside we will have to request the back patio, I have heard good things.

Go to Bistro Aix, you won't be disappointed.
author: Krista S.

description:
First of all, thanks to the fellow Yelpers that suggested sitting in the back room. Although I am lead to believe the front might be quieter, the back is certainly aesthetically pleasing. A big tree wrapped in small white lights takes center stage- and all tables surround it. The open ceiling is quite nice too- and lets in a lot of light!

When I made our reservation, I requested a seat in the back but we still still given a seat in the front (although there were 3 or 4 empty tables when we requested to be moved). The hostess and our initial waiter were very friendly and accommodating and made the switch for us without hesitation. 

Unfortunately, our new waiter lacked personality and all customer service skills. I wasn't at all pleased with him.

Our Meal:

The bread- delish!
Spaghettini- was my favorite... Just the right amount of spice!
Sonoma Chicken, Red Potatoes, and Green Beans- Someone remind me why I didn't just get a Rolli Rotti chicken for half the price? Really was nothing worth raving about...but still yummy.
Hamburger- The boyfriend usually finishes hamburgers off like its going out of style. He only ate half. Said it was nothing to rave about.
Brownie Birthday Sundae Thing- Eh. 

Although it was a good and enjoyable meal, it's nothing worth going back for. 

We were told to "have a good night" by every single employee we passed- that was a nice touch on our way out!
author: Annalise F.

description:
Met my Fiance's family here for dinner and were seated in the atrium located at the back of the restaurant, which was much brighter than the interior section!  The atrium also had a beautiful lighted tree in the middle, which was nice to have in the background.

The food was so-so.  I ordered the chicken and wasn't too impressed.  We ordered lots of wine from their extensive collection, which added a half star to my review's rating.

There are lots of restaurant's in the Marina to try, this can be one of them.
author: Carmel U.

description:
First we came here, i was kinda disappointed with their service. We had a reservation already, but it took us like 50 mins to get the table. We requested a patio table when we reserved, but they totally forgot our request, so we waited and waited for almost an hour. Glad they still remember to apprize by providing 4 glasses of free champaign. 

Food was so good! We were really impressed with their bread. Believe it or not, I think their complimentary bread was even better than Tartine. Just can't stop asking more. We ordered like three starters, and all of them were pretty good. Entrees were delicious, too. I can't complain any thing about their food. This is a restaurant I will definitely go back!
--------------------
UPDATED: The second time we visited
Ok, we just visited there again last weekend, and it was an "Extremely Unhappy" experience. The service was horrible this time, and his name is Ben. We waited for 10 mins to get his attention, then we finished our orders and waited for another 15 mins to get our drinks. He even forgot to serve bread to us; how a nice service that we had to ask everything by ourselves and waited for another 15 mins again?! They need to pay more attention on the staff training!
author: YT T.

description: I can't believe I've never been here! Reminds me of the type of menu at Starbelly in the Mission, but closer to French Bistro menu. Wonderful date night or catch up with a friend atmosphere, their calamari (paired with the blood orange salad!) is the best. Spaghetti was great as well.
author: Adele A.

description: Great food. Love the Kobe hamburger. Got it medium and it wasn't dry. The bread had a unique flavor that really made the burger well rounded. Instead of French fries you can get green beans, which was good. The bad things were the service was so slow and they didn't offer you bread.
author: Christina K.

description: Just had a dinner there tonight. We liked their food but their service is horrible.  Our server throw a bill to our table - who does that?!? He was very rude. Only person who say "thank you" ehen we are leaving was a bartender. Never go back.
author: M H.

description: Great place to sip on some wine, catch up wth friends, and be given 5 star service. The food was insanely delicious. I got the Ahi tuna.. Pretty much anytime Ahi tuna is on a menu I am going to get it. It did not dissapoint. The service was awesome, there was a party that took up the whole back room and was needing a lot of attention but that did not take away from our expereince or service in anyway. Our waiter knew when to come up and see if we needed anything (another glass of wine) but also knew when to hang back and just let us talk and catch up, we did not feel rushed at all which can definitely be an issue with some resturants in the area. Glad I came, cannot wait to go back.
author: Jen K.

description: Had a wonderful evening with the folks at aix last night. Though we were visiting from out of town, they made us feel like locals. The warm and friendly service was more than matched by the food  Simple and delicious. The highlight was the incredible corn chowder, though the woodgrilled burger topped with a lusciously oozing farm egg was pretty bangin' too!  We look forward to visiting our new friends in the marina next time we are in town!
author: Doron A.

description: Came here for one of my friend's birthday and it was a cute little place tucked in the marina! It's perfect place to take your date and luckily we were double dating so it was nice! :) I had the cracker crust pizza (tomato/mozzarella) along with calamari! Both very delicious! The crust taste exactly like it sounds and i've never had anything like it! I also had a random spaghetti craving so I made my boyfriend get the spaghettini and it was great! Overall, definitely loved the food and ambiance of this place and would come back for another date night! :)
author: Jennifer W.

description:
The bean soup and thin crust pizza were excellent! The grilled octopus was also very delicious. The artichoke was tasty although I would love it to be more than just battered and fried. We had a hard time deciding on whether to order the gnocchi or the squid ink pasta. We finally ordered the gnocchi and it seemed we made the wrong choice. It was quite blank and dry. 

Overall, I think they know how to cook well and their dishes are creative. We will  come back for the squid ink pasta and desserts, which I heard are marvelous. Also when we were leaving we got to see some very beautifully presented antipasti dishes. Will come back to try more of their antipasti too.
author: Clara L.

description:
I don't know how or why I waited eight months to review this place. During this said trip to the bay area, I was with a couple friends just trying to eat at as many Michelin-starred and Bib Gourmands as possible. Bistro Aix just happened to have open reservations the night we got into the city.

The ambiance:
We arrived for an extremely early dinner. I think we were the first people in at 6pm when they opened dinner service, so given that, the place was quite empty and we had the entire place to ourselves! We opted for the seats in the back, per everyone's suggestions on Yelp. The decor and atmosphere was gorgeous. The sun was still out since it was 6pm and it just lit up the room marvelously. People began trickling in and it also helped brighten the room up. I was a big fan of the overall atmosphere.

The food:
We had a three-course prix-fixe for $25 (I believe that was how much it cost; it's been a while!). I remember ordering a soup, but forget what it was. It might have been a split pea soup or something similar, but I remember it being okay. It didn't rock my socks off, which is probably why I don't remember it well. The entree was delish -- my two friends each ordered the steak option, but I decided to go with the halibut, which was served atop a fennel broth with some potatoes. It was perfectly flaky and full of flavor; it also had the added bonus of being one of my lighter meals that week, minimizing my diet-associated guilt! Dessert was forgettable, but I'm not much of a sweets guy, so that's to be expected.

The service:
I think it had something to do with us being the only party there for a good half hour, but service was great. No complaints.

If you're in SF and want a great contemporary and reasonably upscale restaurant to try, I'd highly recommend Bistro Aix. They lack the pretension, but deliver all the quality you'd expect at other Bib Gourmand restaurants. I'd definitely come back if I'm ever back in town.
author: Kenny O.

description: Waiter was great. Food was great. $20 corkage. Grewat atmosphere. Get lots and lots of appetizers and share.
author: Jason M.

description: AVOID AVOID AVOID--worst service I have EVER had in my life. The waiter refused to substitute a vegetable for potatoes (and was rude about it) then mocked and sneered at me when I didn't understand a menu food descriptor written in French.  Then he belittled my 81 year old Mother when she chimed in with a complaint--and literally chased us down the street when I walked out without touching my dinner, yelling "where's my tip??"
author: Peter C.

description:
Kinda expensive for what you get.  It was okay.
Our bread came out cold.  They should heat it.

Came here after the Shecky's event.  Parking was difficult here.  We had to park in this stinky parking garage and it was really expensive like $3 an hr and only took quaters, no dollar or credit card machine.  Who has that many quaters?
author: Julie G.

description:
First: the staff are friendly and professional, and as another yelper pointed out, wishing our entire party a pleasant evening on the way out was a very nice touch.  The experience was heartfelt and genuine rather than forced.

We made a reservation for the back room.  It was a busy and lively, yet relaxed atmosphere.  There are a couple of nice touches to the back room.  The redwood tables are gorgeous (manager explained it died of natural causes), but the centerpiece is the tree under the skylight. 
It feels good to sit next to a living tree while inside.  It's like getting away with combining two ingredients that aren't supposed to be mixed, yet somehow work.

The food varied from wholesomely good to great.  

Of the starters, the salmon salad was the best.  The soup was well balanced, though not a favorite.

We had the pizza for an appetizer, which was very good.  Also, their bread is amazing.

For entrees, the chicken was done perfectly, which was delightful.  There's a small window of perfection when cooking chicken and they nailed it: properly cooked, juicy, and very flavorful.

My favorite was actually the hamburger.  A good burger isn't to be scoffed at, and this one was tip-top.  They used a home made bun and other high quality ingredients to make it, but the addition of gorgonzola cheese, which I highly recommend, made for one heck of a burger.

After the entrees we had desert and coffee.  I love coffee, and they serve Fourbarrel, which is on the level.  

For desert, the chocolate cake was good, but didn't induce the phenomenon of craving. Next time I'll try a different desert, because I will definitely go back.  It's a new favorite.
author: Joshua K.

description:
Two wonderful friends of mine took me here tonight for a belated birthday dinner. I'd originally been recommended the place by my favorite winemaker. It absolutely lived up to his hearty endorsement.

All three of us took the $18.95 prixe fixe that's offered from 6-8pm. As it was a chilly night we all had the french onion soup.It was wonderfully rich and not dripping with cheese. Instead a small cheese crostini floated on top. I chose the steak frites and my friends both had the chicken. Both the steak and the fries were perfect. However, the glass of wine I had tasted a bit like it had been opened several days earlier. Drinkable but definitely feeling the effects of the air. 

We rounded out our dinner with three desserts --- the panna cotta, the apple pie and the creme brulee. I would order the panna cotta and the creme brulee again but the apple to crust ratio on the apple pie was a bit off (too much crust, not enough apple).

We spent two hours in total because we were having such a wonderful time. Never once were we rushed. 

Excellent service, great food and good value I'll definitely go back.
author: Miriam W.

description: The best food! The only problem is on multiple occasions the kitchen closes early, so you dive all the way over there for a great meal, only to be turned away by lazy staff. Bummer!
author: Michael A.

description:
***3.5 stars***

Although the food, service and atmosphere were good, they had raised their prices and weren't as veggie friendly as they promised me to be.

I was looking for a place to take my friends to dinner to thank them for letting me crash at their place for a week. After endless yelping for places that were both friendly to vegetarians and close to the place where one of them worked, I settled for Bistro Aix. 

When I called for a reservation I got the voicemail and left a message. I didn't expect them to actually call back within 20min but they did. The man, Steven I think, was very friendly and even said that they could change the prixe fixe menu to accommodate the difficult to please vegetarians. 

We ended up getting there almost an hour before our reservation time but we were seated right away anyway. The bread really was fantastic and it was hard to stop eating it. We looked at the prixe fixe menu and realized that the price had been raised to $23. Furthermore, it didn't have a vegetarian option. The prixe fixe included an appetizer and an entree. If you wanted something that didn't have meat in it, you could actually order off the normal menu and add an appetizer for less than the prixe fixe menu. But there only about 3 vegetarian options to even chose from. 

I had the pulled beef ravioli ($20), which was very good. It has an incredibly full flavour but, at the same time, wasn't as heavy as I thought it would be. For dessert I had the Chocolate Cake ($7.50), which I thought was fantastic. It was flour-less and thus basically a brownie, and came with vanilla ice cream and raspberry sauce. 

In summary, it was good, but not mindblowing. I was a bit disappointed with them saying that they could come up with something interesting for the vegetarians over the phone, and then just pointing to the menu when we were there.
author: Mariko F.

description:
I am giving Bistro Aix a generous three stars.

My friends and I had an 8 p.m. reservation on a Saturday night; we were seated promptly which was nice (also because we were ravenously hungry). As soon as we sat down, we ordered appetizers for the table - a basket of fries and some calamari.  The appetizers came out quickly and while I didn't try the calamari (just wasn't feeling the squid that night), the fries were tasty. When we settled in, we learned they were out of a couple of dishes - the gnocchi and another one - which was a bit disappointing.

We ordered our entrees and more appetizers - a few beet salads, and I had the steak (after I was advised by my friend to not get the lamb which she had ordered on other occasions). The beet salad was fine, though it definitely erred on the side of more goat cheese than beets (I prefer a beetier salad than the tiny bits that were included in this salad). My steak was a small but good sized portion, though it was a bit rare for medium. The flavor of the steak was fine but definitely average. Instead of the fries (which I'd already had as an app), I got the haricot verts (they were out of the potato gratin) which were tasty. All in all, the food was average.

The service, however, was bad. Our waitress was surly from the start - not a smile not once, nothing. We are a fun, friendly group, and she mostly just frowned at us. While she was pouring wine, she also poured wine on my friends shoulder. Luckily (I suppose?), my friend was wearing a sleeveless top so the wine didn't get on her clothes, but no apology from the waitress. My other friend wasn't so lucky. When they were clearing plates from another table, they dropped a bunch of the plates and spilled ketchup on her white jacket. She was trying to be nice but she was mortified; at least in this situation, the waiter apologized profusely, tried to get it out with soda water and also told her to come back if she had any problems getting the ketchup stain out of her jacket. 

'Tis true, it's a nice spot to dine outside but so are the other places on the block. I found Bistro Aix to be overrated for its prices, service and quality of food. One day I'll try Bistro Aix again but probably not again any time soon.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Pros:
Tasty bistro food in the neighborhood.

Cons:
Not the "see and be seen" scene that many marina going-outers are looking for (but maybe that's a pro?)

Fun:
The back patio is the only place to sit.
author: Mike G.

description: cute interior and decent food. Go for the atmosphere more than anything else.
author: Aimee W.

description:
I want to go back to San Francisco just for the pasta at this place. It's a cute restaurant. Rose and I sat in the front of the restaurant, close to the bar (just where we're supposed to be!).  Close quarters. I think we were just about a foot away from the diners to our left and right. It was fun to spy on their orders and make our decisions. It can get a little noisy, but we could still have a conversation without yelling.

We each had a different salad and I remember both of us loving each of them.  A fan of beets - Rose had that salad. I tried the greens with salmon and a very thinly sliced potatoes.  It was a perfect combination of salty with lightly dressed greens.  Rose had that pasta I now want.  Lucky for me - she gave me a bite.  I was jealous the entire meal, but I had the lamb steak, which was also delicious. I couldn't be a complete pig and order the pasta too.  Trust me - it crossed my mind.  

Prices for the food were very reasonable.  The wine list was a little on the pricey side.  My only problem with the restaurant is that we had a car. Parking was horrible.  But instead of doing what I did, which was drive round and round and then find the metered parking garage (very expensive!). Go to the restaurant's website and read their recommendations on parking.  That would be the smart way to go!
author: Doreen E.

description:
Bistro Aix was yummy.  Not amazing by any means, but I affirm what my sister said "It's good and it's reliable" 

The service was good, the wine was pretty yummers too!
author: Roxanna A.

description:
I love the food here.  Must eats are: burger, spaghettini, cracker bread pizza (both types).

Burger is better than the rib eye steak; all appetizers/salads are good, but not as good as the pizza.
author: Wakako U.

description: The chicken was underwhelming, though my boyfriend's simple spaghetti with tomato sauce was delicious.  Since the service was simply OK, not worth going back.
author: Cristina C.

description:
I am definitely a fan of Bistro Aix.  Their décor is right up my alley.  Marble, dark wood, olive trees in the back courtyard.  Their bathroom idea is cool; the trough sink in between the two toilets is neat.

The food spoke for itself.  I enjoyed the calamari, spinach and beat salad with goat cheese and the steak. All were AMAZING!  My only disappointment of the evening was no full bar and they didn't accept AmEx and it was a business dinner. 

I will be back!
author: Sofia H.

description:
My wife and I are vegetarians and we brought my visiting parents here for dinner on Saturday with a reservation. We sat in the front portion of the restaurant which based on the prior reviews was not the best place for ambiance. We ordered the butter bean soup which had fresh butter bean and corn in a lightly flavored white/clear broth that we thought was okay. We also got the heirloom tomato panzanetta, which had fresh tomatoes that were popping with taste in a slightly over salted, citrus-y dressing. We also got the burratta with eggplant appetizer which was basically a grilled eggplant topped with burrata and a thin slice of roasted bellpepper - the burrata was soft and fresh and the veggies were roasted perfectly: everyone liked this dish. We got the burrata, kale pizza which featured a thin crust cooked well in a brick oven, topped with delicious dino kale, fava beans and burrata cheese -- the burrata was not as tasty as the burrata on the appetizer. We also got the spaghettini which ended up being everyone's favorite dish because the sauce had the most unique flavor (oregano, chili oil, basil). We got the risotto which was bland and very forgettable.

Overall the meal was average and the service was solid. We probably won't be coming back but it is a good option for a crowd with mixed vegetarians and non-vegetarians looking for a restaurant in the Marina.
author: T K.

description: Really really good.  Seafood, chicken, burger, desert, wine, it was all great.  Highly recommended.
author: Daniel J.

description:
The ambiance and staff here is good. A nice go-to place at night. The location makes it very difficult to find parking though. 

The food is simply alright. They have some good appetizers. I enjoyed some of the calamari. Their pizza is thin and flavorful, though a bit too much oil for me. Their ahi tuna and steak are decent.
author: Lei I.

description: This was one of the very few times I had to actually return my food because it was inedible. The "gnocchi" were tiny pieces of dense dough with absolutely no flavor and was luke warm. I changed it for a salad, which had more dressing then food on the plate. Terrible food, mediocre service and the waiter kept referring us as  "my friends" and he was calling every single table that. No we aren't  friends and that is unprofessional. Poor choice and lousy food.
author: Julia C.

description:
Talk about a Sex-and-the-City dinner spot! I was running late to meet some girlfriends here so they had already taken the liberty of ordering a bunch of different plates and I was happy to say they have great taste! 
The environment of the restaurant was great, very lively. The staff did a great job of pacing the courses out in a way that we didn't feel rushed at all, nor were we waiting for our next plate. They were all friendly, and had just the right amount of small conversation to make us feel welcome.

I don't even want to get into the menu because it was all delicious; hard to choose favorites.

Bonus: they had no problem making accomodations when we requested to pay the check with 5 different credit cards.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
I love Bistro Aix. Granted, I have only been once, but I plan on making it one of many attendances. The 5th star is deserved. The service here is impeccable and memorable. I called to make a reservation one day before I planned on dining (make that late night...), and received a confirmation the next day for a 7 o'clock reservation. This does not normally happen to me. Usually, a call back will include "We would like to offer a reservation for tomorrow at 10 pm." 

Upon entering, I was greeted by not only the maitre d', but the full bar staff and servers. They were patient with my friend and I, after we chose our table (take it to the wall!/back room!)...they managed to stay courteous after we took an hour(?) to order several apps and glasses of wine...only. The staff here toes the line of too-attentive, yet seemingly know when to come by and when to leave the table at peace. The food is delicious, the service/servers are also. 

The back room is gorgeous, with a Joshua Tree/Ikebana/sweatlodge feel to it. If at first you feel it's a bit exposed, take a seat and wait for it to fill. You will have privacy.

Overall, food is comforting, fresh and healthy, the service will make you want more.
author: Sierra B.

description:
DELICIOUS CLEAN, FRESH FOOD.

It's got a great vibe.  A solid selection of various pastas, meats, and fish.  Great service.  

I won't like that places like this kind of turn me off where it seems to be more hype than anything else, but I really liked it.  Maybe it's the lure of R.E.M. and Mumford & Sons that was playing, while I enjoyed my gnocchi... but I was a pretty happy camper there and would definitely go back.
author: Christine K.

description: the food is grate. always ask for a seat in the back room.Service is excellent, and the waitress was very attentive you should get the calamari
author: Arden M.

description: Nice atmosphere, good service and good food. The baby beet salad was tangy and tasty. I had the gnocchi with chanterelle mushrooms, delicious. He had the tagliatelle with pancetta and artichokes. It was also really good, a bit too garlicky for my taste, but he loved it.
author: Scott R. D.

description: My friend and I were spending a few days in San Francisco. We got there for a drink, and at the very start, had a great experience, great chat and help from our waiter to choose a wine and had a lovely time... until we asked for the check, and our waiter totally LOST IT on us! He went literally crazy, insulted us because we asked if we could pay separately and took his sweet forever to get us our checks, profuciently apologize TO HIS COLLEAGUE in front of us for OUR rudeness. Seriously, YUCK! Say goodbye to your tip--and please, see someone about your anxiety issue.
author: Emilie D.

description: Although the chef is French-trained, the menu is eclectic. Our waiter says it varies a lot. We had butter bean soup, baby beet salad, pasta, side of green beans (haricots), with tarte tatin for dessert. Everything was excellent! Service at 6pm Fri was astoundingly fast. Room temp filtered water a plus. Highly recommend.
author: Stephen B.

description:
I got here early for my reservation, but they made us wait after our reservation time for a good amount of time, which was sort of annoying.. the service was ok, but the food was only decent.

I didn't have the prix-fixe, which maybe would've made my dinner more worth it, but I paid about $20 for a steak that tasted like it was marinated in the broth of pho (which lots of people like, but I personally hate..) and it came with a watercress salad that I definitely could've done without (one of the people at my table enjoyed it though).  One of my friends got the ahi tuna, and the wild mushroom/red wine sauce was sooo savory and delicious and I usually don't even like wine sauces!

Overall, this place was mediocre and there are sooo many other places to try in SF that I probably won't be back.. 2 1/2 stars, but I'll round up.
author: Alice M.

description:
Bistro Aix post-remodel, you're killing me. 

Pre-remodel I had my rehearsal dinner here before my wedding and my husband hosted two, count 'em two holiday parties here. We could not have loved you more.

You closed in order to beautify, and we were crushed. But we waited. And waited. And now we've been back twice with the same experience, both times. Just to be sure. Poor service, as in one hour wait time to place our order. Cold entrees. Forgotten drinks. Servers so absent we had to crane our necks around for 15 minutes in order to get our check. Same menu, but not the same food or service.

And I just can't take any more disappointment.
author: Kristin G.

description:
Good Italian food, short but impressive wine list, very representative of old world style taste ... so glad I live in a wine-savvy city! 

It is claimed to be a French restaurant, but many dishes are Italian. Not to say, they are not good, but a bit strange. 

Took a star away because of the short wine list. This is San Francisco, I'm sorry, tough competition. I won't give it 5-star unless their wine list is doubled.
author: bone-dry-cappuccino L.

description: What a lovely dinner! Loved the peppers in the soy sauce, and the salad was just perfect (goat cheese). But the chicken dish was perfectly prepared with a just-right spice rub! Our waiter was fun and funny! What a sweet little spot!
author: Natasha M.

description:
I am giving Bistro Aix a total Yelp score of 3.5.  The atmosphere for a intimate meal or for a group of friends is excellent. The dining area is close, warm and not rushed in any way. 4 Yelps for atmosphere! 

The food, however, is average earning only 3 Yelps. The food was fresh and flavorful, but just lacking that extra something. 

I would go back though just for the atmosphere assuming I could find that same parking spot!
author: Charles B.

description: Great! Mushroom pasta awesome. Service welcoming and funny, yes. Great bread served, yes. Unique and original dishes, yes. Will I come back, yes.
author: Thomas B.

description: Late dinner, phenomenal value, cosy atmosphere, the best service we have experienced here in San Fran, friendly staff, really good food, and OMG amazing pie for dessert - have the pie. Yuuuuum
author: Mike J.

description:
Do yourself a favor and get the gnocchi in a sage brown butter sauce!! Heavenly!

Tuna...amazing!

Bottom line...you can't go wrong!
author: Monica M.

description:
I am sad. I could NOT wait for this place to reopen and I had dinner here a couple of days ago. i am very very disappointed. 
First of all my friend thought our waiter was drunk and I must admit I had a slight feeling she was right. 
We had to wait more than 30 minutes just to order our appetizers! (???) 
The leek soup was boring and flavorless, the house cured salmon was ok, in my memory from last time tasted 1000 times better. 
We both ordered the risotto for the main dish and it was ok. Just ok. 
I don't think I will be back for a while :(
author: Oyo S.

description: My husband and I walked in on a Sunday evening after we checked out the menu and thought it looked great. Bistro Aix was busy but not packed. We noticed a few open tables in this very small restaurant. Waited at the door while a server (hostess?) passed us twice. The bar tender looked up at us two to three times. No one asked us to be seated or indicated that the otherwise seemingly free tables were unavailable. We stood there for another minute and it became clear no one was going to acknowledge us so we left. There are too many good restaurants on Chestnut and Union to be treated like this. You missed out Bistro Aix, when we go out, we don't scrimp on food, wine, etc.
author: Melissa W.

description:
Good!

Service was very accommodating on a Sunday night for my group of 7 (which became 12 within minutes of arriving) - no reservations. They tried as hard as they could to seat us all together, but I'd say that two tables for a dozen people is more than acceptable with no advance notice!

The traditional French bistro entrees are solid. I enjoyed the chicken with a lightly crisped skin, good and juicy. The frites are tasty, even the green beans popped. 

Try the persimmon pudding for dessert - like a pumpkin pie, but denser in a good way. Refreshing!
author: Kiesha R.

description:
We wanted to travel to the City for a little French but not fancy French. We checked out reviews and decided that the vibe, menu and location for Bistro Aix felt right.

We had an early night and made reservations for 6:30PM. Got a call back confirmation. Restaurant was already full when we arrived and we were immediately taken to our table. 

Everything about the experience was exactly what we were looking for that night. Right amount of food, delicious crisp flavors, terrific service without being overly solicitous.

My husband had roasted leg of lamb with sunchoke risotto and I had Petrale sole. Perfect pink lamb, not always the case. Both were tasty dishes as were our salads. 

We skipped dessert. The place was jammed with patrons at the bar and spilling out onto the street in front as we left. It was too cold for a stroll but were it summer, the restaurant is situated between Chestnut and Lombard in perfect Marina-strolling territory. Ample parking with use of the Wells Fargo lot ($12 for the evening), or taking chances with the side streets. We'd go back in a heartbeat.  Looking forward to it.
author: Pamela K.

description: Last Wednesday night went to Bistro Aix for the first time with five other friends, and we all cleaned our plates! Delish!  A little noisy and a little pricey, but look forward to going back another time.  I had the Duck Confit with white beans and the beet salad and a fabulous sherbet for dessert.
author: June Y.

description: Solid and delicious French food, romantic atmosphere. When reserving ask to be seated in the back room which has a tree in the middle. Go for the lamb.
author: Shang S.

description:
I go to Bistro Aix when I can't decide what I want, everything on the menu is good.  The menu includes chicken, snapper, halibut, pork and steak . One night I went with a party of 6 and most of them ordered the chicken, which everyone really enjoyed.  The portion was big and most of my friends ended up taking home left overs. 

The newly renovated back area is really nice. There is now a large sky light.  We ordered a bottle of wine as well.  They have a great wine list that varies in price range.  Service was fine, but not great.   For now I won't hold it against them sense it could have been an anomaly.  Hopefully service is better next time.  If you haven't been and you are in the Marina, its worth going.
author: Michael M.

description:
Had dinner here the other night and it was good. We split a starter pizza, 
which was delicious.

Then Kevin and I shared a beet salad (good!) and gnocchi? Both us and our friends brought a bottle of wine. Theirs was good, ours was not. So none of us got to try their drinks and/or wine. 

Regardless, good food, good service, love the back patio.
author: Art A.

description:
Had my BDay dinner here with a friend of mine and we both just love the food. We started the night with Crispy Duck Leg Confit, I am not a big fan of duck dishes but this one was really good, the meat was very juicy and cooked perfectly. My friend ordered Bouillabaise with Halibut & Mussels she absoutly loved it. The flavor was really good and the portion was def. a plus for her. I had the Grilled Rare Ahi Tuna which was exceptional. The tuna was grilled just about right, and it was very tender which I enjoyed very much. Mashed potatoes was very tastey with garlic and just the right amount of butter. The portion @ this place is perfect for us with enough room for desserts.

Both Chocolate Cloud Cake & Tahitian Vanilla Bean Creme Brulee was good. I would say the chocolate was better since the Brulee had too much sugar on top and was a bit on the thick side. The prices you paid for the food you get is def. well worth it. I would come back here again, espeically for speical occasion.
author: Miaka W.

description: This has become our Friday night go-to. The menu is always changing and everything I've tried has been fantastic. The neighborhood/locals atmosphere is also a draw - we've started to see the same people Friday after Friday! Travis, the bartender is so much fun and really knowledgeable about the menu and the wine list. Everything about this place keeps me coming back over and over again!
author: Lucy R.

description: I went to Bistro Aix before a show on Saturday, and had a great experience. I sat at the bar with a friend, and enjoyed a nice wine selection and delicious food. I had the Ahi tuna, and my friend had steak and fries. But were amazing! Afterwards we shared the creme brulee, which was absolutely delicious. I love this restaurant - it has a wonderful ambiance and a friendly staff. The bartender Ben was great too!
author: Frank T.

description: The decor and ambiance are pretty cool.  The back courtyard area is loud, but can seat large groups.  The service was really good; the waitress was very helpful clarifying menu items and giving advice/opinions on different dishes.  The food was alright, but everything we tried was missing something, or had one thing that was just off (way too much salt, salad dressing, etc.).
author: E B.

description:
preparation//
make reservations!  i'm so glad we did because the line was OUT the door on a weekday

ambiance//***
the front room has a bar seating and a few small tables surrounded by dark wood paneling
the back room has a sky light/roof are much better natural light for dining on a summer evening

service//***
you could tell they were trying to be attentive in spite of the overwhelming busy-ness
everyone steps up including the hostess who presented dishes as well

food//****
ask for the bread! foccacia was chewy~
sauteed gnocchi was seasoned well with the truffles and mushrooms
defnitely order the salad w/ goat cheese, lightly fried it adds texture and flavor to the salad
duck confit-- fatty yummyness over a bed of buttered beans
maine scallops were fresh and served w/ truffles (seafood special if you want to try)
grilled ahi tuna served w/ spinach over a bed of mashed potatoes -- a good combination of light seafood and heavy potatoes =P

~*~
yuM! it's ranked as top 100 in sf...for the price and quality, i can see why~^^
author: Donna S.

description:
This past Saturday I stumbled upon the newly renovated Bistro Aix after leaving the Apple Store in the Marina.  The space has been completely redone, and there has been considerable improvements to the ascetic with the same first class quality food and service.   

A few highlights i had a chance to try were: The tuna tartare, the crispy chicken, the burger on focaccia bread with fontina, and their radeberger pils which goes very well with either dish.    

If you have the chance to be here on a sunny day, request a seat either by the front window, or in the back patio.... perfection.
author: Lake C.

description: Really enjoyed our first time at Bistro Aix.  They do everything right. Awesome food, cozy ambiance and excellent wait staff.  Great place to come as a couple or a few friends.  We'll be back!
author: Jenny B.

description: It was after a concert. We were hungry. No reservations. We wandered into Bistro aix and were absolutely delighted. Great food, friendly, helpful and easygoing service. Highly recommend the burrata and eggplant appetizer, the halibut, the gnocchi and the bread.  Lovely laid-back ambience, too.
author: Gail E.

description:
We had a great dinner. Party of  8. Good service,
Good food. Nice for our large party.
author: elaine c.

description: All 3 dishes were great, although we probably needed 4 between the 2 of us to get full. The gnocchi was the stand out dish. We will return and try more dishes in the near future.
author: Captain B.

description:
The staff was very attentive. All of our food was delicious, especially the salads. The glass wine I got was pretty lackluster though.

We had the tarte tatin for dessert and it really made our night.

The music they played was a bit of an aggressively eclectic mix, ranging from Tony Bennet to Prince to Bobby Womack.
author: Benjamin M.

description:
Newly re-opened and renovated Bistro Aix doesn't seem so different from the old Bistro Aix.  What carries through is the very good, friendly service and relatively fair prices for some pretty good food.

Beet salad with greens and cheese was nice as the beets were not over-marinated.  Better still was bucatini with pancetta.  The bucatini was chewy, the panetta a bit gamey and the tomato sauce assertively spcied.  In fact this was one of the best pastas I have ever had, as good as what you get at Perbacco or Delfina.  Bouillabaisse was nice but could only be a letdown after the pasta.  The broth was nice, the shellfish and potatoes likewise, but the fish a bit dry.  

Bistro Aix is a nice alternative in the Marina.
author: David D.

description:
Closed until winter for a massive renovation.  I walked by here this weekend and it looked like it had been in a fire, but apparently that isn't the case.  

I'm very much looking forward to coming back here.
author: Beau G.

description: What a great place for dinner!   Front tables on a sunny night can't be beat.  Service was friendly and attentive.  Calamari was light and crispy with lime undertones- that was our fav!  Salmon, beet salad and burger were all really tasty.  Of note, skip the pizza.
author: Piera R.

description: Delicious food and awesome atmosphere. No full bar, but very extensive wine staff and our waiter was extremely knowledgable about both the menu and the wine list. The back of this restaurant resembles a patio, but the ceiling is a large glass triangle (think the sculpture at the Louvre?) which lets light in to give the illusion of an outside area but could still be used when SF gets a little cold. Very reasonably priced food for how delish it was. Recommended! I will return.
author: Ella A.

description: Lamb was chewy and lacking flavor. Service was good, folks were nice though.
author: Charlie R.

description:
My best friend and I have a challenge going on right now - try and go to as many different and new restaurants as we can - no repeats until 2011.  Came here on Friday evening and were welcomed warmly and seated immediately.  The restaurant is beautifully designed and laid out, and it just has a great aura about it. 

For dinner, I ordered the gnocchi and BFF ordered the roasted chicken.  Probably the best gnocchi I've had in some time.  It was super rich without being too much, and the English peas were so fresh I wouldn't be surprised if they had been picked that day.  BFF ate all but two bites of her chicken (and we also try not to eat more than half of what we order in one sitting.)  If that doesn't speak volumes, I don't know what does.

The service was excellent - friendly, efficient and not bothersome at all.  I've seen in other reviews that they felt the service was lacking, but to me, that was not the case at all - flawless service, and we were there on a Friday at 7pm!  Already looking forward to coming back!
author: Megan W.

description: came here to celebrate a friend's birthday.. the back room was really nice with the huge skylight and tree with lights. our waiter was really attentive and prompt at refilling our water and wine glasses. we enjoyed everything, from the calamari and salmon for appetizers, the wine, and the entrees of gnocci, squid ink pasta, and spaghettini. can't wait to come back to try more things! the location is really cute too, close to lots of other shops, restaurants, and bars.
author: Sabrina L.

description: I picked this place based on the Yelp reviews and couldn't be happier.  Small quaint, yet inviting and delivers on service and food.  You're welcomed to a nice size bar with a decent selection of local wines.  I could see the kitchen and the cooks cooking over wood fire while enjoying the wine.  For dinner we decided to sit in the back, sky lit area which offers a charming ambiance.  I tried the burger since the bar host raved about it and it lived up to its reputation.  All in all Bistro Aix offers great service and food and a price you just can't beat.  I'll be coming back for more next time i'm in the area.
author: Sunny C.

description: Came here with my man after a day of drinking in the Presidio. You'd think anything tastes amazing after drinking, but this place failed to impress me. Okay, the calamari was pretty tasty and I loved the sauce on it. However, our meals were just okay. $22 for their ahi tuna dish over mashed potatoes and it was incredibly small and mediocre. Apparently it's their best dish there so that is a bit unsettling. My man got the chicken and potatoes and said it tasted like chicken he could have made from the grocery store. Meh.
author: Shannon G.

description: Local favorite of mine. Enjoy sitting at the beautiful white marble bar, enjoying a glass of wine and yummy food. People watching is entertaining. Seems to be a favorite first date choice which can be entertaining...!
author: Margaret S.

description: This is what every restaurant should inspire to be like.  The service was spot on.  I love the wine list!!  Attentive staff, beautiful interior and the food was fabulous.  I have dined @ Bistro Aix several times and have never been disappointed.  I reccommed all salads, pastas, fish. chicken, burgers, pizzas and even dessert!   Great dining experience.  Hands down one of my favorites!
author: Krissa B.

description: Pretty phenomenal meal. Split the Halibut and Pork chop with a friend and got Lamb meatballs, Asparagus, and Octopus for appetizer. Everything was delicious... best halibut I've had since a trip to Alaska (where the halibut was out of f***** control!!).
author: Rohan S.

description: Great food! Amazing Ambience. The Lamb, Grilled Tuna & Marinated Shishito peppers were delicious!
author: Mahak S.

description: Everything was average except the attitude which was horrible. The hostess was too curt for my liking. To my further annoyance, I had a reservation and there were tables available but she refused to seat me while I waited for my date. The waiter was friendly but the food wasn't anything to write home about.
author: Gaurav M.

description: "Lost" our reservation for 10 people on a Friday night, even though we had called to  specifically confirm earlier that afternoon and were assured they were ready for us. The hostess then lied saying they could seat us around 9pm. After waiting 45 min we decided to leave. SO disappointing and totally screwed over our night. Have actually eaten here a lot of times before and the food is just okay.
author: Maddy D.

description: Can't cook a burger right to save their lives. Ordered medium rare got it well done, sent it back. Ordered it rare and got it well done. Spacey staff as well. A shame, I had come here 3 yrs years earlier and had a delightful experience.
author: Lyn-Genet R.

description: Cute place. We were seated in the back around the lit up tree. Felt kind of like the kids corner. Our server was great, food was good but the hostess was horrible. Must have had a rough night but if that would be the face of my company, I would have a serious word with her!
author: Conny F.

description: Bistro Aix is a truly special place. It is located in the Marina, but is set apart from the other neighborhood restaurants because of its warm inviting atmosphere and friendly staff. The space is beautiful and cozy, and features a beautiful live olive tree in the back dining room. Once I enter this place, I feel as though I can relax and just really enjoy a great meal in a lovely atmosphere. The food here is superb. I recommend the baby lettuce salad with tarragon vinaigrette and and goat cheese. The grilled calamari is also delicious. Last time I went in, I loved the bouillabaise with Alaskan Halibut, Clams, calamari, tomato and fennel broth, potato and rouille and my date loved the grilled ahi tuna with mashed potatoes, fried baby spinach and port sauce. The food is fresh and the favors clean and precise. Every time I walk through the door, I am pleasantly surprised by how friendly and smooth the service is. The staff at Bistro Aix are all so genuine and professional. All in all, I love Bistro Aix and always look forward to the next time I can stop in for an amazing dinner.
author: Tomasina W.

description:
BREAKING NEWS...

Bistro Aix is reopening in 2 weeks.
Saw their ad on Craigslist with this info.
author: Betty Y.

description: Great upon Great. Strong food and wine list but it was the service that made it top notch. Yannick was a fantastic and attentive host. We sat at the bar and had apps and wine. It was Romantic and lovely.
author: Mark O.

description: great setting for a birthday dinner for my 79 year old dad! the grandkids joined us for dinner and loved the ribs and the ahi tuna!
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
Party 0f 6 based on excellent Yelp reviews chose this restaurant for 
a B-day celebration. We all felt the average of 4 stars is way over rated for dropping $ 50 per person.

Pros and Cons:
Good artisan breads yet it was served COLD and not warmed in the oven.  We initially had to ask if they served bread and had to ask for refill.

Table area for 6 was a little tight in space.

The pizza was simple but had a lot of taste.
The potato pasta with mushroom was fresh but was lacking in the taste department. Waiter did not offer fresh grated cheese that would help the dish.

Entrees:

Kobe Hamburger was made to my Medium request and was the best
value on the menu.  The bread was soft and good.  The french fries had a good portion but was under cooked by a minute or so.

Both Fish dish was fresh and had good portion served.  But the
sauce lacked any kick in the favor department.

Lamb dish was made to a Med Rare and Medium request.  The risotto was excellent.

The pork dish used excellent meat but was way overcooked.
 If it was my dish, I would have rejected it.

The $ 60 bottle wine was good but it was French wine and had to
be aired in white wine glasses?

 Apple Tart was Ok.
Citrus Cake - average, sauce did not go well with the cake.

Service ... A mandatory 18% for  a party of 6 did not go well with
me.  Reservation was made through Open Table with a Birthday note.
Nothing was done except a waitress on the way OUT  said,"Happy B-day". Our waiter was a spaced out cadet and seemed out of control all night.  Not a well orchestrated wait staff.

Atmosphere and Decor - Nice , it was a cold night the heater could
have been turn up a few degrees up.
 
We had better, not coming back!!!.
author: Food Sage W.

description: The calamari was excellent as was the gnocchi. Both very different and delicious. If we lived in San Francisco w would definitely go back
author: Barb L.

description:
Cute place, enjoyed my food. They have an outside covered patio area with lots of heaters, but it was still a little chilly on a December evening. Six of us were seated outside with a few other empty tables around us on a Saturday evening. Their wine list was longer than their food list! But we finally decided on two appetizers, the fried calamari and their bacon and leek pizza. The calamari was quite tasty; it was really tender and came with this lovely "asian slaw" as they called it. The pizza was on a thin crisp crust and was quite enjoyable. Most of us had the ribeye which was topped with garlic butter and accompanied with fries and some greens. The ribeye was tender and cooked to order, but oddly was sliced for you, rather than served as a complete steak. I enjoyed the gnocci, which they gladly replaced the brussel sprouts with spinach for me. The gnocci was a little firmer than I'm used to, but was still tasty. It was served in a butter sage sauce, which made the dish a bit heavy/greasy and salty. One of us had the smoked salmon salad, which was nicely prepared. The smoked salmon topped a thin layer of some sort of cream cheese and julienne cut and fried potatoes, which was quite tasty! It came over some fresh greens. The last entree we had was the sole, which was topped by an olive sauce. We all agreed that we never thought something that wasn't an olive could taste so...olive-y.

Overall, we enjoyed our meal, the service was attentive, and the atmosphere was cute. We had a good time, but nothing stood out enough for me to come out of my way to find myself back here again...but if in the area, I might stop by again.
author: Christine L.

description:
I'm not a Marina Girl.  But, isn't there a saying that goes something like, "if you can't join 'em, beat 'em?"  At least, I THINK that's the way it goes... So I accepted a dinner invite and headed to the Marina to pummel some trust fund babies.

But when I got there, I decided I was a little too chipper and my nails were a little too manicured to bash empty skulls, and reversed my original goal to read: "if you can't beat 'em, join 'em." 

So I tossed my hair back, applied my $30 lip gloss, tightened the straps on my water bra, tried to look like I hadn't eaten in months, and sauntered into Bistro Aix with my good friend.  

He drank wine, while I sipped calorie-free Diet Pepsi.  We were lucky enough to find seating in the back patio area.  Our quiet table for two was suddenly ambushed by bread baskets and water carafes and wine glasses and plates with green salad + warm breaded goat cheese, and pizza, and chicken.

What a delicious indulgence.  2 people = ~ $90 + tip

Our waiter was friendly and the crowd was well-mannered (like me, when I'VE been drinking) and beautiful (like me, when YOU'VE been drinking).
author: Janney B.

description:
Eight o'clock on a Saturday night 
The Marina rocks, the Marina rocks  
Crowds on the sidewalk in broad daylight  
Up and down the blocks, everyone drinks and talks 

Everywhere the bars are full 
Screaming over the noises like a buzzing fool 
Elbow to elbow, hey where's my space? 
Let's go try at Bistro Aix 

Nice little menu and a back patio  
Host in jeans is really in the know 
French wine at the bar until a table is ready 
Chat about investing but not too heady 

She orders butter lettuce, it's a real French salad 
Cured salmon on greens are more to my palate 
Heat lamp on the patio makes it a warm outing  
Quiet enough to talk without shouting 

Hamburger fontina panini medium well  
Shoestring fries make us feel swell  
Bouillabaise served for My Lady, too 
It includes halibut, who woulda knew?  
 
Dessert is a cloud cake for her without flour 
A genmai cha green tea for a beverage 
We're leaving for home at the 11:00 hour 
A wonderful time, I'm happy for the privilege 

---------------
3 glasses Bergstrom pinot noir 
2 glasses Malbec 
1 butter lettuce 
1 cured salmon 
1 bouillabaise 
1 top sirloin burger w/fontina 
1 cloud cake 
1 genmai cha 
---------------
$132.59
===============
author: David D.

description: We have been just once, I am sure we will be back here though. It was just fine for us, but we have many other places we preffer much more. The dinning area is nice though. The food was fine.. just not the best in the city. IMHO :)
author: Kirk M.

description:
Want a great meal for under $20?  Bistro Aix has a great prix fixe dinner Sun-Thur until 8pm...choice of soup or salad and one of three entrees for $19.95.  On a Monday night the place was packed but service was quick and professional and the food tasty.

They also have a cool backyard patio for these ever increasing warm summer evenings in SF.  Marina or not, Bistro Aix is a great place for an inexpensive night out.
author: phil h.

description: The food is not spectacular but the atmosphere is very nice, especially in the back with the tree in the middle of the room and the skylight.  The service is fast and very friendly.
author: Sailing A.

description:
No complaints, none at all.

I don't eat often in the city (thanks Yelp for guiding me!) and Aix was a great complement to a magical night of walking around the Palace of Fine Arts at night.

It's December now, but we got the back patio -- even though it was chilly, we got sat under a space heater that made it almost TOO warm. The patio is really pretty too; stars and murals, hanging lights... it's a beautiful space.

First off, I love the fact that they have a bottle of water at every table. It's probably tap water, and those who might like cold water best might be offended by it being room temperature, but it's a great touch. We didn't order any appetizers, but the bread they served us was DELICIOUS - three different types of bread, one foccacia and two loaf breads.

Our meal took awhile to come to us, but that was okay - we had a couple glasses of wine to hold us over (that said, I didn't mean to get more than one glass... the waiter came over, and I heard "Can I get your glass?" when he actually said, "Can I get you another glass?" - I was a bit surprised when he brought another glass. Oh well, more pinot grigio for me!)

I got the crispy chicken with haricots blanc and roasted garlic potatoes, and my partner got the bouillabaisse. Both were excellent (according to him, I don't like shellfish much). My chicken was crispy and -really- moist, and the green beans had some sort of season on it (other than butter and salt, yum) that made them really excellent. I would have liked it if the potatoes were a little -less- fluffy and light (seemed over-whipped) but they were still good.

Great time all around.
author: Tracy O.

description:
They are open till late Saturday nights and we follows bunch of other people and ended up here :)
