The service was attentive but by no means pushy, and the staff we encountered were super friendly and helpful with suggestions. It is possibly just a touch overpriced considering the simplicity, but then again, I am willing to pay more for fresh local products delivered in such a pleasing locale.
author: Carrie L.

description:
This place is great -no doubt about it - especially since I avoid the marina like the plague 

You will not find a better burger in the city, and I've been everywhere. Get it med rare with Gorgonzola. 

The bread of all things is superb and everything else on the menu is done just right. The servers are perfect and the Chef is topnotch 

Perfect spot for a date night or just casual dinner - french food, but done without the pretentiousness found in most places in sf 

Matt the bartender there is a rock star - even if it's is only beer and wine 

one of my favorite spots
author: Jerome, Jerome T.

description:
Aix de bistrot est un de mon favorites de san francisco. Le menu est assez simple mais la nourriture est faite bien. Le frites de bifteck et le poulet rti sont parmi mon favorites. Ils ont aussi un grand menu de fixe de prix avant 8 du soir pendant la semaine. 

L'endroit a une ambiance invitant. Je recommande la sance dans le secteur de patio arrire. Il a une atmosphre agrable et les lampes de chaleur avec le vin vous garderont toasty. Le service toujours a t amical et attentif. Un grand endroit de date.  

For the French illiterate: http://ets.freetranslation.com/
author: Andrew C.

description:
There are very few things that bring me to the Marina, but damn, Bistro Aix's burger really does it for me. Definitely one of the top burgers in the city...up there with Chez Mama, the Richmond, Absinthe (back in the day...and haven't had Zuni's yet--I always fall for the chicken there).

Screw the wait and sit at the counter. Waiter is really friendly.
author: L N.

description:
Ate at Bistro Aix last night.

Its a very cool space. Simple colours, great black and white photos on the wall, an open kitchen. The real highlight here is the awesome food.

There were two of us. We shared the butter lettuce salad, and had the top sirloin steak and the lamb. Everything was great. My steak was one of the best steaks i've had in a long time - cooked perfectly. I'll definately order it again when i go back.

Only reason it didn't get the 5th star is we had to wait a short while before being seated, despite a reservation. But it wasn't a big deal. They served us wine while we waited.
author: David H.

description:
I used to work here some years ago....so this may be a tad bias. And like some other reviewers...I am not the marina type...(which is maybe why I got fired ;). And I can be a pretty vengeful person so for me to give this 5 stars says a lot! 

I love this restaurant. I love the food. And because I love the food so much I even love the owner/chef who fired me many many years ago. If he hadn't...I would probably still be working there eating and eating and eating (and getting fat) and drinking and drinking and partying after work every night (getting fatter) realizing I need to go into rehab. 

I just checked the menu to see it hasn't changed too much from when I worked there so I know things must have remained fantastic. They still have the ahi with a few tweaks I see they made to the dish..but that was my FAV!!! So yummy!

I love the guys in the kitchen and I hope they are all still there!
The owner is obsessed with keeping his wine list perfect so I'm sure that hasn't changed. He's also a good chef too which doesn't hurt.
This was a great date restaurant and was also a huge hit for it's back patio.

Even if you don't like the Marina....I would still check this place out. Love it (in case you haven't caught that yet... ;)
author: Jocelyn J.

description:
Café Aix has such great ambiance. At around 8pm on a Saturday night, our table of 5 was seated in 15-20 minutes without reservation. We got a fantastic table out in the patio area where Christmas lights hung from the roof top. Super cute. For this, Café Aix gets additional kudos. 

Our waiter was cool and we got our food in a reasonable time. I had a yummy corn soup (with actual kernels) and average spaghetti.

I'd come here again for a casual dinner outdoors.
author: Han C.

description: Tried 3 appetizers here. Grilled calamari, beef tongue, and mushroom gnocchi. All 3 well presented and tasty. As an appetizer they are enough for 1 person. The gnocchi howver is big enough to be a main dish.
author: Jean Francois K.

description: Fantastic service and delicious food. The buttermilk panna cotta was divine!
author: Desiree S.

description:
Loved the food -- solid menu of appetizers and main. The chocolate cake for dessert was excellent. 

We had a very large party (10+ people), and they really struggled with serving our group. We were seated late and didn't start eating until an HOUR after we were seated. 

I actually found the staff to be somewhat rude before the meal (when we were trying to get seated) and also during the meal. They seem very ill-equipped for large parties. 

I would definitely not return with a large group.
author: Mariya P.

description: Fabulous back  room for private parties, work events, etc. The staff and food were amazing! I am looking forward to going back for another party.
author: Elsa E.

description:
FOOD: tart tatin with caramel and blood orange salad were perfect.  Seared ahi tuna was mostly unseared and interestingly paired with mashed potatoes and spinach, which I would typically expect with a red meat like steak.  Apparently the ahi tuna is THE most popular dish at Bistro Aix, according to our waiter, so something must be right.

SERVICE: good.  Thoughtful, not too lax, not too pushy.  Promptly seated with reservation.

AMBIANCE/SCENE: cozy, candles, packed, very Marina, 30s/40s crowd.
author: Chris P.

description:
The outdoor patio, with its white Christmas lights and intimate feel, is the perfect place to enjoy small plates in a tucked-away bistro atmostphere (which is bustling on weekends), even with its tables precariously perched upon pebbly pavement and the heat lamps set to "scald."  The small plates are delicious and they serve a gorgeous Bordeaux by the glass.

On dates or with small groups, I always savor a good meal and a great glass of wine here.
author: X E.

description:
This is one of my favorite restaruants of SF.  I took my dad here for his 60th and I took 10 friends here for my 30th.  Service ROCKS, bartender knows his game, great wine list (superb actually), boutiquey place, super cute outside with a HUGE Van Gogh mural on the wall.  The goat cheese mesulen salad is the bomb.  The also have a mid week prix fixe that I love.  

I've been here a few times by myself too and just kicked it at the nice intimate bar.  

It's a good local restaurant.  All kinds of people from financial district folks in nice threads who just got off work, to jeans and a jacket people, to apres yoga types as well.

I LOVE this place!  solid!
author: Fresh M.

description:
The food was not stellar as most the reviews led me to believe.

The service was also not too stellar, although our waiter was super friendly and checked back often.

I ordered my meat medium well and received a bloody chunk of flesh.  That kinda grossed me out.

All in all, if you want a fancy-ish restaurant, and don't want to spend over $100 for two people (this includes a half bottle of wine), then you may like this place.  

Being that it is 15 mins driving to here from my house, I most likely will not go back.
author: william c.

description:
Have been to Bistro Aix three times, twice in the last 6 months.  The past two times I have sat in the back patio and the service has been terrible.  I went with a group of 4 and 12 and had the same waiter both times.  The first time, he was fairly rude and impatient.  This past weekend, we went with a group, and same result.  Even the kitchen was slooooow-realize a group of 12 is difficult-but one of the people in my group was finished with his meal by the time mine was served!  We decided to skip dessert not because we were full, but because it probably would be another 45 minute ordeal.

On the positive side, food is very good and the price is very reasonable, too bad the service will make me think twice before coming back!
author: Mike K.

description: One of my favorite spots in town! The food is spectacular every time I go. (Also, obviously - the staff is super!)
author: Lucy M.

description: What happened to the restaurant? Did it close for good? It's been "closed for repairs" for 9 months & the phone is now disconnected. We loved this place!
author: jennifer M.

description: Awesome service, tasty food. I love the casual , clean feel of the restaurant. Everything we ordered was delicious. I had the petrale sole and pumpkin soup. Both had great flavor! I will definitely be coming back
author: oi y.

description: Great food and wine selection. Loved their burger, cracker bread pizza and lamb chop. This place is definitely worth visiting multiple times.
author: Mekhala M.

description: Hadn't been here in awhile--actually not since the remodel.  Very impressed with the overall experience.  Food was very good & ambiance/service was top notch.  Definitely putting Bistro A back in rotation
author: T H.

description:
OK so I'm not the first to give five stars....that said, it is rare that I give five.  I've been go Bistro Aix more times than I can count on my fingers, and, should I care to take off my shoes, my toes.   

What you can count on here is consistency.   Service; always great.  The waiters, though sometimes overworked, really care about your experience.  Price; you can't beat the $20 prix fix menu for a starter and main if you don't mind dining early, before 8PM Sun - Thurs.  Quality;  I normally get the steak but decided to stray once or twice and had the chicken which  was just as over the top.   I've never been disappointed by their wines "by the glass" list either.

I most recently dined there with a couple of out-of-town friends who, as discerning Midwestern meat and potato eaters, gave it two thumbs up.  And, if I weren't in the midst of my food and wine induced coma,  I would have gotten up  to pull back in a couple of  guide book toting tourists who checked out the front window menu only to walk away.  I wanted to scream "WAIT, come back. You will LOVE it!  Alas, they had wandered off into the fog before I made up my mind to go after them......
.
author: kim c.

description:
We've been meaning to try Bistro Aix since we moved to Cow Hollow, but because they aren't on Open Table, they are never top of mind.   That all changed tonight.

We finally stopped in and loved it.  My husband had a 1/2 portion of the orecchiette as an appetizer and holy hell - it was delish.  Everything was delish, actually - especially the foccacia, which they make in house.  We even made some room for dessert - tarte tatin topped with the most amazing creme fraiche I've ever had.

Great food, great service, and the back patio is a very cool space.  We are only sad about the fact that we waited this long to bring Bistro Aix into our regular restaurant rotation.
author: Bette K.

description:
Bistro Aix is our go to place in the Marina and that's because:
1. The food is tasty - not life-changing or a gourmet experience - but consistently good and filling (the *homemade* bread is a crunchy delight)
2. The service is reliably fun and friendly - whether it is a packed house at a table of 12 or a table of two.
3. The price - you know you can have a nice meal and some drinks and not leave regretting it as you sign the bill.

It's a fun place with good food - perfect for a night when you want a *night out* but not all the fuss.
author: Taj A.

description:
This place definitely goes into my mental rolodex of 'tried & true' spots when in need of a thoroughly pleasant dining experience.

Seating

Had reservations for two and waited briefly to be reseated away from the doorway and without much inconvenience...I saw walk ins at 8ish and people were still able to get tables pretty quickly (Which, quite honestly, had me a little concerned that perhaps the reviews were overstating things).

Menu

Simple but good variety...Wine list was adequate.

Server

Understated and professional...If I had a complaint the entire night it was simply having to wait just a tad for our check but otherwise very strong service from the staff.

Food

Excellent...For appetizers we split the butter lettuce salad and the beet salad, both were terrific and not over seasoned with dressing.

I had the Ahi Tuna and my wife had the sirloin and we both loved it....Very flavorful and complimented well with the vegetables and sauce.

Had both a smooth glass of the Pinot Noir and the Cote du Rhone...Perfect

Dessert saw us split a Tarte tatin that wasn't necessarily in the traditional French version but nevertheless memorable.

Truly, top to bottom, food was terrific...Very enjoyable dining experience...Perhaps not gastronomique but memorable enough that I wouldn't hesitate to return for something I know won't disappoint.

Definitely recommend and before we knew it, the restaurant was quite packed...If it's a nice night, try to get a table in the back 'garden'...On a cooler night, be aware that there is a draft that will reach you even if you are near the kitchen.
author: Barca F.

description:
The rare ahi tuna was delicious. The roast chicken breast was nothing special, a little on the dry side. The chocolate cloud cake for dessert was  especially impressive as it was apparently made without flour.

Overall a good dining experience. Nice place for a social outing; the place is a little loud to suit a more intimate dinner.
author: Julie Z.

description:
I definitely have to agree that Bistro Aix has a nice ambiance.  I came with a party of 13 for a birthday party.   Some of us got there early, and the waiter was very kind as he waited for us to all trickle in.   We sat in the back patio, which was nicely lit and somewhat cozy.  I ordered the chicken breast with potatoes and found it to be only O-K.   It was nothing special--not too dry but nothing extraordinary.  I guess it's just chicken.   I also tried the steak dish and my experience along with others who had it thought nothing great about this dish.  Meat was not tender nor was it very tasty.   By the end of the night, i felt our waiter was also losing his cool.  He was snappy when we told him how we wanted the steak cooked, and he was rude to my friend when she had asked for something.  

Overall, a cute little restaurant in the Marina.  I'm not sure if this would be my 1st choice restaurant to go back to in the Marina.
author: Liana W.

description: 8:00 reservation for a party of 10, didn't get seated till 8:45, didn't get our food till 9:45, had to ask for bread (which they then ran out of), food was ok but nothing special, won't be visiting here again.
author: E x.

description: I dined at the bar on a Friday evening. Best Burger in a long while but I asked the bartender for a good red wine to have with a burger and he poured the most expensive one the list.  He could have warned me that the glass of wine was costing more than my entire meal.  Because of that reason Bistro Aix gets only 3 stars.
author: Annie G.

description:
Man I swear this place is my diamond in the rough. Me and my girlfriend just go gaga over there delicious pasta or chicken dishes. We went with friends from outta town (AZ) , thought that we could give them a wonderful dining/ wine experience for not a wallet busting regretful evening and boy did Aix deliver, I even had a friend show up with his wife on a friday night and the table of 3 changed to a table of 5 without even a blink from the hostess or the waiter. Say what you will about this place but I am sold on the waitstaff and the chef's interestingly prepared dishes and the affordable tasty wine selection that are eclectic and soo soo yummy.
Greg J. 4 Life
author: Gregory J.

description: Excellent service. Excellent entrees. Excellent desserts. I am not sure that I would go too far out of my way to eat here, however, the parking in this neighborhood is very challenging and there are so many other great restaurants. If you do go, try to get a table in the back room. It is less crowded and has a much better vibe.
author: Mosey S.

description: Same terrific menu plus seasonal specials...as always...I've been going here on and off since the late 90's and it's consistently been delicious. Plus, there's a friendly neighborhood-restaurant vibe too. The patio in the back used to be so unbelievably charming, with it's heat lamps, starry night mural, and yes - trees. They've since remodeled it, and I found it a totally generic setting with bare walls and an actual roof (albeit one with skylight). Really boring. Eat indoors, the inside remodel is nice (but the space is small). Service was super fast - which I appreciated, given my 2 tired little girls who really weren't in the mood to eat out - but my husband and I are always up for visiting Bistro Aix. I think I even ordered for the kids before I really sat down and their pasta arrived straight away.
author: Nina S.

description:
Good food! Good wine
Can be noisy and busy,  but a really solid choice.
author: Chris M.

description:
I'm sorry I didn't make it here more often when I lived up the hill in Pac Heights.  The backyard patio is charming and the food reliable.  I had wine and an appetizer the last time I dined here, but I would definitely go back.  

I think the owners of the place should advertise a little more because it's not a well known option, even though I think it should be.  There is some money being left on the table here.
author: John M.

description: Price point too high for product?  And not very French.   Seemed like expensive American fare: Hamburger, pork chops and a steak that I ordered medium rare but served well done.  Still, an enjoyable dinner was had and the servers were great.
author: Estelle R.

description: I came here with my bf for a nice dinner as a treat.  We had the five-course tasting menu and everything was superb.  The wine which was paired with each of the courses went perfectly together.  I can't wait to go back here although it won't be soon because it is quite pricey but if you're looking for a place where your money won't go to waste then this is right up your alley!
author: Carly P.

description: Was highly recommended by a new friend and we were not disappointed.  Great food and service.  I am not a brussels sprout fan but I have to say theirs are terrific!  I had the seafood pasta and it was outstanding as well.  Definitley a returning on out next vsiit to San Francisco.
author: Mark H.

description:
The back porch is really romantic. On Fridays and Saturdays, i'd make a reservation. it gets busy.

For French food, the quality is excellent, and the prices right. It's very difficult to find such a good price to quality ratio. This French restaurant will not break your piggy bank, and you'll be fed properly. 

I recommend the duck confit, the 2 pasta dishes, and the lamb (yum).
author: Jerome F.

description:
Went to AIX after drinks at Nectar.

Food:  3/5
Drinks:  3/5

Wasn't really thrilled with the entire experience for the price.
author: Dee F.

description: great food, great atmosphere,and a super friendly staff, waay above Marina Standard. Last night, the friendly hostess had promised a table within ten minutes, so we ordered a drink at the bar. Well, it ended up taking 30 minutes. We had dinner and when I realized they had not added the drinks from the bar, I went back to the bar to pay the two drinks. It was on the house as he apologized for the additional wait. Mistakes happen, THIS is the way to handle it. And to get 5 stars on Yelp.
author: Peter J.

description:
better than mom's!

and my mom is an excellent cook.

this place felt like home.  whether you sit in the resto or in the patio area.  the space was charming and the food was comforting.

1. the baked goat cheese salad was delicious.  the warm breaded crunchy coating was a nice textural contrast to the smooth and velvety cheese and to the acid of the dressing.
2. the beet salad was light and fresh - a good choice if you order a heavy entree.
3. the crispy roasted chicken was tender, flavorful, and so juicy.  it's a must order or convince someone to order it so you can have a taste.  
4. the  cracker crust pizza was light and scrumptious.  i like mine pure and simple but there are a couple of choices for toppings.

and last but not least, dessert for me lately has been another glass of wine and a cheese plate.  theirs came with thin apple slices and honey.    

cheers!
author: Anh V.

description: Everything I've had here has been great! The chicken was spectacular, and their seared ahi tuna was amazing. The soups are always really tasty, same with the salads. It's quiet, cozy, and always seems inviting. It's hard to choose this over Isa when I'm in the area, but it's consistent enough to keep me coming back. Really good place.
author: Stephanie B.

description: wife and I came here based on the solid yelp reviews. atmosphere in the front is nice, wouldn't recommend being seated in the back if you can avoid it.  The food was average and tough for healthy focused eaters... everything was buttered up.  Average dinner experience, won't be coming back soon.
author: Mike L.

description:
We went here after the second game of the World Series.  (BTW,why is it called the World Series when only teams from the US take part?!)

We were very lucky to get a table by the window and so got to watch many drunken revelers go by.  I had the fish of the day, which was cooked really well - just right in fact.  Pretty noisy, but how many SF restaurants aren't?
author: Stephen F.

description:
I recently hosted a small post-wedding dinner at Bistro Aix and I could not be happier with the restaurant and the staff -- particularly Stephen, the manager.  

We were looking for a reasonably priced, intimate setting with simple, good food.  We found it!  We reserved the small private room above the restaurant and our little party of 25 was treated as though we had bought the place.  It exceeded our expectations.  

A particular hit was the chicken.  I know...chicken!  I'm not usually a fan either but this restaurant works magic with it.  

If you are looking for elegant but unpretentious, quality with zero attitude, service of the highest order, and value, then Bistro Aix is the one for you.
author: William G.

description:
Okay food with a good atmosphere. We ended up going for the prix fixe on a Thursday night. The salad with goat cheese was good. I ended up ordering the chicken.  The meat itself was tender and flavorful.  The green beans were limp and bland (overcooked), and the potatoes were bland except for the occasional grinding crunch of salt chunks between my molars (a nice reminder that I need to see a dentist in the near future).  S.O. got the steak. It was cooked well, but the flavor was rather bland.  The fries were limp - obviously undercooked.

I have to say that I just don't know what all of the fuss is about. I don't plan to return.
author: Meredith M.

description:
Sorry,Michael Bauer, but this does not deserve 3 stars ! Just barely 2 or better 1 1/2.
First of all it is not really French and second not very tasty or well prepared.
They seated us in the back room which is very cold and lonely with a tree in the  middle. Walls are bare also. So we asked for a table in the front which we got. Better - more lively.  Servers tried but came off as a bit indifferent.
We had 4 appetizers:
Smoked salmon with potato galette and greens. While it was tasty, the salmon(very thin) was placed over the galette .I would have preferred it separate.  Grilled calamari with olive spread inside the calamari on a piece of toast. Strange combination and I did not see the bean dip. Taste : boring.
Heirloom tomato salad with feta: 2 big thin slices and 2 really small slices with feta and herbs. Ok but a bit strange.
Ahi Tuna pasta with olives and tomato sauce. Huge pasta like penne only much bigger,so so  - also very salty.
Dessert was better:Panna Cotta  with fruit. Very light,refreshing and not too sweet.
The waitress could not understand that we wanted to finish our bottle of wine first before we started dessert and proceeded to come over to  check on us. By the way the wine,a $ 35 Beaujolais  was not good either.Maybe we should have spent more to get a better wine but it should not really matter.
This was my first time there so I cannot comment on the remodel. But what stuck out were the bare  walls. Mirrors maybe would have been nice if the budget is limited.
Michael Bauer where is your head ??
author: Maria C.

description: Great atrium area in the back to eat, good wine list, we went early so service was great, not too busy. Menu does change, my duck ravioli was amaaaazing.
author: Mike J.

description: "The burger is the bomb! One of the best we've (party of 3) ever eaten. It melts in your mouth. Truly delightful! The bartender, owner and other guests were also top notch."
author: MC M.

description:
(3.5 stars because of the bug in food.)

What do you eat at a French restaurant? Why, French fries, of course!

Seriously, the hamburger and french fries were delicious. Be sure to add gorgonzola cheese to the burger, which adds "pep" according to the waiter. The calamari with the Asian slaw was different than what I had before, but still very good. The half bottle of Minervois la Liviniere was definitely worth it. Or maybe it wasn't worth it, because my stupid friends repeatedly tried to say the name all night. And butchered it every time.

The negatives: The rest of the foods we had were .. okay. The gnocchi, chicken breast, and boullabaise were not particularly memorable. The waiters were attentive, but also seemed a little dull and serious. One of my friends found a bug or worm on the tomatoes, which were on the side of the hamburger. We showed the waiter, and he just gruffly said "I'll fix that," took the plate -- without an apology -- and came back soon after. I wouldn't have been surprised if he just went to the kitchen, flicked it off, and brought the same plate back.
author: Kevin S.

description: Went for the first time last night and LOVED it!  Fabulous food, not overpriced, very cool atmosphere, right down to the music and the lighting.  The owner, Jonathan Beard, could not have been nicer.  When he told me he's been there for 16 years, I knew he was probably doing something right.  And it turns out that he certainly is - for me, this was like a quick trip to the Murais neighborhood in Paris for dinner.  I had the steak, started with tomato and goat cheese salad, and finished with cheeses - all were excellent, high quality, and very authentically prepared.  Also took advantage of their unusually good selection of half bottle wines.  Was a great night and I'll definitely be going back on future trips to San Francisco.
author: Kent Z.

description: You can't go wrong with stellar service, scrumptious dishes and the Black Key's playing during your meal. Bistro Aix is a fantastic neighborhood restaurant that will draw me back to the often ostentasious Marina whenever I am jonesing for quality classics served in a warm and inviting space.
author: Jamie S.

description: Had a great meal here with 3 girlfriends. Super friendly service, good wine selection, fantastic food. Highly recommend it!
author: Kari M.

description: The wait staff was cordial and helpful.  The tastes were superb.  Best calamari ever.  Beet salad was lovely.  Tagliatelle with chicken -- divine.  Bistro Aix deserves our highest recommendation in a city known worldwide for the finest restaurants.  We'll be back!
author: Henry M.

description:
If I lived in the Marina, I'd eat at Bistro Aix on a regular basis.  It's one of those awesome neighborhood restaurants that offers quality food at affordable prices.  

Food:  5 stars.  Come between 6-8pm on Sun/Mon/Wed/Thu to take advantage of the $23 two-course prix fixe menu.  Unlike some restaurants, Bistro Aix is willing to offer some of their best dishes as choices on the prix fixe menu.  As appetizers, we had the asparagus soup, which was creamy and lick-the-bowl delicious, and the mesclun green salad with tarragon vinaigrette, which must be paired with the optional ($1.50 extra) warm breaded goat cheese.  For entrees, the grilled top sirloin with maitre'd butter was perfectly cooked, tender, and juicy with flavor.  The accompanying french fries are better than McDonald's, but the dish didn't need the watercress salad.  The crispy roasted chicken breast is a standout - it's so juicy and delicious.  I finished every bite, including the equally delicious crushed baby red potatoes and the haricots verts that came with it.  For dessert, the chocolate cloud cake is fantastic.  The cake has the texture of a light brownie and pairs perfectly with the coolness of the whipped creme fraiche.  

Service:  5 stars.   Service is polished, professional, and friendly.  The servers definitely lend to the neighborhood feel of the restaurant.  

Atmosphere:  4 stars.   The room is definitely alive...maybe too alive.  I could barely hear my conversation with my friend because some of the patrons are too loud, especially in the front room with the bar.  Otherwise, the mostly good-looking Marina crowd makes up for it.

Hits:   Asparagus soup, mesclun green salad with warm breaded goat cheese, grilled top sirloin, crispy roasted chicken, chocolate cloud cake.

Misses:   Noisy atmosphere.

If You Like This Place, You'd Probably Like:  1550 Hyde Cafe and Wine Bar, Nopa, Range, Slow Club
author: Keith C.

description: Charming little place in the heart of the Marina. Came here on a Sat night and had dinner for two. The ahi tuna was OUTSTANDING. We'll be back for that again for sure. The burger was just ok. Not bad, but not special either. I agree with others about the service. Our waiter probably would have ignored us completely had we not been seated right in the middle of the restaurant. He left dishes on our small table throughout the meal and rarely checked on us. We'll be back for sure because of the tuna, wine list and ambiance.
author: Amy H.

description: FANTASTIC.  I had the chicken, a nice cab and rounded it out splitting a desert and coffee.  MMMMM magic!   I say go...the marina is nice...I said it!!  So there, it reminds me of covent gardens on Chestnut street and it is a nice place for a post dinner walk or smooch fest...plus it's filled with Brad, Jeff, Jennifer and Lindsays...so who cares if they see you...hehehe.  (In case your name was just stated, I apologize if I offended you, you see...those are typical frat boy/sor. girl names)  So, in closing, not too expensive for a great night out.
author: Jess S.

description: Finally had a chance to make it to this quaint spot and so glad i did.  i was with a large group of regulars.  was surprised to find a wonderful heated outdoor patio.  wonderful menu...most of my group ordered the ahi tuna with wasabi mashed potatoes. i caved in and was not disappointed.  can't understand how they managed to make the potatoes so light!   Can't wait to come back and sample the rest of the menu.
author: Angela N.

description: Solid continental fare with some Californian flavor.  They have good steak, lamb, fish, pasta, and salads.  It can get crowded in the evening but you can sit at the bar area and have a drink while you wait for a table.  This is a good place to take people with a variety of tastes because everyone can find something to eat.  I like the appetizers here which give a good variety of fresh vegetables.  A nice intimate date place.
author: apple r.

description: Prix fixe--total bargain. All the boys at the table had the read meat. And the rest of the entrees and apps are solid too. Non-greasy, tempura'd calamari and duck confit (which we shared) for apps--excellent. I'd say my pork chops, not on the prix fixe, won. With broccolini and fingerling potatoes, it felt oddly light and hearty. Everyone wanted a piece. The strawberry crepes for dessert were on the light side too. And sitting on the patio was very pleasant. The whole place is just nice and simple, but done well.
author: Genevieve R.

description: Excellent food, excellent service, and great ambiance to spend some time with food and friends. I had a generous plate of spaghettini with some a couple glasses of sangiovese and cotes de rhone red wine (both of which were balanced and damn fine, especially the sangio). Travis our server was johnny-on-the-spot with service and an overall cool friendly dude. I'm gunna have to head back to try more of the menu. Also, California Wine Merchant is close by and an excellent spot to have an after dinner glass or two or five of vino.
author: Kelly N.

description: Took advantage of the prix fixe offer and paired it with a great bottle of wine. Definitely request the back patio, as it is an excellent place to enjoy good food and wine along with great conversation. As another reviewer noted, similar to Isa in many ways, but with a French flair. C'est magnifique!
author: Chris B.

description: I was starving and stuck in the Marina. A16 had an hour long wait, so we ended up here. The home made bread is very good. I was starving so I stuffed myself with the homemade foccacia type bread soaked in olive oil. We also ordered the thin crust pizza, which I really enjoyed. The pork special was good, but nothing special. Overall the food is good and well priced, but the wine is rather expensive. If I wasn't starving, I probably would have prefered to wait the hour to eat at A16.
author: Karen C.

description: Surprisingly good.  I had low expectations as I was sullenly trudging down the street waiting for a 25-minute line at Pac Catch.  We decided to drop in.  The ahi was rare as I like it and the wine menu was really deep.  The patio was really nice as well - the heat lamps were not too cranked up as to broil us.
author: Rob K.

description: Went to Bistro Aix for the first time last night and had a wonderful evening.  The warm goat cheese salad was every bit as good as described below, and the salmon salad option my friend ordered was equally good.  Steak and frites cooked to absolute perfection.  The fixed price menu was a real bargain at $19.95 and the atmosphere and service quite charming.  Definitely recommend for a special night out, sophisticated without the feeling of being 'stuffy'.
author: Mark N.

description: When I can't get into Isa, I have no qualms about eating next door at Bistro Aix.  The food here is great, the wine list is excellent and they also have outside seating in the back.  Good place for medium-sized groups and there is something on the menu for everyone.  Haven't ordered anything I didn't like here.
author: Katie P.

description: This is my favorite place to eat in San Francisco.  I used to live a few blocks away, but am now out in the Tri-Valley.  We try to get there as much as possible.  Hard to go wrong with anything on the menu.
author: Steve N.

description: Bistro has the best burger in the city hands down.  Another plus - Chinon by the glass.  No one ever sells Chinon by the glass!  All of the food on the menu is fabulous, and the host is the nicest guy around.  I love this neighborhood restaurant, and the only reason I gave it four stars is because the service can be slow if it is busy.  However, I don't mind.  Everyone is nice and the food is great.
author: Carrie R.

description:
I'm really sorry to say that NYE here this year went no where near as smoothly as last year unfortunately. I was here with Gina C. and concur with everything she had to say.

When our event planner there quit the week before our event I was definitely concerned. At that point though, it was too late to back out - we had 27 people signed up and our credit card down holding the room. Last year, we were blown away by the waitress and the event planner and how great they were at accommodating us. This year, not so much. The waiter was frazzled, and they were downright rude in general to our group. They weren't apologetic when they were out of things and made substitutes - when we'd confirmed our group size prior and had narrowed down their menu with them per their requirements to only 3 appetizers, 3 mains and 2 desserts. They cut the alcohol and tried to kick us out immediately after midnight when last year we were okayed to stay until 1 or 1:30. Some guests didn't get dessert at all. The food quality had gone down - the chicken I raved about last year was dry this year and I heard the steak meat quality was very poor. 
I don't know what's going on with this place but they need to get their act together. Maybe they changed ownership. We had 27 disappointed people who paid $80 a head for a nice NYE. We won't be back and next year we'll be taking our group elsewhere.
I should have seen the signs between our contact leaving and the wine list changing 3 times over the month or two I was planning the event - every time I submitted my sparkling, 2 whites and 2 reds I was told the wines were no longer available - but there wasn't anything I could do at that point. I'm disappointed for my friends and encourage you to take your large group elsewhere.
I'm sorry to report that our experience this year wasn't so great.  The waiter looked unhappy and stressed.  I don't blame him since they ran out of everything - we had an agreed menu selection - but were not able to get everything on that menu.

Appetizers - they couldn't handle all the requests for the calamari - so some of our guests didn't get it eventhough they requested it read more ».  Also, we had some late arrivers, and they didn't even get an appetizer - they were told they ran out.

Main Course - Steak was really fatty - heard that from several of the guests.  I heard good comments about the Tuna.

Dessert - I was very disappointed.  Me and my husband ordered the Creme Brulee - I was looking forward to it all evening.  When the desserts came, they plopped down a bread pudding which was not even one of our menu choices, and looked like a afterthought dessert - a cupcake with fruit on top.  They didn't explain to us at all why we didn't get what we ordered - they just plopped it down.  Needless to say I complained to the poor waiter and he said they ran out.  A few of the other guests didn't even get dessert.  I ended up getting the chocolate cake which was flavorless and dry....left half of it on my plate.

I heard about some other mishaps, but can't elaborate on them since I don't know the details.

My only guess to our poor service and quality of food is that they have either changed management, chef, or just were not organized that night.  

For $80 a head, it was a real disappointment.  We will most definitely be changing venues for our next year event.
author: Sarah R.

description:
Cozy, cute, clean, yummy.  I came here with a few other friends for dinner, and left very happy.  Service was great, the food was delicious and tasty, and the wine was good.

I started with the baby beet salad, which is served with spinach and goat cheese.  Good sized salad, you could easily share with another person for appetizer.  Then I had the cod, which had olives, tomato, pasta, etc. in a soup-like consistency sauce.  Light, warm, comforting.  My sister had the gnocci (vegetarian), and that was delicious as well.  My date had the grilled Hawaiian ahi tuna which is served with garlic mash and fried spinach; and to me, this was the best dish of the night.  The ahi was "cooked" perfectly- very rare, and the ahi was very good quality.  I would definitely order this if you love ahi.  For dessert we had a persimmon chocolate bread-type-pudding dessert.  It was interesting tasting (I had never had persimmons before), light, served with freshly made whipping cream and honey.  We also had a chocolate brownie served with vanilla ice cream and raspberry sauce- excellent, addicting, and super chocolate-y.  

Our server, Brandon gave excellent service.  He was attentive, kind, and fun.  His recommendations were awesome.  Great place to take a date or go with a few girlfriends.
author: Sarah F.

description: When meeting friends from Marin (some people move there when they have kids), and they don't seem like Tunnel Top types, we meet here for a simple meal in a nice garden setting (in back).  Not super fancy, and as I have not dragged myself to the new Presidio spots (preferring as I do the closeness of Potrero Hill and the Mission, if given half a voice), it may be that those will supplant this.  But it's still a very pleasant dinner here at Bistro Aix.
author: Laurel B.

description: The back patio has an SF version of starry starry night- cool. Portishead echoed over the speakers- cooler. I had the heirloom tomato salad which was very good. The salmon entree had a great presentation with greens encircling the fish which laid on the most unique cream corn I've ever tasted- like a puree. When the waiter asked if I liked my entree, I found myself smiling from ear to ear realizing, I didn't just like it, I loved it. Greatness at Bistro Aix.
author: Amanda H.

description: me and 2 other girlfriends, all professional women, went here this past friday because my most discerning friend told me it was one of if not her all time favorite restaurants.  the service was very poor to the point of rude and disinterested.  we were never asked if we wanted more wine (yes we would have thank you!) we were never checked back in on.  we had to ask for the dessert menu.  We ordered a side of spinach during the meal and got it after everyone was done with everything else and then upon asking for the dessert menu, the waitress grabbed the spinach w/o asking if i was done, swear like 5 minutes after setting it down on the table.  It ruined the experience for us and we're all pretty discerning especially when it comes to service.  We didn't feel warm and fuzzy eating there and trying to unwind from our very busy lives.  I wont be dying to go back.
author: Deborah H.

description: This place is great! Wine list is fabulous, filled with a variety of affordable and expensive wines. Service is on point! Our waitress helped us pair a wine with our meal and it was a very good pick, not to mention she was incredibly attentive and very friendly (my water glass was never empty, and I was never left wondering "where did our waitress go). Food was very tasty, a Californian-French fusion that like Calvin N. said, isn't over seasoned and is delicately prepared. Want decent priced food in a lovely setting and exceptional service? Screw Chez Maman, come here.
author: Julia T.

description: Not much to say that hasn't been said before. My wife enjoyed the duck. I thought the wait staff was strange, the atmosphere weird and uncomfortable, and the food just above average.
author: Raymond B.

description:
i don't ask much of restaurants.  all i want is good food and a good wine selection.  sometimes i'd like a nice, dry martini to start things off.  

bistro aix manages to give great food and a great wine menu.  in addition, they have a surprisingly affordable prix fixe menu which includes some of the better options from the standard menu.

i had the lamb, my friends both had the steak, and we were all very pleased with our meal.  i'm giving 4 stars rather than 5 only because i could not enjoy that nice, dry martini since they only sell wine and beer.  also, i think the waitress was brand new.  every time we asked a question about the wine or food menu she said, "i'm not sure, i'll have to check on that."  that's ok because i'd prefer she ask then guess, ya know?  it's just that it could have been avoided by simply knowing the menu.

anyway, i'm recommending this place to you.  so why are you still looking for a restaurant?  just have your smart cocktail prior to arriving.
author: Jason S.

description: Awesome.  I just love the food.  Well balanced and minimally seasoned preparation allows the ingredients to really shine here.  The food, although hearty (and sometimes traditional) in nature comes out tasting light and very Californian.  Their wine selection is WIDE so there's something for everyone.
author: Calvin N.

description: Great wine list, a menu that never fails to satisfy and a patio. The prix fixe is amazing - love the green salad, followed by the steak. This is one of those rare restaurants that you know you'll never be disappointed with.
author: jane t.

description: I have to give Bistro Aix 5 stars because it is my neighborhood favorite.  They get to know you, they are really cool, and the food is fantastic.  It's always fun to sit in the patio with the van gough fresco of SF.  The calamari and ahi tuna are awesome, and there are always great specials on the back of the menu.  For first timers, a lot of times they run out of ingredients for certain dishes, which regulars are just used to.  I guess they could overestimate and raise the prices of everything all around...  Anyways I highy recommend Bistro Aix and eat their regularly!
author: Peter Y.

description: So they knocked down the building and finally dumped that awful olive oil in the process. That said my hopes where high... the food is flat and little over priced. The staff needs to sharpen up a bit too. No personal touch. I hope the turn it around and succeed.
author: Adam M.

description: The Ahi is back, chef only puts it on the menu when he can get it line caught and it is a top ten dish in San Francisco.  Also I think they have the best servers and bar tenders in SF.  Space is causal, reasonably priced and relaxing, hard to find in sf anymore.  Bauer is right to give this place 3 stars.
author: frank m.

description: Similar to its neighbor Isa, this place mixes great food, service and atmosphere. The Prix Fixe menu (served 6-8 p.m. Sunday through Thursday) is a steal. Oh, and save room for the Rustic Apple Pie with Tahitian Vanilla Ice Cream and Caramel Sauce. It is a slice of heaven.
author: Leigh M.

description: Quite swanky!!  I am a fan of the atmosphere- dim lights, candles, modern feel.  BOYFRIENDS: TOTAL GREAT DATE SPOT.  Very romantical, BUT the check can knock you over!  Wine is expensive, the food is expensive, but it's VERY good.  I had the lamb steak, and it was incredible.  I usually don't like lamb, and I LOVED this.  The Creme Brulee was amazing as well, and I left happy, feeling VERY spoiled, and stuffed!
author: Melissa R.

description: How I've not managed to review this yet, I'm not sure, however, this place is yummy! Mmmm ahi tuna. Some seriously good stuff! What I really like about Bistro Aix is that there seems like there is something for everyone on the menu for the most part. The staff is friendly, service is totally unpretentious and the food is good. I really don't think that given the prices and everything else this place is overrated. Definitely a gem.
author: Anita B.

description: Thumbs up. I went with the bouillabaisse--often a risky bet--and it was fantastic. Tuna tacos, calamari, and beet salad apps were all good but not outstanding. The back patio atmosphere is really pleasant. I'll be back.
author: vanessa r.

description:
Had a reservation for 7, got seated right away, but not the greatest selection of tables, kind of an awkward space.

Went off of the recommedations of our server: the pizza special was pretty good, paper thin crispy crust, gruyere, leeks, broccolini and thinly sliced ham, but there were was an overload of oil floating on the crust, a bit strange.

My date had the ricotta ravioli and loved it. Said it was rich without being too heavy.

Good service, good food, not way overpriced. I'll probably go back.
author: Spring L.

description: I had my rehearsal dinner here for about 20 people back in October. I couldn't be more happy with the service, ambiance and food. I got so many compliments on how simple, yet fresh the food was. This place was very reasonable in price compared to other places with private party rooms we looked at. There was a nice variety of food on the menu for guests to choose from, but it was not overwhelming. The dessert platter was so cute and delicious, just the right way to end a meal. The upstairs room was perfectly set up with a bar and passed hors devours (sp?) by the time we got there. the waitstaff was excellent. they even brought out extra appetizers when they saw that we had run out. No one's wine glass was ever empty. Overall excellent experience. I would recommend this place to anyone who is planning a rehearsal dinner of smaller private party!
author: Ivy T.

description: Fantastic! Brilliant! I would have never thought a mid-priced Marina restaurant could be so damn good. The patio is super rad and the service is very modest and welcoming. I had the chicken and garlic mashed potatoes. Stellar? I think so. Who says chicken isn't exciting?
author: Brandon B.

description: I WAS THE LADY IN RED...nothing better than the Hung Sisters surprising a private upstairs party, room full of 25 post frat guys on a birthday dinner.  I WAS DANCING WITH THEM, CHEEK TO CHEEK...and feeding bites of the best banana cream cake.  THERE'S NOBODY HERE, IT'S JUST YOU AND ME...and fresh cuban cigars...lounging on outside deck with chillin' peeps...IT'S WHERE I WANT TO BE...
author: Wendy H.

description: YAY. A decent place with outdoor dining -- regardless of the weather.  Without a doubt, there are too few of these in SF. Calamari was great. Only downfall was the limited bar menu (only beer and wine!). But the great mural walls outside will make you forget all that.
author: Lindsey B.

description:
classic scenario, walk into this place knowing that my co yelpers love it, that it is a local fave, and just was not crazy about anything. its charming certainly. prices reasonable. but as I gladly accepted each of my server's recommendations, and agreed out loud with my date on how delicious everything was, I was actually thinking to myself, "sure, this is good," or "it's aight." (deep south for "okay)
now there was some kind of chocolate goodness that we finished with that really did me right. and the servers are pros. but I don't think I'm goin back.
author: Jeremi M.

description: I've lived in the city for about 10 months and have had people recommend many different restaurants, but nobody ever mentioned Bistro AIX.  One night my wife and I were walking by and it looked cool from the street, so we decided to give it a try.  I'm so happy we did, because it is now one of my favorite stops.  Been there five times and can't wait to go back again!
author: Will H.

description: I have eaten here several times and I must say that I have not had a bad meal here. I recall the burger and fries being quite good too. Service was great and the wine was good too.
author: Lisa H.

description: My favorite place in my neighborhood.  I could eat the spaghettini every day.  As long as they serve it with that soft foccacia that has a very thin film of olive oil and powdery salt on it - YUM!
author: Danielle B.

description: I have eaten here several times and is now one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  The food is amazing!
author: Myra M.

description: Love it! The decor is simple yet charming, the ambiance warm and romantic, the food fabulous and flavorful and the prices fare. I love sitting on the outdoor patio.
author: Sara W.

description: Our waiter had the patience of a saint.  After having people show up late and some not showing up at all, we finally ordered our food, 40 minutes after we sat down.  I'm only taking a star off because our food did take FOREVER to come, and I don't understand how the people that came 45 minutes late ordered and got their food before we did.  Wine selection is pretty good, though.
author: Jenny L.

description: Bistro Aix is a great place. I love the energy, the heated back patio, classic food, and relatively reasonable prices for good food. That said, so I think the food is amazing? No... but for a good week night French option, I'm all about it. I want to check out Clementine in the Richmond still. Have yet to find a french place I adore in the city.
author: Shoshana D.

description: My absolute favorite restaurant in the Marina. I love the seared Fois Gras and the scallops. The service is friendly and the prices are decent. You can sit inside or outside, and you'll always feel at home at this gem of a restaurant.
author: Shirley L.

description:
I'll try to sum this experience up in an efficient list:
1.) My husband and I stood around awkwardly for an unacceptable amount of time before the host arrived. 
2.) He sat us at a crappy table that got a lot of foot traffic and was right next to this tree in the middle of the back patio. The tree was surrounded by four blinding lights that were really distracting. I could understand if this were the only table available or if we had not reserved, but there were easily six other two-person tables open, and we had reserved. They did move us after we asked nicely.  
3.) The menu did not match the one online, and the one we were presented with was significantly inferior to what we were expecting. 
4.) My husband attempted to order an Heirloom tomato salad with mozzarella, and they were out--it's tomatoes.
5.) We ask for bread and were 2/3 though our appetizers before it arrived. Meanwhile, we watched a basket (ours) get delivered to the table next to us who was already paying its bill. 
6.) I ordered a glass of wine. They forget. I had to ask again. 
7.) My duck was way undercooked in relation to how I ordered it. 
8.) I found white plastic wrapping in the duck. It was obviously the type of wrapping that comes around all meat purchased at a butcher shop, but it's pretty unacceptable that the chefs would overlook that.
9.) We ordered one dessert. The waitress even made a point of telling us it's her favorite. The runner brought us an entirely different dessert. 
10.) Regardless of the plastic wrap in the duck, the rest of the food was average at best. 

My husband is French. We lived in Paris for several years. We are, admittedly, rather harsh critics when it comes to French cuisine. That does not mean, however, that one cannot find good French fare in SF. We have had good experiences at Chapeau, Chouchou, and Fringale. That's not to say these places have 5 stars, but we can only speak for our own experiences which were positive.
author: Emily D.

description: The service was good. The food was only okay. For what you pay, I'd expect a little higher quality. I ordered the halibut, and it was a bit overcooked and tough. My friend's gnocchi lacked flavor. The cheese pizza was all right, but it's cheese pizza at a gourmet price. I'd choose a different spot in the Marina for a higher quality meal or at least cheaper grub.
author: Hannah C.

description: Surroundings are nothing special, but the food is delicious. Try the crusted salmon salad. Waitstaff are very attentive.
author: Steven W.

description: Food was ok... salmon on potato thing was delish!   Kinda over priced but waitress was really great.
author: Smigor r.

description: Walking around on a Sunday night without reservations, my boyfriend and I decided to give AIX Bistro a try. Although it was a bit chilly, we decided to sit in the back patio with the heat lamps. It was a very cozy, little French bistro. I wasn't that impressed with the service at all. It took forever for our drinks to come. Not good when the food arrives before the drinks! We had the arugula salad with Mandarin oranges and manchego cheese. It was not very good.... the salad was literally swimming in the olive oil. For our entree, we had the chicken, mozzarella, basil pizza on ultra thin crust. It was actually pretty good, but not great enough for me to return. A bit disappointing overall.
author: Denise L.

description: Another cute place in the marina with pretty good food. Came in after a long hike and we were both exhausted. Sat at the bar, ordered some wine, and enjoyed their $24 prix fixe which I think was very reasonable. Ordered the french onion soup (which was actually very good because it wasn't covered in croutons and cheese) and chicken entree. The place is cozy and cute and the bartender was very nice. I don't think I'd go out of my way to come back , partially because the marina is so far from me, but if I were in the neighborhood and looking for a place to grab some simple but well prepared food and wine, would stop back in.
author: shadi m.

description: We ate here near the end of June during Pride week.  While the food here was good, the dining expereince was disappointing.  The ventilation system in the open kitchen had either failed or was in adequate  to the task of keeping the dining area clear of smoke and airbourne oil/grease, even with being seated near the open windows at the front of the restaurant.  There was a visible pall wafting past us and we left with our eyes burning and feeling as though we needed a shower.  Cannot recommend unless they repair or upgrade thier kitchen ventilation.  Hopefully the remodel mentioned by another reviewer will help in this matter.
author: Karin T.

description: Great food with nice atmosphere! We went here last night for an intimate dinner and had a very pleasurable experience. We spent about $100 and that included a bottle of wine. If you get the entree special that is offered , I recommend the soup or ask them to spruce up the salad. I had the Bouillabaise with Halibut, Mussels with Tomato Fennel Broth, Foccacia Croutons & Rouille. It was was pretty good. For wine we had the White Rock Chardonnay, which was tasty. Apparently they just raised the price because the website has not been updated.
author: Bryan M.

description:
Me again...it's 0600 and I have an hour to go before I get to go to sleep, so let's type away.....lol
My friend and I had dinner here last Sunday. He asked me what I had the taste for and the only thing I really wanted was seared Ahi. Okay, normally I would say Filet Mignon, but just wanted something a little bit lighter on a Sunday. 
OMG!!!!!!!!!!!!! That is all I can tell you about the seared ahi. I was blown away! I shared a little bit, but really felt like being selfish for a change. It was just too tasty to share. ha! ha! Highly recommend it! 
The wine was also tasty, but did I mention how delicious the seared ahi was??? LOL :) 
Decor.... we sat in the back room. The cutest patio ever! You walk into the restaurant and it looks pretty tiny, but then if you're lucky and get sat in the back patio, it's just perfect! Covered with heat lamps and a mural on wall. I really enjoyed this place. 
Oh, my date had pasta. It looked quite tasty as well, but I didn't try his pasta because I was too busy stuffing my face with the seared ahi. 
Soooooo, if you are going to check this place out, in case you haven't figured out what I would highly recommend.....yep, you got it...."Seared Ahi"!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Can't wait to go back! :)
author: Audrey S.

description: I really like this place. I've been here on a chilly winter day and sat in the cozy front, as well as on a stiflingly hot summer day when I sat on the patio. I've had really solid salads, excellent bouillabaisse and other entres. Even the pizza was good, based on reports from food-timid relatives. The atmosphere is suitable for everyone, from your out-of-town guests to groups and couples. The service is A-OK. The last waiter I had would reach across the table and slam down the glass of on the wrong side of the setting in his rush, but  no demerits since its definitely a solid, friendly restaurant.
author: jen n.

description:
Nice heated patio.  Great warm goat cheese salad. Food is nearly on par with A16, just down the street, but in a much more low key and quieter atmosphere. 

A good bet when assuming A16 will have space for drop ins.  You know what they say about assumptions...
author: B B.

description: Just went here recently for the first time.   The wait staff is nice....that's about all I can say on the service.  The bread is fresh and excellent.  For the entree I had lamb chops and they were very good.   Above average wine list.  They didn't have my selection but recommended another bottle that was decent.  The server didn't seem to know much about wine.   But that's not necessarily a show stopper.
author: Kurt L.

description:
Walked in at 6 on Sunday evening and even though they had just been open for half an hour they were already getting full. We did get a nice table for two, and our waiter was super friendly. His service was fantastic. We both have the fixed price menu, I had the salad and the hubs had the soup. The salad was good, but that pumpkin soup was wonderful. Lucky for me we shared a bit. For entree he had the chicken and even though the menu said no substitutions the waiter agreed to do double green beans and no potatoes. The slightly crispy skin was just right, not like eating deep fried chicken by any means, just roasted to perfection. I had the bouillabaisse, which was amazing. Even more amazing is the fact that I kept it off my silk top, but that's just me. I expected the mussels to be the shining star of this dish, but the huge piece of sea bass hiding below the broth and other goodies was so delish, I might have to declare it the winner. I had a fantastic glass of wine (the malbec) and he had the amber ale. We passed on dessert in favor of grabbing a chocolate around the corner, but the flourless chocolate cake sure looked good! 

Overall this was a big win in our books. Not too fancy, but sure felt special. The perfect balance. Felt like you could be in a number of worldly cities, Paris, New York... but I was glad to know I was right near home, here in SF.
author: Melissa W.

description: Came here with my gf on NYE. We sat at the back patio which had a great ambiance. We ordered the spaghettini, the burger, and the steak. Everything was solid quality. we loved the pinot.
author: j d.

description: I like Isa a couple of doors down more, but I'd consider coming here again. The salads looked and tasted very light and refreshing. The calamari was good too. I was slightly envious of my friends' burgers when I saw them, however, my spaghettini was perfectly cooked and I really enjoyed it.
author: Tammy L.

description: I love this restaurant.  My husband and I have been frequenting Bistro Aix for many years.  We eat here at least once a month.  Love the ambience. Love the food. Great service too.
author: Nesta D.

description: Best meal and service my husband and I have experienced in San Francisco in years.  The decor and ambiance set the perfect back drop for a casual gourmet dining experience.  The wine list is both extensive and fabulous. The food....oh the food.  Words hardly do the experience justice.  A few highlights of our experience were the salad with fried goat cheese, the calamari (Best in the City!), and peach pie.  I hate to rave too much for fear of long wait lists in the future.  With that said we'd be in line anyway, it's worth the wait!
author: KC M.

description:
Last night I stopped by Bistro Aix for the first time since its renovation. It was like visiting an old friend who just had a face-lift; everything was the same, only better. The interior layout and dimensions are the same, but all upgraded materials and fixtures, giving it a bit more luxe feeling. 
I snagged my usual single seat at the counter and was waited on by the competent, capable, and rather good-looking bartender who was more-than-multi-tasking with food and drink orders as well as handling the door and a few other things. He allowed me to taste a couple of wines before deciding on the "right" one. My counter seat afforded me a great view into the compact but bustling kitchen, whence great food continues to come. 
As I was going to a movie nearby I opted for a lighter meal; the first course salmon on latkes over greens was a delight, followed by tagliatelle with lamb meatballs in a light but spicy tomato sauce and an unusual mint addition. 
I couldn't've asked for a tastier meal to send me off to the movies in comfort. Welcome back!!
author: Tom R.

description: Ok i know you wont believe this but..this place has the best hamburger i have had in SF! I dont want to know what is in it because i know its not good for you but...try it you'll like it! The other dishes are good..but try the burger you wont be sorry!
author: Not M.

description: We came here after a friend told us she knows the mother of the chef. We chose the prix fixe menu and the price was right. Oh and the food was good too.
author: Daisy C.

description: I had second thougths as I was about to add a review...I mean, do I really want more people to go there, so I have to wait longer? the answer is yes, because I won't mind waiting at the bar. This place is the perfect neighborhood spot: the staff has been there for a while and they are all very attentive, the food is excellent, and the patio is indeed lovely.  For some reason, large groups (ie 10+) like to take over half of the patio once in a while, so to avoid bad surprises, I always call ahead. And someone already menioned it, but they *do* have the best burger in town.
author: Frederic B.

description: This is my favorite neighborhood restaurant-great place to go for dinner on those rare, warm SF nights. Get a table on the rear patio. The smoked salmon appetizer is a must along with the seared ahi entree. The service is always fast but not always as friendly as I like. This can be overlooked as the food and ambience are great!
author: Joslyn D.

description: Our waitress, Kellie(?) was fantastic. The kind of enthusiastic professional who makes the experience more better. I asked her to select for me and she surprised me with:  Inherited tomatoes with Buffalo milk cheese dressed with just a spicy olive oil. perfect. salmon on a bed of brilliant green stinging nettle risotto. flawless. Quince tatin. exquisitely carmelized. And she picked 2 reasonable and appropriate wines though I think I would perform Corkage next time. The patio is a bit odd-it could use a refresh- but I was hoping to meet the rodents -I'm a fan.
author: K C.

description: One of our crews old trusties. Pizza is rockn, goat cheese salad is a goodie, Orecchiette has an awesome kick...and the burger...holy yes!  Sit in the patio section with the SF cityscape mural, while supa cool servers help you out.  A goodie in my book.
author: T L.

description: I've eaten here twice and both times it has been amazing!  Great atmosphere, great food and really nice staff.  Highly recomended!  The prices are also very reasonable for the quality of food and service.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: The Malbec was yummy. My new favorite vino! Excellent service!
author: Gwen D.

description: Amazing creme brulee. Wonderful, attentive service. Food was alright.
author: Bee H.

description: I really like this place.  The burger is excellent.  The waiters are nice. The atmosphere is great for a date or a casual dinner with friends. Sometimes there is a wait, but it's never been too bad.
author: Sarah S.

description: Best neighborhood restaurant! The food is delicious and the atmosphere fun. Great outdoor patio but we love to sit at the bar. You won't be disappointed at Bistro Aix. AND they have one of the best hamburgers in the city!
author: Michelle M.

description: I just thought the place was filthy. And even though the food was decent for French Bistro food, there were certain things I couldn't get past. The bathrooms were something you would expect in a dive bar, just disgusting. It doesn't help that four feet outside the bathroom door is the kitchen door. If it's open, you can see the chefs cooking your food. In fact, a cook had just walked out of the bathroom as I was walking in. And there he was sautee-ing away when I walked out. My group sat out back in the porch area. The kicker: rodents scurring about through-out our dinner..either big mice or small rats. Yuck.
author: Neile R.

description: Chris Hawkins hosted a party here.    The food was ok, but the crowd was fun.
author: Jim Z.

description: This place is solid.  Had dinner there tonight.  They were sold out of three of the entrees.  Nice wine by the glass menu.  The salad was good, very fresh - but consistent with other reviews, the flavors were sort of dull.  I had the chicken for my entree.  Slightly over cooked with a couple of smashed baby red potatoes and haricot verts.  The vegetables were cooked nicely - but no exceptional flavors.  Service at the bar was very good and attentive.
author: once u.

description: Favorite neighborhood restaurant in the Marina. The staff are extremely friendly and remember locals. The calamari, burger and orecchiette are my favorite dishes to order. Although it is a good thing that they prepare all of the food served the day of, they generally run out of popular dishes later in the evening.
author: Jessica W.

description: A gem of a restaurant. The food is outstanding yet very modestly priced ($19 prix fixe!). The atmosphere is terrific whether in the cozy restaurant or the garden out back. The menu is updated occasionally and never disappoints.
author: Patrick B.

description: This has a great patio/outdoor seating in the back of the restaurant.  However, I was dissapointed by the food as it did not strike me as amazing or out of the ordinary.  Its definitely a decent place to go to for some typical bistro food.
author: Charles C.

description: This place may be a touch overpriced for the food quality, but what it does have to offer is a really lively fun restaurant that consistently makes really good food, has a good wine list, good bartender, good staff, is in fact, good all around. But, whenever  I come here I have great time, so I have to give credit to somewhere that fosters good conversation and treats there customers very well. I definitely recommend Bistro Aix!
author: Steve l.

description: When I lived in the Marina a few years ago I ate here quite a lot. It was my fall back Restaurant if A16 was packed. I liked eating at the small tables on the sidewalk when the weather was nice. It's meant to be a French bistro, but it's more American with a slight French twist. All the food is simple and well cooked. I love the pasta with prawns . Nice freindly service as well. And some nice red Burgundies,mmmm my favorite wine. Big problem though, is they have some kind of trendy wine fridge that they keep the red wine in. I don't like my $80 bottle of red wine served cold. If you don't either, tell them to bring you a bottle up from the cellar, and not from the fridge. Apart from that, it's an OK place.
author: jeff b.

description: Excellent service.  Great ambiance. Fantastic bread.  Delicious salad with fava beans.  And ahi was very good.
author: Liz L.

description: Cute little spot with great food. We took my great friend here for our last dinner during her bachelorette weekend. We were a table of crazy ladies and our server looked like a cross between Captain Jack Sparrow and a Gloucester fisherman (rough, rugged and mysterious). The lady of honor has a habit of asking a billion questions about the food menu and the wine list. Captain Sparrow had no problems accommodating her or the rest of our picky pallets (as in does bouillabaisse mean it has in cream? because i am lactose intolerant. are you certain that it does not? so what does bouillabaisse mean?) . The food was delicious and Captain Sparrow made the meal better with his frequent flirts and his catering to our foolishness.
author: Melee T.

description: You walk into the front door and expect  the place to be small... you wait a min (this was on a Wed night) and you get taken to the back of the restaurant which opens up into a big room...great place...will go back there for sure...
author: Matt S.

description: The prix fixe is a really good dinner for the price. All three entree choices are delicious, but I would opt for the soup over the plain plain plain salad. They have an extensive wine list and very yummy desserts, too. The staff is super friendly. Make a reservation for the patio and enjoy the night air!
author: Katy O.

description: Let me preface this by saying I am not a huge fan of the Marina.  The people there are not really my style so I don't go alot.  But on this occasion I went to dinner with a friend who lives right there, and I can't tell you how smooth the experience was.  The waiter was very nice and quick, and the food was amazingly good.  The goat cheese salad is phenomenal!  Also, the orichietta with pancetta is well worth your time.  All-in-all a great experience.  We sat on the back patio and got there around 9pm, which I recommend to beat the rush.
author: Roman A.

description: Mediocre is the only word I can think of to describe our experience dining here. The butter lettuce salad was plain...the ahi tuna was overcooked and in a reduction sauce that should have been used for a meat dish...the grilled pork chop was lacking in flavor...and the creme brulee had a nice flavor but the top was over-torched taking away from the flavor and texture  underneath...the service was decent...in conclusion there are too many places to try in san francisco leaving this place off of our "return to dine" list.
author: Adam S.

description: Last night we happened upon Bistro Aix.  I don't usually dine in the Marina, but I'd go back to this spot.  It's a newly remodeled space and the owner did a fantastic job with the decor.  From the dark wood panels to the ceiling work to the light fixtures, he created a lovely, understated space that has great ambiance.  The beer and wine list is nice and the bartender was really friendly.  The menu is simple but very well done, with excellent ingredients sourced from local farms.  The burger, with egg and gruyere added, was excellent, as were the beef tongue, burratta and calamari appetizers.
author: Grace R.

description: My friend took me out here the other night for the first time for my birthday.  Though the fresh focaccia and green garlic soup were incredible, the bouillabaisse (tomato stew with halibut and shellfish) bordered on unsanitary.  Both muscles and clams were came unopened, a clear indication to anyone who knows about these things that they were probably bad.  Just screamed irresponsibility on everyone's part, from the manager, to chef, to the server.  When i politely mentioned it the server apologized, but didn't offer to replace the meal.  When the bill came, after waiting 20 minutes, nothing had been comped.  One of the most unprofessional, irresponsible meals i've had for the price.
author: ingrid b.

description: Sit at the bar and get to know the server behind the bar.  Great conversation about wine, travel and food.   The food is good, but the atmosphere is better.
author: Kristalle W.

description:
Bistro Aix was mediocre at best. The food was ok, the service was lacking but the atmosphere is nice.  So if you'd like to spend money for that, ok.  So i think in giving this place 3 stars I am being extremely generous.

We went there for a siblings birthday and were a large party and the second they found out our party was sans 2 people they seemed ready to get us out of there.  When we arrived with an RSVP our table was not reserved or ready. The menu online is deceiving because the prices they listed did not correspond to the prices actually indicated on the menu. Our food was alright, not sure if it was worth 22 dollars for my dish of mash potatoes and 5 slices of seared ahi tuna. We were seated outside which had a nice ambiance, however the waiters helping appeared to have better things to than get us water and bread. 

Overall a subpar experience.
author: SP L.

description: I love the ahi tuna here, the steak and fries are also bomb.  Well priced, one of the few places I can still get a reservation on Friday night with only a couple hours notice
author: Aimee J.

description:
I was very tempted to give this place a horrible review. Mostly because I don't want other people finding out about this gem. 

Great food. Good service. Reasonably priced. Can't beat that with a bat.
author: E F.

description: Very good spot to have a couple of drinks and share some small plates.  Friendly bartenders.  Great pizzas if you get there early enough and they still have some left (how can you "run out" of pizza?).
author: Ryan K.

description: Bistro Aix has been consistently great for the ten years I've been going.  Casual atmosphere, continental comfort food and good wine.  The service is always attentive and professional.  The prices are more than fair.  The back patio is the place to be -- it gets noisy inside the main room. Fantastic roast chicken, good pizzas and salads, and the best hamburger in San Francisco.  The smoked salmon appetizer makes me weak in the knees.  Not fancy, not hip, not trendy.  Just great.
author: Andrew L.

description: Simple, flavorful French cooking at its best.  Hadn't been in several years so was pleased to find it was just as good as I remembered, plus a very friendly staff.  Tried the crispy chicken breast on the $24 prix fixe menu which was perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor.  The haricots verts were delicious.  I couldn't help remembering the episode on Top Chef where everyone was rapturous over something as simple as peas, and eating these one could understand.  For dessert I indulged in the Chocolate Cloud cake, sure death by chocolate but what a way to go.
author: David T.

description: So Bistro AIX obviously know how to TAKE a reservation they just don't know what it means to actually HONOR a reservation.  Back story...I made a reservation for Saturday night for 7 people at 8:30.   They called me day of to confirm the time and the party size.  We show up at 8:30 and the "friendly hostess" tells me they are backed up and it will be an additional 30-45 minutes.  ARE YOU F'ING KIDDING ME?  If we eat any later they might as well bring out the breakfast menu.  I had a reservation and they even called me to confirm.  I felt like I was in a Seinfeld episode.  At first, we were fine with the "mix up" and went across the street to Izzy's for a drink.  For the hell of it, we asked Izzy's if they could accommodate a party of 7 and we sat down in 10 minutes.  If you want my opinion, forget Bistro AIX and go across the street to Izzy's...better food, better atmosphere and you get less of the stuffy Marina crowd.  Plus, what the hell kind of name is Bistro AIX anyway?  Does anyone really know how to pronounce it?  It's one of those names that some stuck up preppy, Marina a-hole makes you feel like an idiot for pronouncing wrong.
author: Greg C.

description: i love bistro aix!!  if you come, try to sit on the patio in the back, b/c the dining room is a bit cramped.  come early to take advantage of the prix fixe meals!  steak and frites plus soup/salad for $19 is unbeatable!
author: Helen T.

description: I'm not usually the planner (I'm usually the follower) when going out, but found myself organizing a small get together one Saturday evening and decided to check out Aix.  I didn't know what to expect, but was I pleasantly surprised!!  We didn't have reservations (again... I'm not a planner) and when we showed up we decided to eat at the bar.  I like eating at bar tables cause it let's you interact with the meal and what's going on behind the scenes.  All of our food was amazing!! Not too pretentious.... Cause I hate pretentious!
