I had crispy roasted chicken and I had to make the waiter take away the dish cause I couldn't stop after I was full.  We also had Ahi Tuna, Lamb steak, and a hamburger.  What can I say about the Creme Brulee??? Holy crap it was awesome!  Probably the best I have ever had!  Oh, and I always get steak frites... I can't help myself... it's my one weakness.  Actually, anything French is my weakness!
author: Alli F.

description: Bistro Aix is a neighborhood gem.  It is a cozy restaurant, but it is great for dinner out with friends or a date.  They are closed for a renovation, and I am excited for them to re-open soon.  I am particularly fond of the ahi tuna.  They used to serve a great lamb steak, but discontinued it recently.  They also have a great steak and a solid chicken dish.  Also notable is the wine selection.
author: Steve C.

description: After eating here, in texting a friend, i described the restaurant as mediocre. and that's what it was... for the price, it should have been better. the restaurant itself is cute. there's a nice sort of outdoor patio, warmed by heat lamps. i wasnt cold at all, and i get cold even at inside restaurants. there were no plates for the bread, and the oil they gave us with it tasted meh. b and j had the onion soup, which wasn't thick, and not covered in cheese. j said it tasted like something he could have made himself. i had the beet salad with spinach and goat cheese and it was the best part of the meal. yummy.  all 3 of us had the steak for dinner. the medium rare was just medium. it was good but not very good. not special at all. it came with mixed greens and fries. the fries were pretty good, not special either. b substituted his for red potatoes which were just ok.  for dessert we shared the special, which was peach pie. i think we should have had the berries the people at the next table had. the peach pie wasn't bad, it was ok. so everything at the meal, except for my salad, was just ok. and this came out to $100 for 3 people (and we didn't order wine). we went to the bistro to save $ from a regular french restaurant, but regretted it later. should have just gone to a more expensive nice restaurant because we paid almost the same amount but for meh food, which is worse.  j esp (who picked it out from yelp) was kicking himself for going to such a boring place restaurant. he disliked the food the most. so, its not a bad place, just not a really great place.  cute and all, and nice enough service. only one bathroom for everyone in the restaurant tho. anyways,  i don't think we'll be back.
author: Merredith L.

description:
came here with a large party one monday night, and the front looks exactly like the pic on the website. but you could also just google street view and see what it looks like through your eyes instead of some artist.

shoestring fries were totally thin, im not a shoestring guy, id rather eat potato chips - in particular those salt and pepper kettle chip ones

the scallops were amazing, as were the little gnocchi dumplings.

you MUST get both if you come here. we also had top sirloin which was nothing special, rather plain steak if you ask me.

i had another entree but forgot what it was so sorry. i did have the chocolate cloud cake, which i think is just ok. (i bake a lot) 

prices are reasonable for french and the server was very nice. after dinner, there is a nice wine tasting place right next door which we went to, if youre in the mood.

menu is truncated on their website. fyi, more choices at the restaurant. and i was disappointed that they did not let us have prix fixe because we were greater than 4 people i think....

i think i will try another french restaurant next time since my tongue is still inexperienced in these rather treacherous realms of french cuisine.
author: Porkers T.

description: I had my rehearsal dinner here in May for about 40 people on their heated patio and it could not have been better. The space was perfect (intimate but relaxed); the food was fantastic (even better than when we had similar things at the regular restaurant); and the service was incredibly good. They were attentive to all of our needs and all of our guests remarked about what a huge success the whole event was. I would highly recommend it if you are looking for a rehearsal dinner location.
author: Hannah O.

description: I've heard from numerous people Bisto Aix' burger is the best in town. I don't know about best in town but it's pretty damn good. I came here solely for the burger and was not disappointed. A top sirloin burger cooked to order smothered with gorgonzola cheese, and red onions....a greasy piece of heaven. The rest of the menu sounds good but I have yet to try. The kitchen is in the middle of the restaurant surrounded by a bar and the aroma of seared butter will tantilize your nose hairs and leave you in a state of pure bliss. Anything cooked/marinated in butter has gotta be GWOOD! Mad props for the french and  their culinary contribution to the world...that and can can girls....yay strippers!
author: Roger T.

description: Very tasty, reasonably affordable.  $20 prix fixe option Sun-Thursday.  Lots of wine available by the glass.  Ask to eat on the patio, as the interior of the restaurant is rather noisy.
author: Josh B.

description: Maybe they were having an off night or something, but the pancetta pasta dish I ate was the saltiest thing I've put in mouth since I tasted my own nuts after a 5 mile run...seriously.....I am a foodie and I wasn't able to finish this dish, which rarely happens. Other folks I know swear by this place, but I will have to say NO to Bistro AIX
author: Anon Y.

description: nice atmosphere, very romantic.  would be awesome to sit in back porch on sunny afternoon or warm evening.  server was attentive and comp'ed two of our orders because of service errors, which i thought was really considerate. food was good, especially for the price but it wasn't amazing. highly recommend the creme brulee. overall an extremely pleasant experience! would definitely recommend others to try it out!
author: Felicia H.

description: If you can stand the wait, the food is excellent!  I haven't eaten in their outside patio, but I hear it's really cute at night.  Atmosphere is cozy (another word for "packed") but great for a small group of friends - I recommend the ahi tuna.
author: Kylene S.

description: yummy!! they had a good menu, good prices, and good drinks. only bummer was that they only had wine and beer. not enough booze to get sufficiently drunk before a nite out in the marina. i had the fish and it was delicious. everyone in our party loved their meal. some people even had the hamburger. i would go back
author: Jessica B.

description: I can't say enough about this place! The burgers and fries are to die for and the tuna over mash is amazing!! Not to mention their wine selection, great service, and a friendly smile when I come in (perhaps I come in too much!)
author: Michelle D.

description: Went on a Friday night. It was pretty crowded. We called for same-day reservations and they were able to squeeze us in. I like the lay out of the restaurant. In the front, it looked a little more formal, fancy tables cloths and nice chairs. In the back patio area, it was a whole different place. Luckily they had a table for us in the patio so we sat on metal chairs with a cool out-doorsy feel to it. Christmas lights hung around and gave the room a casual feel. Our server was so nice and friendly...actually all the staff members we encountered were friendly! We ordered a side of fries and spinach with garlic. yum! I got the spaghetti, mom got the pizza, and sis got the sirloin steak. All the dishes were very tasty. On to the dessert...  I got the chocolate cloud cake and my sister got the peach pie! oh snap were they amazing. All in all, a very filling and delicious meal! I have to come back to this restaurant soon. I also love the location. Great little stores and a lot of other restaurants in the area. Parking can be hard (and appear non-existent) but if you circle the block over and over, you might be able to find a spot!
author: Christiana R.

description: Bistro Aix is the best restaurant the Marina has got to offer. Most of the other restaurants in the Marina chiefly serve bar food. Another reason Bistro Aix is 4-star worthy is its reasonable prices (they offer a prix fix menu as well). I heart their ahi tuna, pizza and bread. Good prices, good location (although parking is a biatch since there is no valet) and good food. Be sure to request a table on the outside heated patio! Great casual dinner place with friends!
author: Mama L.

description: the food, while good, didn't blow me away in terms of creativity, but the prices are reasonable so it's a solid place to come.  i love that it is quiet enough to have long conversations and not even be aware of anything around you.  definitely a place you can go to for a simple meal without worrying about it being too much of a scene.
author: Nana S.

description: i was here for a private event put on by Sarah R. and Gina L. and was very impressed by the service and the very reasonable prices!  i had the duck confit appetizer, the steak frites for the main course, and the chocolate cake for dessert, and all of it was excellent.  sancerre is one of my favorite wines and they had it on the menu as well, so i was very pleased.  i would definitely recommend this place for another private event!  i'm looking forward to going back sometime just to have a regular meal - the service and the food are definitely worth returning for!
author: Caroline P.

description: We were visiting San Fran and got the recommendation to go here by a local who raved about it.  We called on Valentine's Day for that night and we were able to get in.  We sat on the outdoor patio and it was fabulous.  Very comfortable knowing it was a rainy, cold night outside.  My boyfriend and I split the crab cakes, and then I got the chicken and he got the steak. Our original intent was to split but we both loved our meals so much we didn't want to in the end!  As great as the food was, the service was even better.  Our waiter was one of the best we've ever had and he gave us excellent food recommendations and wine pairing.  We had such a great night, and if we ever take the trip from Chicago to San Fran again...we will definitely come back!
author: Samantha K.

description: 100 stars for the amazing bread, which they supposedly make themselves.  The menu isn't anything special, but the pizza and the tuna are good.  Decent wine list, but no hard liquor.  Like any slightly overpriced restaurant in the Marina, it gets pretty busy later at night.
author: Ian C.

description: Very good restaurant.  Have eaten there many times.  Went last night and had their hamburger on Foccacia with Gorgonzola.  Outstanding burger.  Cooked perfect, great flavor, generous portion.  Have eaten their Grilled Lamb Steak, chicken, and pasta/all very good.  Service could have been a little better but overall very good. I will be back.
author: Wayne E.

description: Party of six; they didn't miss a beat.  Gave us our exact reservation request.  Pushed tables together to make it work.  Every dish was spot on.  Let's see, we ordered the escarole and potato soup which we passed around; everyone had a spoonful.  Multiple salads, including the chicory/radicchio caesar, the pear/arugula, and the mesclun with goat cheese, were all fresh and perfectly dressed.  The marguerita pizza, the fontina cheeseburger, the hanger steak, the bouillabaisse all marvelous.  My husband was served the ahi tuna by mistake, but he ate it anyway because it was so good!  And finally, the best for last.  The gnocchi with spring peas and chanterelle mushrooms, just like the soup, was passed around for everyone to try.  Tarte tatin and chocolate cake-yum!  Warm bustling atmosphere of a well-loved neighborhood haunt with perfect food.  And that parking spot half a block away on Chestnut St. was the good omen for the evening.  For all you Marinites, it was 25 minutes door-to-door including parking from Larkspur!
author: Alison K.

description: Thanks to previous Yelpers, we avoided sitting on the patio (I have an aversion to rodents) and the table next to the front door. We were seated quickly and the service was very good. We both had excellent glasses of French wine. The food was above average and well priced. We will go back if we are in the neighborhood.
author: One tough customer M.

description: Very good food and it's reasonably priced. Try to make a reso but the wait is never more than a half hour. Great bread.
author: tracey m.

description: one of my fav in the city to take myself n friends for dinner..great food great vibe..but one thing that strikes out is their very limited n awful dessert menu...would love to spend more money  if the dessert menu was better n more appetizing..otherwise great spot..would have given 4stars if the dessert complemets the rest of menu...
author: kat r.

description: First of all, sit in the back.  Secondly, try the seared ahi or the roasted chicken.  And the warmed goat cheese over butter lettuce is amazing.  The wine list is great and Stephen has always been very engaging and friendly.  This place has consistently stood the test of time.
author: Brian L.

description: Great place to dine with tasty specials and a warm cozy atmosphere; very collegial and active crowd but not so noisy you can't hear yourself talk.  Solid wine list.  Great desserts.  Grilled Lamb Steak with Rosemary Jus & grilled Rare Ahi Tuna was done to a turn.  Service was just right especially on such a busy Friday night.  Have a reservation or get there around 6:00pm if you don't want to sit at the bar or in the back patio.
author: Tom C.

description: Delicious from start to finish, everything was really quite good.  We shared all our dishes and so they placed the plates in the middle of the table and gave us small plates to eat off of which was very nice.  The portions were quite big too and made it easy to share. In fact there was so much food we did not finish everything.  For appetizers we started with an Heriloom tomato and mozzerella di buffula salad that was basic but flavorful with purple & red tomatoes.  We also had salmon with creme fraiche and crunchy potatoes that was very unique and quite good.  Lots of flavors melded together and the crunch of the potatoes strings was a nice contrast to the dish .  Our main courses were gnocchi with sage butter, fava beans and pancetta,  a nice medely of flavors and also herb encrusted lamb chops cooked perfectly with crunchy artichokes and potatoes placed underneath the lamb and topped by a very tasy sauce.  For dessert we had the chocolate dream cake topped with Tahitian Vanilla ice cream it was very very rich.  We brought our own bottle of Bourdeaux and the corkage was $18.  Very good food and service.  We sat in front and so people waiting for tables were standing close to our table which I did not like.  When I go back I will try to sit in the back patio which had a nicer atmosphere than inside
author: Melanie -.

description: Went hear last night after trying A16 - 45 minute wait for a table of two, then Mamacita 45 minute wait, Thirsty Pig packed to the gills so went to Bistro Aix. It had been years since I had been there it was busy and lively but not packed. We were starving and saw the cracker crust pizza when we walked in so ordered up the basic one with tomato, mozzarella, fontina and parm. Nice light with good subtle flavors, great to munch on while we perused the menu. I got the Special Pork Chop with Apricot glaze. It was perfectly cooked, nice crispy sear on the outside, tender and juicy inside. The potatoes and greens were ok but it was definitely the meat that starred. My friend had the the steak with fries and said it was great. We matched it with a reasonable priced Priorat that went perfect with our food. Our server, wish I knew her name, was attentive and fun to banter with. All in all a good experience, I should go there more often.
author: Brad G.

description: i loove the candles and the dim-lit-ness. i wish i had sat in the back patio, though. i just didnt like how i was so close to the other tables eeeek. but the waiter was great. i think his name was matt? each table had a bottle of water (a wine bottle filled with water that we pour into our own glasses) ... and we kept getting refills on the bread! hahahha i know it doesnt sound much, but the bread was GOOD. OH and i must mention the THIN CRUST PIZZA. it was amaaazing. we ordered the pizza on the special menu - it had bacon and spinach. oh my god. (and i actually dont even eat pork). we also ordered the grilled local sea bass and the crispy chicken breast (sorry im forgetting the proper name). the chicken wasnt that great... i wish i had ordered more appetizers (they ran out of duck confit when i went). three people came out to $70 (including tips) so its really not bad for good french food in the marina. yaaaay. im coming back!
author: Judy L.
